address: Avenida Infante Dom Henrique Posto de Turismo, Ponta Delgada, Sao Miguel 9500-770 Portugal
description:
Hungry Whales create cultural and food tours, providing fun and unique ways to experience the character of the Azores islands. 
Expect delicious food&drinks, amazing stories and recommendations, making sure you get a real taste of the local culture, gastronomy and nightlife - for whale-ton of special memories!
We lead small-group tours crafted with a personal touch and private tailor-made tours.
name: Hungry Whales Cultural and Food Tours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Small-Group Ponta Delgada Food Tour in Azores
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Cheese & Wine Tasting in Ponta Delgada
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Wine & Food Evening Walking Tour in Ponta Delgada
offer_group/offer_list/3/title: Sunday Food Tour and Volcanic Dining Experience in Ponta Delgada
reviews/0/text: Diogo was a fun, friendly, and professional guide. We learned a little bit about a lot of things: history, politics, culture, influences, architecture, and, of course, food! It was an enjoyable way to spend several hours, exploring a new city hearing stories.
reviews/0/title: Eat, Walk, Learn about the Azores
reviews/1/text: Rafael is amazing guide, the tour was absolutely fantastic!!! Recommendations 100%! The food was delicious! Go Hungry whales !
reviews/2/text: Such a great tour! Highly recommend when visiting Ponta Delgada. We learned so much about the history of the Azores through food and walking around the city. Everyone we met could not have been nicer! Thank you Hungry Whales.
reviews/3/text: I'm sorry to the tour guides, but though I wrote their names down, I can't find notes. Diogo and Patricia is in the ballpark, but I'm sure I am butchering their names. Anyway, they gave us a really nice tour. The food and wine were excellent, and they were knowledgeable and informative of the city, island and culture. Book this tour early in your stay, as it will give you lots of ideas for locations and food/wine you will want to try/revisit while you're there
reviews/3/title: Ponta Delgada Food and Wine tour
reviews/4/text: Duigo did a fantastic job introducing us to the city and many different foods! I would highly recommend taking the tour the first or second day you were on the island!
reviews/5/text: OMG! Rafael was an incredible guide. All of our stops were filled with interesting history not to mention the food and the drinks! Strangely enough Nelly Furtado came up twice organically during the tour. I would highly recommend this tour!
reviews/6/text: An amazing food tour, with lots of wonderful tastings! I felt like a local on a daily basis, having the traditional meals. Definitely to try again :)
reviews/7/text: Rafael gave us a nice tour with historical highlights and good food. The tastings were very typical and very filling. Would recommend!
reviews/8/text: Diogo was articulate as to the history of the Azores as well as Sao Miguel and delivered the history in an interesting manner entertaining us from location to location imparting the culture and events with humor! We enjoyed the tour immensely!
reviews/8/title: Excellent humor and history with delicious tastes of the Azores!
reviews/9/text: Delicious. I love learning about the history, the food, and the social economic challenges of the people there.
reviews/10/text: The food was amazing but the opportunity to learn about Azorian culture was extraordinary. Rafael was very friendly, funny and knowledgeable. The walking tour showed us things we would never have found on our own. Highly recommend this tour.
reviews/11/text:
Diogo and Patricia were both wonderful! Very informative, kind, and informational!
We very much enjoyed our experience with them on the wine and food tour, thank you!
reviews/12/text: I did this on my first day while waiting to check in to my hotel. Diego and Patricia were except guides. Fun and engaging. Joined a nice small group of people and walked around the city trying Azorean food and learning about the Azores. A really unique way to take a tour. Highly recommend.
reviews/12/title: Fun way to explore Ponta Delgada
reviews/13/text: Diego was awesome, with fun facts and amazing food. On this tour I had the best tea and chorizo (flaming) I've ever had. Involves a bit of walking but you need to after all the food. Portions were much larger then anticipated. I Highly recommend this tour.
reviews/14/text:
Small group - only two of us 
The guide Diogo did a got job explaining local food and even a lot of information about Ponta Delgada.
Didn‘t leave hungry!!
reviews/15/text:
We took the Ponta Delgada food guide and tour this past week. We can't speak highly enough about our guide, Michael de Rosa, who's knowledge and passion for his adopted city was apparent at evert moment. We owe to him one particular recommendation; the extraordinary Restaurant Magna, at the Hotel Senhora De Rosa. 
Our one quibble with the experience is the the food at each of the stops was not exceptional. Good, satisfying, filling, but not memorable. 
Our sense was that the restaurants were excellent, but they didn't serve their best to the tour group at any of the stops along the way. 
One note of appreciation to Michael- he made especial mention of the one and only synagogue in Ponta Delgada, the oldest such in the Azores, now a museum only of the fascinating story of the Jewish presence there and on the mainland.
We highly recommend a visit to all with an interest in Portuguese /European history and Jewish history.
reviews/15/title: Wonderful guide, good but not great food selections
reviews/16/text: Fun tour.  Good amount of walking.  Good food.  Good sights.  Nice lunch meal.  Good tour.  Please stop asking me to say more.
reviews/17/text: We had a great time on this tour, experiencing a number of great restaurants and foods. There was even one stop for tea. It was a rainy day and the tour guide might have been a bit more sensitive to the weather, as at one point he continued to share interesting stories and info in the rain rather than taking us to our next spot indoors. Regardless, the variety of foods and locales were fabulous. Who ever thought I would find I loved small fried mackerel!  The final stop included the most amazing dessert. A fun way to get a taste of the Azores and some history along the way.
reviews/18/text: This was a perfect tour around the area and we learned a lot about the history of the city. Our guide was fantastic and we had an amazing time!
reviews/19/text: Loved it. Learned a great deal and tried some new foods. Desert was fantastic! Highly recommended and would do it again.

address: Terceira 9760 Portugal
description: Do not worry about finding the best sites on Terceira Island. Explore the island with Azor-In at your pace, comfortable and carefree.
name: Azor-In
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Private Terceira Island Full Day Tour
photo/caption: Explore the island with Azor-In at your pace, comfortable and carefree.
reviews/0/text: Amazing Antonio showed  us around his island as if we were royalty. This  is  one of the best tours we have been on and we travel all over the world. We flew to Terceira in the morning and flew out that evening. We were picked up promptly and returned to the airport with perfect timing. Antonio has vast knowledge about many aspects of Terceira and Portuguese culture, economics, politics, history, flora, fauna and other things that held our interest.
reviews/1/text: We did a half day tour with Mario Mendes and we have been delighted with the tour and his work as a guide. He managed to fit the tour to the weather (since it was rainy and foggy in the mountains) and he gave us great explainations about everything. We'd definetely recommend this tour and this guide!
reviews/2/text: Antonio was very knowledgeable about the island and he took his time showing us key places around that you never would find on your own.  we actually broke our tour into two days to maximize and absorb what we were seeing.  Antonio thanks again.
reviews/3/text: The best way hands down to learn about this amazing island is to book the full day tour with Antonio. He is so knowledgeable and professional.  It only took until lunch time, to realize that we wanted to extend our time with him, so we scheduled 2 more days of tours that he customized listening to our interests.  Bonuses: photography tips that he shares along the way, his fantastic stories, the company van is comfortable and luxurious, lunch at local places, many recommendations.  We feel like we made a true friend on the island.  I highly recommend any tour with Antonio.
reviews/3/title: A Perfect Tour with a Wonderful Tour Guide - Antonio!
reviews/4/text: Antonio took us in his comfortable van for the whole day, showing us almost the whole island.  He changed the tour a little due to our request (right on the spot).  He has an immense amount of knowledge about everything - farming, history, plants, geology, etc. etc.  He stayed in touch with us after the tour to answer questions we had during the rest of our stay.  Great resource.  Very highly recommend!
reviews/4/title: We hired the owner, Antonio, to take us on an all-day tour of Terceira.  He was great, knowledgable, accommodating!
reviews/5/text: Antonio was terrific.  So kind and generous with his time and knowledge of his native island.  He is patient and speaks English beautifully.  Great Mercedes can.  Clean and spacious and comfortable.  Can’t say enough good things about our day today.  We were truly blown away.
reviews/5/title: Outstanding first class tour guide on beautiful island!
reviews/6/text: Antonio was very informative and took us to see the entire island in a beautiful new van. We visited all the main sites on our first day with him. We then visited beaches and towns solo the remaining days of our trip. I would highly recommend the full day tour with Antonio. Teceira is beyond beautiful.
reviews/7/text: If I could I would give António 10 stars, he's 100% the best tour guide in Terceira! He is extremely knowledgeable and loves his island which shows in his approach to organising trips. He has tons of interesting information and makes the tour fun too - it was both informative and entertaining. Brand new car and top-notch customer service; António cares about the people more than anything else. Flexible personalised route, excellent picture-taking tips, best places to eat. He is also very respectful towards the environment and Terceira's people, and supports local business. On a personal level António is an extremely kind, intelligent and friendly person, and a brilliant conversation partner with a great sense of humour. The entire day of adventures with António made me fall in love with the island and I feel like I will always have a friend in Terceira. Not to be missed, a truly unforgettable experience!
reviews/8/text: I spent two full days touring with Antonio. He was punctual, helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. His van is modern, very clean and comfortable, and Antonio is a very safe, considerate driver. He made a point of asking carefully what I wanted, and he observed me closely so he could adjust the pace to meet my needs. We did a combination of some standard tourist stops (it was my first time on Terceira) and more interesting locations tailored to my interest in photography. He told me he often covers the island in a single day, but I was glad to have two full days with him. He ensured that everything went smoothly and that I had a full and enjoyable time. I recommend him very highly.
reviews/9/text: I decided to book a tour last minute after having trouble navigating the island myself.  Antonio was so accommodating, provided a prompt response and picked me up the next day on time at my hotel.  I was traveling solo, which some tours did not accommodate, which was a huge relief!  The day was so relaxing, fun and I got to see sites that I would not have found on my own.  Antonio is an excellent guide and great company as well!  He also takes killer pictures of his clients if you're into that.  :)
reviews/9/title: Wonderful, tailored experience... great way to see the island!
reviews/10/text: This is an excellent tour that I highly recommend.  Our tour guide, Antonio, went above and beyond to make this private tour memorable for us.  We had toured Terceira before so Antonio took us to different places we had not seen before.  Antonio speaks excellent English, is very personable and extremely knowledgeable about Terceira, Azores, and Portugal. The van was very clean and comfortable. Avoid the big bus tour. See more in comfort and take a tour with Antonio with Azor-in.  You will not be disappointed!!
reviews/11/text: Antonio with Azor-In went above and beyond for a full day tour I helped plan for my daughter and her now fiancé. He took them both on a full day tour, but also helped plan an absolutely perfect and amazing proposal at Algar do Carvão. He stayed in touch through email for several months leading up to the tour. He even helped hire a photographer to capture the whole event. He arrived at their hotel promptly at the time discussed. He provided a great tour, full of interesting history, and memories that will last a lifetime. I can not recommend Azor-In enough. The tour was individualized and an amazing value for the money. The day was perfect and the proposal was set-up flawlessly with Antonio’s help.
reviews/12/text:
Antonio is the best guide you could find: kind, punctual and accommodating. He'll ride you to discover the stunning and silent beauty of Terceira. He's truly passioned about his job and the island, it was like visiting a friend's hometown. Lunch was tasty and traditional

Thank you Antonio!
reviews/13/text: We spent a great day with Antonio and enjoyed every minute.  Antonio is a great, knowledgeable guide and a pleasure to ride with.  We highly recommend this tour!
reviews/14/text:
Antonio is a brilliant asset to Terceira, and his knowledge, humour, insights make him a must-do for any tourist group.
He totally tuned in to our needs, exceeding every expectation. Always being intuitively sensitive to adapting the tour as we travelled to meet our needs.
With Antonio and his first class Mercedes van we toured half of the island, visited the volcanic caves and the cheese factory.
reviews/15/text:
Exceptional! Antonio made our visit, tours and activities even more enjoyable. We appreciate his professionalism, knowledge, caring and warm friendship. He and Diogo were enjoyable to be with and we felt that they quickly became part of our family. They were always punctual and the vans are top of the line. 
Very highly recommend!
reviews/16/text:
Azor-In provided a great experience!  Antonio is outstanding -- passionate about Terceira, knowledgable, articulate, friendly and a pleasure to spend the day with.  It felt like we were spending the day with a friend.  

The van is a nice ride and very comfortable.  

I will not hesitate to use Azor-In during my next trip to Terceira.
reviews/17/text: Great tours, friendly and professional drivers. António and Diogo were wonderful to my family during our stay on Terceira. They were able to accommodate our requests and went above and beyond when a medical emergency arose with one of our travelers.  Highly recommend!
reviews/18/text: My family and I had decided that we needed a tour of Terciera and was recommended this tour group. We didn’t look up anything about it, so we had no idea what to expect. All I can say is that it is amazing. Our tour guide, Antonio, took us to an array of different sites, from a military base to the countryside to a beautiful rock-swimming area in Praia de Vicoria. My favorite parts were the volcano-made cave and even a real volacano itself!! Absolutely loved this group and the guide, and I would recommend to anyone looking for a little exploration and a lot of fun!
reviews/19/text: What wonderful experiences! I arrived in Terceira with my family and with few expectations. Anyway, I tried to know a little more about the island and found advertising from Azor-In. Curious, we contacted Antonio and he seduced us to do a Full Day Tour. What a fantastic decision. Antonio and his unbelievable van (our kids were amazed, and so were we!) Took us on a beautiful walk around the island where we got to know all the secrets of the places. Antonio exceeded expectations and it was an experience we all love. He gave us a history lesson. We are all amazed and eager to return. We advise lunch with him so he can tell the secrets of gastronomy of Terceira. The next day we made the walking trail of the Mistérios Negros and it's impossible to not be in love with the island. Such beautiful landscapes... Azor-In provided us the best experience we had in the Azores, ever.
reviews/19/title: The best way to meet the island
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Azor-In tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Terceira Portugal
description: Terceira island with 4 million years, is one of the nine volcanic islands in Azores and belong to Central group, with 400,3Km´2, elevation 1021M and Population 56000. What this island has to offer… amanzing landscapes, very rich in culture and traditions, great food and the people it`s very friendly. About us... We are a family business, Marisa and Juca. Marisa organize the tours (bookings) and Juca do the tours. We provide several private expeditions tours in Terceira island. You can choose one more tours we provide, or you can costumised the tours the way you want. Talk with us..! We expect to see you soon! Huge hug from Azores Marisa & Juca Azores Expeditions
name: Azores Expeditions
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: LANDSCAPE HIGHLIGHTS (Full Day Private Tour)
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: UNDERGROUND TOUR (Full Day Private Tour)
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: ARCHEOLOGY TOUR (Full Day Private Tour)

reviews/0/text: My husband and I absolutely loved our time on this excursion. Juca took us to all the best spots on the island, took great photos of us, and allowed us to experience unique spots (hidden gems) in addition to all the main sites. Juca was very friendly and fun to spend the day with, and his wife Marisa was great to communicate with every step of the way. We also had lunch at a great local spot. We would strongly recommend this to anyone coming to Terceira, especially if it is your first time visiting the islan
reviews/1/text: My husband and I were so lucky to get to spend the day with Juca, where he showed us his beautiful island.  We were blown away with the beauty of the island, and had so much fun exploring it all.  We were filled with a day of wonder and amazement.  We got to experience so much of the island, its food, and sights.  And Juca--what a great guy.  So fun and knowledgeable, and a master of photography.  Juca, you made your island so memorable.  We will never forget you and this place.  Thank you for what you do, it was unbelievable.
reviews/2/text:
We booked 2,5 days with Juca from AzoresExperience. It was our first time in Terceira and we saw the island in a way very few do!
Juca knows the best spots and will show you the island in a way that nobody else can do.
He has an amazing eye for photography, so we got some spectacular shots of ourselves that will feed our online presence in a unique way.
On top of all this, he is super fun and time just flies by!
Thank you so much! 
Andreia
reviews/2/title: The Best Guide you can find in Terceira!
reviews/3/text:
No need to waste any more time. This is the tour company to book! 

My husband and I travel extensively and have done dozens of memorable tours, mostly private, but none come close to our experience yesterday with Juca & Marisa at Azores Expeditions. They were responsive to our inquiries and questions before booking. They made their schedule work for us then spent the entire day not just showing us all the amazing places but also educating us on fun facts and history.

Marisa, born and raised on Terceira, is the most knowledgeable about the island. And Juca, Photography is his passion. He captured some incredible photos and videos of us, even took time to teach us how to use our phones and editing tools to create next level images ourselves. It felt so refreshing to spend over 8 hours hitting up sooo many destinations with someone who maintained high energy and kept us entertained and upbeat the entire time.

Whether you're a solo traveler, family or group, you won't go wrong choosing Azores Expeditions to show you and teach you about the best Terceira has to offer. And you must definitely will get your money's worth. Just tell them what you're interested in and they'll create the most memorable experience for you. Here are pics from my phone of just a few of the spots we visited.
reviews/4/text:
As a solo traveler, I had a hard time finding a company to book tours with. I am so glad that I found Azores Expeditions! They are fantastic for private tours for solo travelers and small groups! 

Juca is an amazing tour guide and photographer - you will come away from these tours with incredible memories and photos! Juca is very knowledgeable about the island, so he knows the best places to take you based on your interests and physical abilities. Juca will make sure that you see the big highlights and he will also take you to less well-known, amazing locations!

Juca and his wife Marisa are incredible people! Don't hesitate to ask them questions - they genuinely want you to have the best experience possible and they love sharing their knowledge and passion for Terceira. 

I highly recommend Azores Expeditions!
reviews/4/title: Incredible - Archaeology, Underground, Hiking, and Highlights!
reviews/5/text: It's easy to see why Trilhas is recommended by the locals, and Juca should be a national treasure! Reservations and communication with Marisa was so easy and prompt. Of all the tours I've been on, Juca's was by far the best tour I've ever had. I enjoyed 3 days of the customized experience. Terceira is prone to inclement weather, and he was able to optimize our activities based on current conditions. Juca is a kind, smart, knowledgeable, considerate and fun travel buddy.  I booked my trip to Azores on a whim, after being burned out by work and life, and didn't have enough brain cells to plan in advance. I gave Juca full rein to plan my days, and he made my trip truly unforgettable.  Waterfalls, sunrises, private cave tours, swimming holes, hikes, delicious food, church tours...my days were packed with beautiful views, cultural history, natural history, adventure, and laughing my butt off at his humor. His photography skills alone are worth the tour price--Juca is definitely an OG here and have inspired many others (tip: if you want some beautiful photos, wear clothes in solid, bright colors - blue, yellow, red, etc).  I could have easily booked a full week and still have so much more to do, but 3 days was plenty of time to enjoy a taste of Terceira without feeling too rushed or overwhelmed.  Thanks, Juca and Marisa for welcoming me to and sharing your beautiful island with me! I had the best time ever, and I can't wait to be back!
reviews/6/text:
I spent 1,5 days with Juca exploring the highlights of Terceira (hiking, nature, viewpoints, caves, volcano, natural pools...). It was an amazing experience, one of the best trips i ever had.
His wife Marisa made the organisation and booking and was very friendly and welcoming. Juca himself knows a lot about the island and is a great photographer. He is experienced, sensitive to the interests of his clients and honestly interested in offering you an experience you enjoy. The day was long for an absolutely fair price!
reviews/7/text: This was by FAR the absolute BEST tour I have EVER been on, period!  It's just kept getting better and better every stop we made. The photographer was AMAZING the way he used his creativity to capture each moment. Some photo's we had to wait for the cloud to pass through the sun so the lighting would be PERFECT and he was extremely detailed with each photo. I highly recommend this all and every tour, you will NOT regret it. This is the BEST way to see the island!
reviews/8/text:
I absolutely loved this company. The staff were so completely charming snd as for the Island of Terceira, it is FABULOUS. 

Really nothing was too much trouble for this wonderful company. I am coming back next year!
reviews/9/text:
Customer service was remarkable! Juca and Marisa answered all my questions and provided so so many ideas for an amazing photoshoot. The photo session was super easy to schedule and it was truly a great experience for me. They are very professional, very personable and very patient - a great combìnation when doing a photoshoot. I specially appreciate pre-session discussions, poses and choice of background which they did an amazing job at. Photo quality - AMAZING! The photos look natural and most importantly they capture stunning views not just facial and body features. I got my photos back very quickly! I am so glad i made the trip and i HIGHLY RECOMMEND him and his amazing work.

Beatriz Martins
reviews/10/text:
I returned to Terceira island and i wanted to try another tour with another company, well that was my big mistake! 

I ended up doing it again with Juca and of course it was unforgettable. It may be a little more expensive compared to other companies, but I tell you, it's worth every single euro.

We can see how much Juca loves his work and his island. It was a great privilege again to take a tour with him, because he knows a lot of things about the island. Photography, geology, archaeology and culture, it's a master.

Of course, all this has been possible also thanks to Marisa a very sweet and professional organization.

A great thank you to both of you and i promise to come back and do more adventures with you.
reviews/11/text:
I was travelling alone and wanted a guide to show me Trilho dos mistérios negros (top of my bucket list), contacted the company and got a reply from Marisa on the same day, she is prompt and provides good advice eg bring extra set of clothes, because weather forecast says it will rain. 

Juca is punctual, we started with the hike (highly recommended) then moved on to Duck’s Lake and I thought the trip was coming to an end after a late lunch at Caneta, but we went on to see Biscoitos Natural Pool. Juca was kind enough to speak with one of the vendors to keep an eye on my belongings when I come by the next day for a swim. Then we went Alvar do carvão, Furnas do Enxofre and ended the trip at black forest. It was certainly a full day trip.

Showed the photos taken by Juca to my friends and family, everyone agrees that the photos are well taken :). There is a minimum charge for 2 person but based on the amount of time spent, photos and effort from Juca and Marisa, it is well worth the price and I will gladly do the tour with them again.
reviews/12/text:
We are so fortunate to have had the opportunity to tour with Trilhas Outdoor Adventure Tours and Juca. After doing some research ahead of time, it was clear that working him and his business would be ideal. 

It almost didn’t materialize however; after having to reschedule (since we lost two days the day of our tour due to a cancelled flight) as the weather was so poor on the date of our rescheduled tour. 

Juca made the trip to our hotel (on New Year’s Day) to meet with us and discuss whether we wanted to tour or not, given that the weather was miserable and wouldn’t likely improve. He felt this was an appropriate conversation to have in person rather than to have over text or email. 

While it would have been rather easy to convince us to go, anyway (since it was our last full day on the island). Juca expressed that he didn’t feel that it would be fair to take our money, given the situation. 

For my wife and I, the honesty and integrity that was exhibited had won us over. We promised that if we returned, we would certainly book with Trilhas and while sad, we really looked forward to coming back and appreciated the honesty. 

Later that evening, we received a message from Marisa, Juca’s wife. There had been a cancellation and they wanted to see if they could give us a half-day tour that we could do before our flight home. 

Logistically, Marisa and Juca made it as easy and as pragmatic as possible by arranging that we meet at the airport so that we could get the most out of our time, which was a big help. 

As far as the experience itself, we couldn’t have been more impressed. Juca carries a kind and friendly energy that is incredibly welcoming. As we explored the island, he was well-equipped with an wide array of information, helpful context, interesting stories and funny jokes. 

The thing that was massively appreciated was that typically when we travel, I stay behind the lens and there are rarely any photos of my wife and I together, save for the random selfie. Juca exhibited a wizardry with the iPhone that neither of us knew existed, while also providing a number of helpful tidbits that I could use with my camera as well. 

He was mindful and caring, funny and welcoming. He showed us plenty of highlights around the island in a rather condensed format that at the same time never felt rushed or forced.  On top of that, we have a number of fantastic photos that we never would have imagined being able to take on our own. It felt as though we were traveling with a close family friend. We were totally comfortable and fully engaged during the time we spent. 

We can’t wait to come back again to visit and when we do, without question, we’ll be sure to reach out to Marisa and Juca once again!
reviews/13/text:
This is not the first time we've visited Terceira, but this time it was in a terribly round about way. Our plane was diverted from Lages Airport, to Porto on the mainland. Then we were put on a plane to Lisbon! Then to Porta Delgada! There we spent five days with no luggage. We finally got a flight to Lajes on the 24th and made it to the wonderful Island of Terceira. We were worn out...mentally and physically exhausted and with no clothes to speak of (Our luggage was finally found, but it seems to have been left out in the rain and everything in the suitcase including the suitcase was soaked & mildewed). BUT FEAR NOT! Juca to the rescue!! Our wonderful friend Juca and his beautiful wife Marisa form TRILHAUS Outdoor Adventure Tours had been following our harrowing adventures around the Atlantic and Europe and were there to pick us up at the airport and offered the compassionate support and understanding only true friends are capable of doing and eased our strife and put our minds to rest. Everything was all of a sudden right in the world once again! Thank you beyond words Juca and Marisa! 
As mentioned last year Juca and Marisa are PROFESSIONALS...THE BEST of THE BEST!! They both go the extra mile to make your experience on their Island is a time to remember. Juca goes overboard to be sure your tour is memorable, informative and un-hurried. TRILHAS - The ONLY way to see Terceira! Here is a little secret. Treat your tour guide as you would like to be treated! BIG HUG!!
reviews/13/title: A Shining Light in an otherwise Murphy's Law Vacation!
reviews/14/text: We went with another couple that has been on the tours as well as to Terceira multiple times before.  The tour was great and Juca had so much information to share with us during our tour.  He took us to some beautiful spots for photos.  This was definitely the best tour I have ever had.
reviews/15/text: We took the ARCHEOLOGY TOUR hoping for something a little out of the ordinary. We were not disappointed. Great communication from Marisa. Juca was informative, passionate and so very kind. He treats his clients as friends and tailors each tour with a mixture of history, great food and beautiful scenery. His passed his enthusiasm of the island history on to us. You will enjoy any tour of his. Highly recommend.
reviews/16/text:
We just returned from the best vacation of our lives!  This was our 20th anniversary trip so we wanted it to be super special. We booked two full days with Juca and then booked an additional day, as well.  We saw more beauty in those three days than ever before. Juca took us to so many beautiful sites and then took the most amazing pictures we’ve ever had taken. We visited the island in February and loved it but now after going on the tours with Juca we love it even more. We had so much fun!  He took us to amazing restaurants and coffee shops and we thoroughly enjoyed each and every day with him. He also took us to a cheese factory and my favorite eatery-an ice cream factory!  I loved it so much that I asked to go back all three days. 

We explored caves, saw beautiful cliffs, climbed amazing rocks, went to a waterfall, and so, SO much more. We also went to dinner with Juca and his wife and they are two of the friendliest, most hospitable people that we’ve ever met. We will most definitely be returning and scheduling more tours with our amazing friend, Juca. 

This tour is worth so much more than you pay and I highly recommend it. Your time with Juca will most definitely be the highlight of your trip!
reviews/17/text:
5+ Stars!! 
Excellent experience touring Terceria Island with Trilhas Outdoor Adventures.
Juca went above and beyond to show us all of the beautiful sights, and attractions, on the island.
His incredible photography skills were just an added bonus to a first class, tour experience.
Don't miss the best tour company on the island.
Worth every euro and highly recommend!
reviews/18/text: From the moment I booked a two-day private tour with TRILHAS I could not be more pleased. Marisa was so helpful in coordinating the tours and itinerary and even provided additional recommendations on other islands before our arrival. From the moment we met Juca, his enthusiasm and excitement for our upcoming adventure was contagious. Not only was he very informative about the history and culture on Terceira, you could tell that this is not just a job for him and that he loves his home and sharing the beauty of it with others. Juca was able to bring us to the highlights of the island as well as unique places - all while avoiding the crowds.  He was so kind to take time, not only taking pictures but also to explain some of the advanced settings on two different cell phone cameras. Both my friend and I have some beautiful photographs of a breathtaking island to bring home. I cannot wait to come back and book another tour with Juca and Marisa!
reviews/19/text: I just completed an amazing two-day private tour with TRILHAS and couldn't wait to write a review and share my experience.  It was by far the best tour I have ever taken.  Juca is not only an extremely talented photographer -- I now have some of the most incredible and creative photographs of myself in the most beautiful locations I've ever seen -- he is also funny, kind and considerate. Both Juca and his wonderful wife Marisa made my friend and I feel very comfortable and welcome.  I cannot stress enough how much I recommend hiring Juca for a private tour.  You will thank me.
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Azores Expeditions tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Cais da Madalena S/N, Pico 9950-026 Portugal
description: We are a company of young and experienced local guides, ready to guide your through the best experience at Azores. We know that the vacations is the most important time of the year, so we are committed to take your vacations very seriously, but in a Fun way! Our experiences are made in small groups, so you can embrace the Tripix Tribe feeling, on top of the Mountain, exploring caves, riding a bike or appreciating our unique azorean culture and local wines. You’ll be always a result of people you meet and places you see, so join the Tribe and live your best experience at Azores. Respecting the raw nature and the local sustentability of Azores.
name: Tripix Azores
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Climb Pico Mountain with a Professional Guide
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Night Climb to Pico Mountain in Small Groups
reviews/0/text: Our tour guide, Maria, made sure our day trip to Pico Island was a success. I highly recommend that you request Maria as your Pico Island guide.
reviews/1/text: We spent the day with Mateo and his trainee, Maria Louisa, on the Secret Lagoons and Lava Cave Jeep Tour. They were very personable, accommodating and attentive.  We visited the Lagoas, lakes in old craters, while seeing the island's interior and its spectacular views.  Our guides were able to answer or anticipate our questions about history, volcanoes, dairy farming in great depth.   Mateo is a fountain of information. The highlight for me was the tour of the Grutta dos Torres, the lava tube. but the experience in its entirety was five stars.
reviews/1/title: Breathtaking views of Pico with friendly guides.
reviews/2/text: On this full day tour of Pico Isalnd we were fortunate to have not only Matteo as our guide, but also Maria Louisa, as a guide in training. Matteo also guides Pico Mountain hikes. We learned so much about the history and culture of the island as we explored coastline and central portions, vineyards, whaling museum, historical villages and more. Our hosts were charming, natural and attentive. We spent a long lunch sampling many Azorean dishes and enjoying animated conversation. A very enjoyable and rewarding day, with a side visit for tangerines and oranges.
reviews/3/text:
Booked a tripix tour all day of the island and I was met with a very personable staff and a lovely van of high quality. It was the first time on the island and I was uncertain of roads etc and the tour was perfect to given me the confidence to then explore on my own. I enjoyed the whale museum  which really gives the history of the island and is a must and also just the smaller towns and navigating.
I would;d highly recommend and its exactly at the port so you can walk off the ferry and jump in the van.
reviews/3/title: perfect way to get a overview of pico
reviews/4/text:
Had a full day wine tour with Margarida and enjoyed every second of it. Margarida is a young, wonderful woman who provides great atmosphere, lots of fun and her language skills are simply great!
We loved going around vineyards with her!
reviews/5/text:
Best experience in Pico! I did the day climb if Mt Pico and the Wine Tour the next day. 

PICO MTN CLIMB. I’m going to preface this by saying I was NOT prepared for this technical a climb. I love to hike, and am ok with steep and a lot of cardio - but I found the mental side of this overbearing. Thank god for our amazing guide Matteo. He has climbed it 650 times!!! So he was amazingly supportive when I had a panic attack halfway up and helped me thru it. I was also terrified the whole way down (way harder than going up, btw) but he had me hold onto his backpack and talked the whole way so I was distracted. I definitely would have needed the the mountain rescue team if it were not for him. THANK YOU MATTEO!!!

PICO WINE TOUR: What a lovely day. We started at 9.30a and I was a little nervous about hitting the bottle that early, but luckily for me the morning ended up being more of a tour and learning about the island. Then we went to a lovely lunch and the wine commenced! It was very good. We then went and tried Liquer which I was not a big fan of - would have preferred more wine - but still fun to try. Jerson the Guide was kind, personable and extremely knowledgeable. What a wonderful day!
reviews/5/title: Mtn Climb and Wine Tour with Tripix
reviews/6/text: We did hiking to the top of Pico mountain with Matteo. He is awesome guide! We really enjoyed being guided by him. He was attentive, maintained our pace, took pictures (this is a very cool bonus), took care of a girl who got a panic attack. Also we were lucky to see the top of the mountain without clouds. It was challenging, we were tired but vary happy!
reviews/7/text: Tripix wine (and moonshine) tasting tour, Pico, Azores. Full day island tour with an excellent buffet lunch.
reviews/7/title: Pico wine tasting and island tour.
reviews/8/text:
Pico mountain day climb with Matteo was a great experience!
He is a very experienced,entertaining and motivating moutain guide
reviews/9/text: Our guides were amazing! We had a great time ane feel safe all the time in the mountain thanks to the knowledge and the energy provided by them. It’s a hard climb and we are thankfull for having choose Tripix! I don’t recomend to climb alone and if you have to choose someone they are the right choice!
reviews/10/text:
Did the bike wine tour with Jerson.  This was a casual ride along the north west coast of Pico.  We got some info about the vineyards, a wine tasting and cheese tasting.  Jerson was pretty chill and went with the group's schedule. 

Also did the half day tour of Pico Island with Raisa.  Raisa was pretty knowledgeable of the island.  She adapted the tour to the group's interest as well as the weather conditions.  She was a really fun guide.

Overall Tripix was easy to book with.  Their office was close to my hotel and was able to book on the spot.
reviews/10/title: Bike Wine Tour and Pico Half Day Island Tour
reviews/11/text:
All the experience with Tripix was amazing! Since the first few contacts over email, they were very helpful and flexible allowing us to adjust to the various activities we wanted to do in Pico.

The overnight climb was an unforgettable experience, Matteo was the best guide we could ask for, doing the impossible to keep the moral of the group up and getting everyone to the top, and even got us a few surprises when we got up there!

Regarding the climb and descent, do not underestimate how hard it is, carrying the backpack all the way up and more importantly all the way down is very hard, specially for someone that is not used to this kind of workout!

But if you are going up, go with Tripix!
reviews/11/title: If you are going up, go with Tripix!
reviews/12/text: Although Matteo's specialty is hikes up Mt Pico we had his company for an island tour, lunch and two wine tastings.  Not only is he knowledgable and well connected on the island but he has the perfect 'vibe' of just relax and enjoy your stay.  He has an interesting background which makes for enjoyable conversation as you tour around.
reviews/12/title: A vibe that's perfect for Pico
reviews/13/text:
My friend and I did two activities with Tripix and they were both awesome! 
Having not access to a car on Pico, we were looking for a tour that could give us a full and adventurous experience, our eyes landed on the “Secret Lagoon and Lava Cave Tours” and we were not disappointed! We started the morning with exploring two caves with Raisa, our guide. The two caves we visited are only known by some locals so we got to explore over 700m of caves just by ourselves. Raisa was very knowledgeable on the subject and we were provided with great gear to explore without being afraid of hurting ourselves and getting ourselves dirty. After the cave exploration, Raisa brought us to a local restaurant where we got to try some very nice food from the Azores. The afternoon we got to explore a large portion of the islands; some hidden lagoons (since sometime the fog just hides it from everyone), the coast where we really got to appreciate the remains of the eruption and the solidified lava. Raisa also made us try some local wine as she wanted to make sure we couldn’t leave Pico without trying at least a glass of wine from there.

We also had initially planned to do the Pico Night Climb later that day, but the weather was unfortunately not on our side. We instead got rebooked on the Pico Day Climb the next day which was great none the less. They taught us about some plants, gave us a taste of the local drink, and got us all the way to the top in a good pace. Bring lots of Water, Snacks and Lunch! 
Thanks Tripix!
reviews/13/title: Secret Lagoons & Lava Caves Tour, and Pico Climb
reviews/14/text:
Where to begin, from the start the Tripix team helped us with all prearrangement (food, water, clothes, transportation...). Matteo, our extremely experienced guide (500+ hikes to Pico Mountain) picked us up and drove us to the Mountain House. On the way he showed the weather forecast and what to expect, always good to manage expectations as the weather can be tricky. He arranged everything once there making our life’s very easy, specially at that time of the day. 

During the hike he explained the different parts, with names and difficulty, and managed our pace to make the experience as enjoyable as possible. He also know the mountain better than his living room so he went on the easiest parts, with short cuts 😁.

Not only that, he is also a very knowledgeable climber and we were lucky enough to get a 7 summit 101 class on our way back, making the time go by super fast.

Just to top it off he spent the day taking videos and pictures that are just the perfect way to remember this day, and it takes that off your hands so you just have to enjoy the view.

100% recommended if you are planning to do this hike. He is all passion and knowledge, and managed to keep us smiling all the way.

Ah by the way, if you do the hike with Matteo there is a surprise waiting for you on the top;)
reviews/14/title: Your guide to conquer Pico Mountain
reviews/15/text: I went on a day climb of Pico with Tripix and I cannot recommend it more! Our guide Matteo was extremely knowledgeable and made the entire hike very fun for all. Very glad I chose this company for my climb of Pico. I felt very safe and inspired the entire time.
reviews/15/title: Fun and Knowledgeable Guide for Pico Climb
reviews/16/text: Pico day climb: Great experience, amazing people.. You can’t choose better, more reliable and fun guides!!
reviews/17/text: We spent a beautiful day with Lucia exploring all the nooks and crannies of the Pico island wine and liquor industry.  She was one of the most knowledgeable tour guides we’ve ever met and not only taught us about the wine culture, but also gave us an overview of the island’s history and geological formation. Although I wasn’t sure what to expect in regards to the liquors, they were really flavourful and unique.  Everyone along the tour was super friendly and provided amazing service and comfort.  Thank you for making our trip to Pico so memorable.  I highly recommend this tour for anyone coming to the island.
reviews/18/text: Did the Pico mountain day climb with Tripix (Rai was our guide). The email comms were always friendly and Rai was a great guide - she told us bits about the volcano and flora/fauna, as well of course of providing plenty of encouragement and helping us pick the best routes. I should mention that my climb was bought forward by a day fairly last minute: this was due to the mountain weather forecasts and so that I see as a positive - i.e. they have guests' safety and experience in mind - rather than anything negative. N.b. transfers to/from Madalena are included in the price (e.g. if you don't have a car), but you do need to specifically request this in advance. Thank you Rai for an excellent - if somewhat tiring - day.
reviews/18/title: Pico mountain day climb with Tripix
reviews/19/text:
I climbed the Pico with Tripix in the early hours of August 24th. It was an incredible experience, I went with the guide Matteo, very friendly, he adapted the pace of the route to those who had more difficulties.
We took the necessary breaks.
When we arrived at the piquinho, the group waited for the rest of the people to leave in order to rest, enjoy the view and drink a aguaardente (local brandy), offered by the guide.
reviews/19/title: My experience going up the Pico
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Tripix Azores tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Kiosk B - Ponta Delgada Marina, Ponta Delgada, Sao Miguel 9500-763 Portugal
animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
description: Scuba Diving Trips and Offshore Trips for Mobulas. PADI Courses. Try Scuba Diving Dives. We are the only 100% AWARE and 5* IDC Dive Resort in the Azores that has first goal the client satisfaction and safety always focused in oceans protection and conservation. We love what we do so it´s easy for us to make your holidays even more special. With a dive group up to 6 divers you will get the best chance to enjoy your dives guided by marine biologists/dive leader. With a long experience with tourism and our staff is all the time getting in new training to give you all that you need. As a PADI 5* IDC DIVE RESORT and AQUALUNG PARTNER CENTER we will give you the best support in education materials and scuba equipment. Our company gives also support to Environmental Projects and we have our how local Environmental Education Project called "Jelly Fish Project" for which we donate 2% of our annual profit. Also we are 100% Project AWARE Partners donating 10€ for each student that makes an
name: Best Spot Azores Dive Center
ranking: #4 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #4 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text:
Couldn't have chosen a better Dive Center for our Advanced Adventure Diver course! 
From the booking communication to the hot tea after coming back from the cold water, Best Spot had all the details in mind to ensure we had a great experience.
We did a night dive for the first time, and Bruno guided us through it, not only showing us all the amazing nightlife underwater but also making sure we felt safe and comfortable. 
Shout out to the entire team: Bruno, Mike, Ruben, Koen, Luís, João, Suzi and their mascot Spicy! Thank you for the warm welcome and guidance, and I hope to see you soon!
reviews/1/text: I can recommend anyone who wants to dive on São Miguel to go with Best Spot. I got my advanced diver certificate here. Bruno and Ruben are very knowledgeable and caring instructors. The rest of the team is super helpful and nice to be with. All in all, a great experience! I recommend bringing some diving gloves if you tend to be cold, like me :)
reviews/1/title: Learning skills and having fun in a safe environment
reviews/2/text: The instructors are great, always supporting and explaining when needed. The rentable equipment is high quality. The diving spots are very different from one another. Getting bored is impossible! I truly recommend this also for both advanced or beginner divers.
reviews/3/text: Completed my Advanced Open Water PADI course with Bruno in October 2022. Best experience, the instructor is very patient and supportive, the gear is in very good condition. And the dive locations are very beautiful!
reviews/3/title: Amazing Dive Center on the island
reviews/4/text:
I was diving with those great guys from the 19.11.2022 'til 23.11.2022 not the best season but I had lots of fun and pleasure anyway. They adapted the dive spots to the weather conditions to stay safe and have it magical anyway. I can recommend and will sure come back again thanks Sergio and his team.

Marie
reviews/4/title: Diving Ponta Delgada with best spot Azores
reviews/5/text: I had the best experience completing my Open Water certification with Best Spot! Ruben was very patient, calm, and knowledgeable. I can't wait to dive more with my new, shiny certification!! The entire crew was very friendly and welcoming. Spicy was almost always there to greet me with a tail wag :) Thank you for an incredible few days, Best Spot! Highly recommend to anyone looking to dive, snorkel, or get certified!
reviews/5/title: Best Spot really is the best spot!
reviews/6/text:
I had 2 dives with 'best spot' and it was great!! The place is very proffesional, the guide Bruno was very nice and professional. He answered all of my questions and help me to calm during the begining of the drive. 
Thank you Bruno! 😊
reviews/6/title: Bruno is the best scude diving guide!
reviews/7/text: Amazing staff and diving spot. Water not so cold, hope I can repeat. Best scuba dive in S.Miguel, really really happy.
reviews/8/text: Best diving spot in the island for sure !!! Bruno and crew are very nice and really professional ! Dory is a must do diving !!!
reviews/9/text: We had 14 dives with them as a family, including 13ys old son. I felt safe, nothing was rushed and none of the safety procedures were skipped. They have taken great care of us. All of divemasters or instructors seemed very professional. We had amazing week with them at the end of October. If we come , we will dive with them again.
reviews/10/text: The guides were very attentive and caring and made sure to show us amazing wildlife while keeping us safe. I felt absolutely secure during the whole dive.
reviews/11/text: Our 2 daughters (12 & 14) did their junior open water certification (had no prior diving experience) with Best Spot and from start to finish was a top experience with Bruno and his team.  Easy booking/communication via email in advance from abroad/received theoretical material in advance, excellent instructors where safety and throrough instruction was at the forefront, kids (and parents on shore!) felt great about the course and instruction.  Would recommend to others looking for a dive school.
reviews/12/text:
Nice and well organized diving center. Great team of dive masters and instructors too. Good sense of safety and confort. For sure I'll return.
Regards to all the team Suzie,Bruno, Ruben, Katerin, Silvia, Alexandra, Diogo, Nuno, Miguel, Camila (hoppe not have miss anyone).
Some of spots: Dori, lavakita, arcos do cruzeiro, ilheu s.. Roque, willy wonka, luso wreck, baixa do ouro, lavakita deep, formigas.
reviews/13/text:
Strongly recommended. These guys are great at what they do, a super organised flowing machine which makes you feel relaxed and ready to enjoy a days diving. 

Thanks for the great experience (again!!). This was our second visit to Sao Miguel and second time diving with Best Spot. Anyone wanting to dive as a regular, first timer or pro should give these guys a shout. 

They get busy so bill ahead to avoid disappointment!
reviews/14/text: Thanks to Bruno and the team at Best Spot. We completed our Advanced Open Water certification with them. I was really impressed by Bruno’s attention to detail and focus on safety. The Azores is an amazing place to dive and I would highly recommend Best Spot.
reviews/15/text: I was making my Ocean Water Diver Certificate and it was just fabulous. The staff is very kind, helpful and know their stuff. Very well organized trips and nice diving spots. Definetly worth a visit and an amazing place to start your first diving experience.
reviews/15/title: Amazing place for Open water diver certificate
reviews/16/text:
Ok, quick review..
Amazing people, amazing hearts, amazing dives.
Just finish a 2 week dive trip with some friends and couldnt have asked for a better dive center.
Professional, friendly, helpfull.. pff.. you name it!
I seriously cant recommend this guys enough. 
I just want to send a quick shout out and big thanks to Bruno and Suzy and the rest of the staff: Ana (the group favorite),Alexandra, Leo, Luís, Vasco, Rodrigo, Silvia, and every other amazing human that dived with us. Im sorry I cant name you all now but you are in our hearts forever.
If you ever go to São Miguel, Açores you have (not must, HAVE!!!) to dive with these guys, and I rest my case!
As the name says: best spot!!
reviews/17/text: I completed my PADI Open Water course with Best Spot, had a great experience and highly recommend it! Their instructors are very knowledgeable and experienced which gave me a lot of confidence from the beginning. I also had different instructors which was great to understand different points of views/ technics. They were very detailed orientated and patient and I ended the course really confident in my knowledge and future dives! A big shout out to Nuno and Diogo!
reviews/18/text: Awesome dive centre in an amazing location. Bruno, Suzie and the team are so welcoming, knowledgeable and fun to dive with, they really looked after us and made the trip one of a lifetime!
reviews/19/text:
Having done the confined water dives for my PADI Open Water in the UK, I chose to do the open water dives here in the Azores.  Best Spot was well reviewed and did not disappoint.

Silvia and Camila instructed our group for the first two dives, making sure we were comfortable with the requisite skills (and in my case, the realities of diving from a boat).  They also added a saltwater confined water dive for me, which was again very useful for getting the feel of the full equipment without the complexities of open water.

Rúben then guided our group for the third and fourth dives around Caloura (Galera and Arches), adapting the route to our confidence and air consumption (giving me an extra 20 minutes on the second dive).  I’m not a marine biologist so can’t really comment on the wildlife, but I loved the underwater scenery.  I chose the Azores having had a wonderful holiday in Iceland, so being able to “fly” through the familiar volcanic landscape was magical.

Overall, I was very pleased with the service Best Spot provided, and would highly recommend them to anyone else doing their PADI Open Water.
reviews/19/title: Staff very friendly and welcoming but also professional.
subcategory_ranking: #4 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
