address: Flores Portugal
description: Hi my name is Silvio, I provide pick ups and drop offs at any part of Flores island. Also sightseeing on Flores island, prebook your transfers to / from airport, hiking trails, restaurants. Fluent English spoken!
name: Pick me up in Flores! - Silvio Medina
reviews/0/text:
Silvio offers a pick up & drop off and sightseeing services. He also provides info about hiking trails, places to eat and everything touristic. He speaks fluent English, always on time and responds to your calls quickly. 
Above all he is attentive and a wonderful person.
reviews/0/title: Pick Silvio for a perfect holiday in Flores and forget about renting a car
reviews/1/text:
Great service
Silvio’s english is excellent
Great prices
Highly available and super attentive to any need and request, provided us great recommendations for our stay in the island.
reviews/2/text:
Was very nice..peaceful..beautiful landscapes and seascapes  
  Food and drinks are reasonably priced.
Lots to see and the hiking is excellent.
reviews/3/text: When you get into Silvio's car, you are not in a taxi but in a travel agency. He helped us a lot with all our questions and organizing our stay in Flores, It was great to meet such a interesting person. Exactly!
reviews/4/text: The Best Guide In Flores. Silvio is more than a Taxi Driver. Silvio Is an institution of the Island! He will guide you in discovering the Island giving you the best tips.
reviews/5/text:
We couldn't find  rental car in Flores for our stay and ended up booking Silvio to drive us to the hikes and around the island.  This proved to be a very happy mishap as Silvio turned out to be not only a friendly, efficient, professional driver and guide, but also cheaper than it would have been to actually rent a car. 
Unless you want to hike 14-30 km (and we are hikers, but the humid climate of the Azores makes everything harder)  it's actually better to have Silvio drive you to the beginning of the hike and pick you up at the end. 

If staying in Faja Grande, three hiking trails begin there, so Silvio can drive you to the end of the hike and you can walk back to your accommodation for a very reasonable price (20-30 per route for the two of us). 
Silvio also gives great advice on tours to Corvo, restaurants and accommodation and can often make the booking for you. 

10/10 and  not a tourist trap.
reviews/5/title: Forget the rental car and go with Silvio
reviews/6/text: After realizing that renting a car in Flores was an impossible mission, we found Silvio’s number and honestly, it was the best thing it could happened to us.  We contacted him to organize transfers between accomodations but in the end he helped us to organize the hikes, gave us the best recommendations and explained a lot of interesting things (and we are VERY curious people😂). But apart from that, he is a problem solver, always willing to help and to make the most of your time in the island.
reviews/7/text: Best driver in Flores! Silvio is an amazing person, he drives you to the best spots of the island and he also recommend nice restaurants and activities. If I come back, for sure I’ll call him. We have a lovely time in Flores thanks to Silvio!!
reviews/8/text:
Excellent and trustworthy taxi driver always willing to adapt to your needs. Also as an experienced professional and local inhabitant of the island offers you a wide range of plans to do: hiking trails, natural sea swimming pools, waterfalls, etc. 
Highly recommendable.
reviews/9/text: We were afraid because we hadn’t been able to rent a car. But Silvio was an amazing discovery and he help us with the transfers to the airport and to the trails. He is FAST, and I’m not talking about driving around the island. Capable to manage all his customers in a way that I’ve ever seen. Better to book the day before and avoid to tight schedules. Great choice and would repeat without a doubt!
reviews/9/title: Great option to move around Flores
reviews/10/text:
Silvio is the best! Uncomplicated transfers to and from the airport or from hiking trails. He knows the island from the back of his hand and can also give a lot of tips and connections. We would have been lost without him. Super flexible and every trip with him was a pleasure. 
Also, it's always great to see someone who loves his job as much as Silvio.
reviews/11/text: Many thanks for the last days Silvio, the were amazing. You are the best man to discover Flores and also one of the highlights of this wonderful island.
reviews/11/title: Never rent a car on Flores, just call Silvio!
reviews/12/text:
Sorry for the late review but I did not forget about you. Silvio is a hell of a blast, I thought we just booked a taxi but wow, no we booked a flores expert! He speaks fluent english, has a great sense of humour, is super enthusiastic about the island and has a fair price. Would i rent a car ont flores? No, just book Silvio and follow his suggestions, especially restaurants (he might wants you to hike everyday, i dont 100% recommend this as the Portuguese wine is quite good😅)
Thank you Silvio, keep beeing a great dude!!!
reviews/13/text: Silvio took us around the Island and informed us very well about all we asked him. He put us to the startpoints of the walking trails and picked us up at the end of them. Perfect Taxi including Tourist Guide. Best Choice :)
reviews/14/text: Silvio is an amazing Taxi driver. If you are ever visiting Flores absolutely call him ! He is your guy. Also fluent in English which is a huge plus!! Also very organized. Use him! A+
reviews/15/text: Thanks to Silvio, we had a wonderful Time in Flores . Every day, he chose the best places to visit according to the weather and recommended well adapted hikes according to their difficulties. He even managed to show us the beautiful lagoas without fog ! H&B
reviews/16/text:
Great tour guide, enjoyed our time in flores with silvo  as  our guide ,very reliable guy who loves his work as a tour guide showing people around flores island.helped me get my suitcase back after it was lost in the airports helping us get anywhere without a car.
Dont think twice and book silvio
reviews/17/text: I can‘t Imagine of a better driver than Silvio! I booked his service 4 times during my stay on Flores and he did a perfect job. He is driving safe. His car is clean and well maintained. I always felt comfortable. He responses very quickly, is very reliable and on time. His englisch is exellent and he is great company.  He knows a lot about the island and explains it during the drive (like a guide). I can highly recommend him to anyone.
reviews/18/text:
Silvio is far more than a driver. He knows everything about the island and the sights. Since he drives a lot of people around he is always informed about the hiking trails and their condition. Just ask and you will get the information you need. When driving around he also stopped at some nice viewpoints for us to make some cool pictures. Also ask him about the restaurants, he will recommend something good no matter where you are on the island.
If the weather is bad and you are not sure what to plan, he will also give you great Tips.

The communication was also really good. We wrote messages and WhatsApp and made appointments for transfers. Really easy and uncomplicated. 

We really enjoyed driving with Silvio and would definitely book him again.
reviews/19/text: We enjoyed our day trip with Silvio a lot, he showed us the whole island and offered us different program options to choose from. He was punctual, kind, reliable. And gave us an insight to the history of Flores and the life of locals. We highly recommend his tours and thank you Silvio for the unforgettable experience!
reviews/19/title: A fantastic day trip on Flores

address: Canada de Santa Barbara Rosario, Lagoa, Sao Miguel 9500-141 Portugal
animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
description: Equitur is offering guided horse back riding tours on the beautiful island of Sao Miguel. From the first time on a horse, to experienced riders, everyone is welcome. With a maximum size of 4 persons per group (exception: a family or a group of friends who know each other can ride in a larger group all together) we offer safe and individual rides.
name: Equitur
reviews/0/text: Group of 7 had a wonderful time riding w Lara.  Horses are beautiful and gentle on new rides.  Lara made everyone feel comfortable and safe.  We loved the dogs at the farm!  Horses were well taken care of.
reviews/1/text: Lara led me on yet another beautiful ride through the countryside of central Sao Miguel.  Valioso, my lovely Lusitano mount for the afternoon, was sure footed and enjoyed being out with his buddy Fidalgo.  I never miss a chance to get out with Lara and Rodrigo when I am in Sao Miguel for a few days.  I was so pleased to have had the opportunity to see them again this trip.  Their facilities are lovely and their 13 horses well taken care of.  Be sure to stop in and have a ride with them when you next visit Sao Miguel.
reviews/1/title: A Peaceful Joyous Ride in the countryside
reviews/2/text: We are a family of three adults, and we were on a half day tour of Pinhal da Paz. We had an amazing experience with Lara as our guide, the horses were very friendly and well trained. Lara told us a lot about the flora and fauna and some history of the island. The tour was really beautiful with ocean views and dense, magical forests. I would recommend Equitur to anyone looking for horseback riding in Sao Miguel.
reviews/3/text: We had a fantastic riding experience with Lara and Rodrigo and their horses. We did three very varied rides and saw different parts of the island that you would not normally see as a tourist. The horses are well-trained and can accommodate also less experienced riders. Lara was a great guide and taught us many things about the island and its fauna and flora. My teenager children both loved it!
reviews/4/text: I have been on a lot of guided horse rides and Equitur has been the best experience of them all! Lara and Rodrigo are great guides with with alot of knowledge of the area. The scenery is dream like making you wish the ride never had to end.
reviews/5/text: Truly one of the most memorable experiences I’ve ever had. Lara and Rodrigo were wonderful guides and you can tell they really love and care for their horses, which were all beautiful, healthy, and lively. After a short tour of their farm, we rode in a car with Lara to Setes Cidades to start our full day ride. We climbed up around the side of the lakes with the horses and had lots of fun trots and canters along the way, then walked them down the step side of the crater, followed by a nice Azorean lunch and another ride along the sides of the lakes afterwords. If you love to ride and love nature I completely recommend this experience, it’s unforgettable.
reviews/5/title: Unforgettable riding experience alongside volcanic lakes
reviews/6/text: So fun! So relaxing! We did a half day ride. The scenery was gorgeous and Laura was very knowledge and kind. I would highly recommend!
reviews/7/text: Excellent tour with Lara. We had a mixed experienced group but even our most hesitant member loved the ride. Those of us who wanted to canter/trot were able to and others stayed in a walk the entire time. Excellent views and experience!
reviews/8/text:
When I searched for a riding experience in the Azores, I knew what I hoped to find but wasn't sure I could. As an experienced rider and horse owner myself, the most important thing was impeccable care for the horses... along with an unbelievable riding experience with beautiful sites and tons of fun. We got it all and MORE with Lara and Rodrigo.
From start to finish, they provided us exactly what my friend and I were hoping for in our full day ride. I can't even say what my favorite part was because it was ALL amazing... the jungle, the villages, the ocean views, a healthy and delicious picnic overlooking the sea while the horses happily ate their lunch, exhilarating gallops while we laughed for joy, the cool history of the islands Lara told us, seeing things no tourist could, and our small group of 4. It felt like going out for a ride with friends. 
And again... their attitude was that the horses come FIRST. The horses are happy and healthy and fit and know and love their jobs. Their workload is carefully monitored and they have proper time off. It is not often a company has so much integrity and passion for their jobs and horses that they would turn away business for the sake of small, personized groups and the care of the horses. They made the day PERFECT and we will absolutely join them again when we go back. Thank you again, L and R! Hug Esmeralda's neck for me!
reviews/9/text:
What a wonderful way to see parts of the island and be amongst nature. As beginners we felt completely safe, even got the nerve up to trot and gallop. The horses, Lord, Lagos, Esmeralda, Duchess were amazing - they knew where to go… and we’re very gentle. We rode on trails, roads, dirt patches and back roads. Laura was very informative and showed us around the lovely stables, riding arena and other animals. It truly shows they care about the animals. 
Would recommend to any family.
reviews/10/text: Horseback riding was a pleasure.  Manny options, depending on experience, and varied ride- country lane, forest, ocean viewpoint.  Lara was wonderful, and I encourage anyone to include this in a trip locally.
reviews/10/title: Wonderful horseback riding- variety, value and pleasure.
reviews/11/text: Best horseback ride experience I’ve ever had. The horses were well trained and healthy. Our guide Lara was wonderful and took many pictures of us during the ride.
reviews/12/text: I did the half day ride on Esmeralda, grey Lusitania, she was so sweet. Lara was a wonderful guide, varying the gaits as we trotted and cantered to match my skill level.  The countryside is varied riding through jungle like areas and open areas, of course cows,  up and down,  through a park.  Enjoyed chatting with Lara about riding and horses sharing riding tips with me, as I am a novice rider.   Highly recommend it.  I would have loved to take lesson with her.  I am hoping to go back and do one of the multiple day packages with her.
reviews/12/title: Scenic ride, Beautiful horses, Great ride
reviews/13/text:
The tour is very nice and it's a different and fun way to explore a part of the island. From farm roads to dense forest parts. The tour has lots of variation. Lara was our guide, she was very kind and she took the time to explain everthing very well and she knows a lot about the island.
This was just our second time horse riding and it went very well.
We highly recommend this tour!
reviews/14/text:
We visited the island late March, and before arriving we booked 2 rides for 2 x beginners. We chose Equitur because of all the amazing feedback received on Tripadvisor. 

The experiences we got definitely exceeded our expectations and we both had a great time.  We rode Esmerelda and Duchesia on both rides, and what lovely trusting horses they were!  It is obvious how well cared for all the horses are, and for the second ride, on a different day, we could have ridden another horse if we wanted too. 

It was certainly value for money. We would be happy to pay more money for the experiences that we got. 

We will certainly be visiting again. 

Thanks Lara and Rodrigo!
reviews/15/text: Equitur is paradise for animals lovers. We’ve had an amazing moment with Lara, who gave us a lot of informations about the island of Sao Miguel. She made sure that we had fun and explained us how to trot and gallop, when paying a lot of attention to the well being of the horses.
reviews/16/text:
Beautiful place, well trained horses and kind owners. Me and my friend did a lovely halfday ride with them one month ago and we couldn't be happier about the trip. Lara was also very patient with me already in the first place, since i was working in Sao Miguel for the summer and my  free days were changing all the time, But she answered all my emails and was just very kind and understanding. 
When we arrived Lara showed us the barn, told us more about horses, about their personallities and health conditions, which was really nice. After that we drove to a place where we started a ride. 
The place was amazing, horses were calm and responsive and we just had a really good time. What I liked the most was that horses were in good condition, it seems like they have a good life here in Azores :) and also that they are doing tours in small groups - it keeps the quality of the tour high. 
Thank you Lara and Rodrigo.
reviews/16/title: Beautiful halfday ride Pinhal da paz
reviews/17/text:
Absolutely amazing experience. Our half day trip was perfect to see the less travelled places of the island. The route was perfect and the guidance excellent. We both felt super safe but still entertained and excited which is great concerning that one of us never sat on a horse once while the other one is an experienced horseback rider.
The farm is lovely and all the animals are really taken care of and seem to enjoy the trips too.
Thank you for the lovely experience.
reviews/17/title: Lovely day in Pinhal da Paz
reviews/18/text: An amazing horseback riding experience led by Lara! Horseback riding gives you the opportunity to see and experience quieter parts of the island you generally wouldn’t get to go through by car. Lara keeps each excursion to a small group, which makes the experience safe and intimate. We also got a great history lesson as we went through the trail. Highly recommend!
reviews/19/text: The tour is very personal, the horses are amazingly beautiful and the guides Lara and Rodrigo are very dedicated! This tour is a must!
tags/animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.

address: Lajes do Pico, Pico Portugal
description: Hominis natura is an enthusiastic young company based on the Island of Pico. We are thrilling to give you, your family and friends a once in a lifetime experience. We see life from a different angle and extend that view in our company philosophy. We deeply care for nature and good local food which is why we try to contribute to conserve the environment and develop local sustainability with our actions. We are a fusion of Azorean and Belgian culture. Together we speak English, Português, Nederlands and Français. We would love to share our knowledge and experience with you so come and join us on one of our activities.
name: Hominis Natura
photo/caption:
Hominis natura 
- Nature in human form -
ranking: #5 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #5 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text: We got the tip to book the guided hike up Pico with Hominis Natura from another company which had already closed for the season. And it was a very good tip! Steffi is a very experienced, knowledgeable and also funny tour guide, full of interesting stories. She times the breaks throughout the hike very well, making it less of a tour de force than we had expected. She also gave us ample time to enjoy our lunch at the peak. We warmly recommend her and her colleagues from Hominis Natura.
reviews/0/title: Wonderful and well planned hike up Pico
reviews/1/text: I did last week the tour "climbing Pico". The tour was organized perfectly - although the weather changed - like the Azores are - several times that day. Nilton was the perfect Guide. Takes care of the slowest members and provide during several stops very good explanations about nature, geography, vulcano-structures etc. with all interactions. He was very friendly and had a good sense of humor. I like it.
reviews/2/text: The organisation of climbing Pico was done very easily for us, response to our request and communication with Steffi fast and informative!  I liked that we were only a small group of 7 people. Special thanks to Nilton for his professional guiding on Pico. It was a real challenge for me, but with Nilton as a guide I felt always safe and I can highly recommend Hominis Natura!
reviews/3/text: Great kayaking from Sta. Cruz to Pontas Negras. Boats in great condition, the coastline was beautiful and guiding excellent.
reviews/4/text: Steffi took us for a day tour around Pico Island. We saw many aspects of this beautiful island, visited the caves, went swimming in a natural seapool followed by deliciously prepared fresh lunch! She told us a lot about the history of Pico, the flora and fauna, the wine industry and whale hunting. Many enjoyable adventures!!
reviews/5/text: We've had the chance to do the Pico night climb with my two teenager kids, expertly guided by Steffi. We are used to hiking and would normally have climbed without a guide during the day but because it was a night climb and we've read that the weather conditions can be difficult, we chose to join a group with a guide (who has all the necessary equipment and knowledge of how to react in adverse conditions). It was definitely a good choice : we were in a small group, could spend some time sharing our experiences and learning about life in Pico, and I also quickly realized it would have been much more difficult to find the right path up without a guide at night ! It was a truly amazing experience and definitely one of the highlights of our trip to the Azores ! Thanks Steffi !
reviews/6/text: Very nice trip with Nilton Goulart, the climb at Pico mountain was great and excelent. Kind guide, pleasant conversation, funny enjoyment 🤩
reviews/7/text: We didn’t know what to expect from the island and wine tour but it was an amazing trip. Steffie showed us really nice spots which we by ourselves never would have found. She is very profecional and helpfull. We recommend this company for every trip you want to do in Pico. C&R
reviews/8/text:
Awesome!!!!
We did the Nightclimbe on Pico together with Steffi and it was the highlight of our trip to the azores. Steffi is the best guide you will finde on Pico and I would definitely recomend to do the nightclimbe with her! And not only because she could answer every of my questions (I had a lot :) ).
reviews/9/text:
A few weeks ago we went on a day trip climbing Mount Pico. We were lucky to be guided by Steffi from Hominis Natura. Steffi is a very professional, trustworthy and helpful guide. Thanks to her advice we came well prepared for a climb with all different weather conditions and made it to the top. As Belgian tourists it was very nice to have a Dutch-speaking guide. 
We highly recommend our guide Steffi. You don't have to be afraid to take the trip if you follow her instructions carefully. 
Thank you Steffi for the unforgettable day! 

M&E
reviews/10/text:
Between January and May, Steffi and Nilton took through the most wonderful walks around Pico Island. They organized every single walk with so much care and attention. I was very specific about the hours I can walk ( no more than 5 hours), about the timing, ( I prefer the afternoons), etc, etc.
Each walk was handmade for me and each walk was absolutely perfect. When Steffi saw that I was getting very tired, she would ask us to stop, always in the most beautiful space, and  gave me the most delicious lemonade and the most marvellous buiscuits made by her, that gave me the energy to keep on going. I hope to resume the walks at the end of October.
reviews/10/title: Steffi and Nilton are the most wonderful guides
reviews/11/text: We did a pico mountain overnight climb and it was really amazing! Very nice and experienced guide! Very well organized and helpful. Small group. We loved it and totally recommend!
reviews/12/text: My husband really wanted to do this hike, and tbh it was probably a little beyond my comfort zone and abilities. Nilson took great care to guide us, ensure my safety and make sure I completed the climb. He was very patient! We had absolutely perfect conditions and I am proud I completed the hike. Thank you Nilson! A great day with a great guide. Highly recommend Hominis Natura to guide you on Pico!
reviews/12/title: Great (but difficult) hike up Pico with Nilton on a gorgeous day!
reviews/13/text:
My girlfriend and I had the great opportunity to do a private overnight climb on Mount Pico together with our guide Steffi.  
It was a once-in-a-lifetime experience spending the night in a volcanic crater and seeing both sunset and sunrise at the summit, in the middle of the Atlantic.  
The hike up and down isn't easy, but at the top, your effort is more than rewarded.  
Steffi from Hominis Natura was a fabulous and considerate guide as well as being a great and helpful host to us.  
Anyone who has the chance to climb Mount Pico together with Steffi or her husband Nilton should take the opportunity.  
In any case, we can highly recommend it and will certainly never forget our night on the volcano.
Thanks a lot, Steffi!
reviews/14/text: I had the honour to experience a cave tour and a full day around Pico (including a hike). Hominis Natura is a very warm company with a high quality of client service, they really pay attention to what your interests are and manage to fullfil your highest expectations (no matter the weather circumstances). Steffi is very passionated about sharing her knowledge and that is inspiring to see and hear. It was a pleasure 🙏
reviews/14/title: A must when you're in Pico
reviews/15/text:
We contacted Steffi and ask here if she could organise us a tailor made day trip off Pico island.
And yes indeed she did.
We had a amazing and unforgettable day on the island. 
We visited the caves, lagoon, climb the mountain....
Steffi is a passionate and attentive tour guide.
We had great conversations with here and although she is not a native from the island,  she know quite a lot of it.
We thank you Steffi for this amazing day, and when we'll come back we will definitely book you again for new adventure 🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏
reviews/15/title: Amazing journey with Steffi a passionate tour guide on a magical island
reviews/16/text:
A friend of mine, who lives on Pico island, recommended to me to do activities with Hominis Natura. I really, trully , enjoyed it. They are very arranging, well equiped, careful about the weather conditions and very attentive to the people hiking with them (physical condition, gear, ...).

I did 2 activities : Climbing Pico and a Cave Tour.

Climbing Pico can be very tough for most of us and as much as it was impressive, i always felt secured. They really care and adapt their pace to the people. I also went down some amazing caves, Lava tunnels created during volcanic erruptions and it was mind blowing. Again here, i felt priviledge to be guided by someone so careful,  and very knowledgeable. 

Price wise, i think it was totally worth it and not expensive compared to other organizations. 

I really recommend Hominis Natura, you won't be disapointed !
reviews/17/text: We did the island tour and climbing Pico. Steffi and Nilton are very nice and know a lot about Pico. When our flight got cancelled Steffi was very flexible with the schedule and helpful to us. Great food, wine, views and company for two days! We strongly recommend you to go with Hominis Natura when you stay at Pico :)
reviews/18/text: Climbing Pico was on my wife's tdo list, but not all guides will take you up in February. Fortunately for us Steffi and Nilton offer climbs at this time of the year. On the day of the climb my wife had stomach issues but decided to try anyway. We were about 20 minutes into the climb when my wife decided she could not continue. (Turns out she had mild food poisoning.) Milton took her back down to the station and made sure she was well enough to drive back to the hotel. Steffi took the rest of us (two of us in all) to the top. The Katabatic winds racing down the slope were phenomenal and made the climb more challenging. We reached the summit of Piquino in under 3 hours and lunched on the lee side with the thermal vents offering us some heat. The trip down was a little more challenging since I had injured my lateral collateral ligament while snowboarding making each step  a new adventure in pain, but nothing you can do except grin and bear it. We made it down in just over two hours. Since I had now way to get back, Nilton and Steffi gave me a ride back to the hotel for which I was very grateful. It was overall an excellent adventure and Steffi and Milton are excellent guides. It is a technically challenging climb and you don’t want to fall because falling on lava rock will hurt badly so bring good boots.  Thanks Steffi and Nilton for a great climb.
reviews/18/title: Great challenging climb in fog and wind!
reviews/19/text:
We had a great time going all the way to the top of Pico - even though the climb is hard, specially on the way down! Steffi was super helpful from the start - we initally booked a night climb, but due to the strike with the ferry boats, we had to change it to a day climb. No problem! We met the dat after around 8.30 at Casa da Montanha (all hikers need to register there) and Steffi was waiting for us with extra gear - which basically saved us during the climb 😅😅 
The climb itself was very beautiful - Steffi always made sure we were feeling well, had enough water and were comfortable continuing (the weather was not the best on that day). She explained us the landscape and told us funny stories about previous hikes :) time flew by and when we noticed we could already see the top of the mountain. The last part you have to do proper climbing, but don't worry as Steffi will help you all the way. The view at the top is very beautiful (although it was quite cloudy, if you have lots of time in Azores - try to be flexible to get the best day to go all the way up). We had lunch at the top and Steffi had warm coffee with her - which was the best treat in the cold weather :)
The way down is a bit harder, you're feeling more tired, but it's equally beautiful. 
Thank you Steffi for taking us safely all the way to the top, all the amazing Açores tips and most of all for your good energy :)
Now we want to do it again, in a full blue sky day 😂🌞
reviews/19/title: Amazing climb all the way to Portugal’s highest peak - Piquinho!
subcategory_ranking: #5 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores

address: Rua Professor Doutor Jose de Almeida Pavao Jr, 13, Ponta Delgada, Sao Miguel 9500-381 Portugal
address_obj/street1: Rua Professor Doutor Jose de Almeida Pavao Jr, 13
description: Carpe Diem dream tours is a nature tourism company operating on Sao Miguel Island-Azores. We develop hiking activities in interpretive trails, observation of local fauna and flora and jeep tours. We are a dedicated team, seriously engaged in ensuring our clients a privileged contact with nature in a sustainable way, guaranteeing and promoting the conservation of ecosystems and biodiversity.
name: Carpe Diem dream tours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Private Full-Day 4x4 Tour to Furnas Volcano
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Seize your day in São Miguel with a 4x4 private tour
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Private Full-Day 4x4 Tour to Lagoa do Fogo & Lagoa das Sete Cidades
offer_group/offer_list/3/title: Private Full-Day 4x4 Tour to Sete Cidades Volcano
offer_group/offer_list/4/title: Private Full-Day 4x4 Tour to Nordeste & Povoaçao
photo/caption: Sete Cidades- Muro das sete janelas
reviews/0/text: We took 3 full days tours, and each of them was amazing. Jose is very knowledgeable and passionate, he just a very nice person, he truly loves the island, and passed this love to us. He showed us not only tourist attractions, but also a hidden jams. Our friends told us that Jose is great, but reality exceeded all the expectations. Highly recommend him.
reviews/1/text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our two full-day tours with Carpe Diem and our guide Jose Santos (we opted for private customized tours of Sete Cidades/Fogo on one day and Furnas on the other).  Jose (raised on Sao Miguel) gave us two wonderful days of amazing sightseeing with opportunities to taste local foods, experience a thermal bath, 4 WD accessible viewpoints... all while hearing about the history and culture of this special place....Jose's knowledge and genuine love for Sao Miguel is apparent....we both feel very fortunate we were able to spend this time with him.

Jeff and Ross, Honolulu Hawaii
reviews/2/text:
We enjoyed an amazing full day Jeep tour with Jose on San Miguel Island touring a good portion of the Island. I highly recommend this tour! The island and the tour were visually beautiful.  The pace of the tour was very well timed.  We were never rushed.  We moved slowly when there was something spectacular like a vista or the thermal baths, and quickly if something was less interesting.

Jose was an excellent host and guide and was very fun to be with.  He is super knowledgeable and experienced from history, geology, food, culture and life!  

We experienced great scenery, vistas, a short hike, a spectacular local lunch, multiple spring water tastings (who knew?), incredible thermal baths, a tea plantation and tasting, and lots and lots of history. If you go to San Miguel, please take this tour with Jose.  It was the best part of our 3 day stay on the island.  Thank you Jose!!!
reviews/3/text:
First of all; José is a Gentlemen and very kind and cautious to his clients. Absolutely knowledged about history, nature and current political situation, he act nearly as a wikipedia of the Azores. He listen to what his clients are looking for and does almost everything to please them. We have had a great day out with him and even extra service at the evening. I cannot judge other tour providers, but Carpe Diem and José seem to be perfect. Nothing else, but nothing less.

Muito obrigado José! Great day, great dinner at the location you recomended.

Ben & Michael
reviews/4/text: We just returned from a wonderful tour with José. Despite less than ideal weather conditions, he made the tour so interesting and fun. He must know every square inch of his beloved island! The vehicle is clean and comfortable and he adjusted our viewing locations based on the weather. We were very pleased with what we saw and the wealth of information we learned from this tour. I’d book again with Carol Diem in a heartbeat!
reviews/4/title: The Tour to Take on San Miguel
reviews/5/text:
I rarely write reviews but our experience was so good, I had to thank Jose and recommended him to anyone considering a tour on this beautiful island.

Our first private tour to Furnas was so good we had to book a further private tour to Sete Cidades a week later.

Everyone in our family could not speak highly enough of Jose and the effort he subtly put into our days to ensure we had the best possible experience. 

It was so relaxed and definitely went above and beyond any tour we have ever done.

Next time we are back in the Azores we will definitely be back in touch with Jose to arrange another tour.

Fist class

Thank you again Jose
reviews/5/title: Best tour you could ever take
reviews/6/text:
We enjoyed a fantastic and informative jeep tour around the beautiful island. We were limited by the time stipulation of our cruise ship but packed so much into the time we had. We would have loved to keep going, and one day we hope to return to see more. We will of course contact Carpe Diem Dream Tours again as it was faultless. Nothing was too much trouble.
The tour itself involved off roading In A jeep which was fun as well as allowing us access to the most beautiful sights of the island. 
I could not recommend this tour more highly.
reviews/7/text: This was an amazing experience. Beautiful scenery, very knowledge, personable guide making our tour very personalized. Even had walking sticks for some rough hiking terrain! Willing to take his time, picked up at location and flexible. Loved this tour! Worth every penny!
reviews/7/title: Beautiful views with amazing, flexible guide
reviews/8/text: My friend and I were lucky enough to do a full day tour with Jose and to be given a really unique perspective on the formation of the island and the history of Sao Miguel. Jose took us to soo many things we never would have known existed without him, including an incredible local lunch in a town inside of a crater. He is so knowledgeable and excited about sharing what he knows. He even added a stop at the end to the pineapple plantation because we had talked about it during the tour. I cannot more highly recommend going with this tour company. On top of being amazing it was also a really great price.
reviews/8/title: Amazing tour with a friendly guide
reviews/9/text:
This was one of the highlights for our entire trip to Azores. Jose, the owner of this company, and is a solo operator , was very accommodating, knowledgeable and extremely hospital person. We were lucky, since no other people joined us and the tour become a private. He mentioned at the beginning of the journey that his trip always are on guest's wishes, schedules, no rush. He showed all the interesting spots: we went to the peak of the volcano and observed the stunning views of the seven lakes drove to unpaved roads thanks to his superior 4X4 all-terrain Nissan while explaining the history, flora and fauna, traditions and current developments in St. Miguel. We have a great lunch the traditional Azores food wine, beer, etc. and then continued to the ocean part, Mosteiros where we were swimming in natural thermal pools with the direct access to the ocean - amazing experience, much better than Caldeira Velha we went their 2 days before this trip and were very disappointed. One interesting fact - since Jose spent almost his entire carrier as a supervisor for the local water authority, he showed us a couple of the water wells and explain how the whole system works - very insightful and interesting part of our journey with Jose. We were back to our hotel around 7:30-8.00 pm, and we very lucky to have this trip with Carpe Diem.

The only disappointment that we booked this trip as the last day before leaving San Miguel - the early dates were unavailable in Viator Jose is very popular and his trips are always in high demand. My advice to fellow travelers - you should book earlier in advance for the amazing experience.
reviews/9/title: Full day tour to Sete Cidades Volcano - amazing guide and tour
reviews/10/text: My friend and I were so, so happy we stumbled upon José’s tours as it was the best tour experience we could have had. As no one else booked José made even more effort to fit the day’s plans to us. He grew up on the island and is extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of São Miguel, from geology to wildlife to daily life and history. He is a genuinely lovely person and a wonderful storyteller. We felt thoroughly taken care of all day and appreciate his ‘no rush’ approach. On top of that we learned so much and explored so many places and views we never would have been able to do on our own with a rental car. We went on a full day Sete Cidades tour. The option for lunch is also well worth taking to taste a variety of delicious homemade style food.
reviews/11/text: I was so surprised at the diversity of Jose's knowledge and the tour's landscape. We went from a beautiful, picturesque church/lookout point to a lush tropical forest and then onto experiencing Portuguese food cooked from the volcano vents. The icing on the cake - swimming in the thermal waters. All this with a wonderful, friendly guide that became more like a friend by the end of the day. So worth every penny and more! Can't wait to go back and tour the rest of the island with Jose!
reviews/12/text: My two daughters and I spent a wonderful day with Jose. We saw, heard and experienced so much of the magic of the Azores through our friendly, informative and well prepared guide.
reviews/13/text:
Where to start on this incredible tour! Jose took us round Sette Cidettes and Lake Fogo - and it was simply the best tour I have ever been on. We had a very foggy day but the scenery was still beautiful. With the weather, it could have been a terrible tour due to most of the view points showing us nothing but fog. However, Jose took us to lots of seemingly unknown places inside both craters and we had some beautiful views with no one else around! Having a 4WD car also helped a lot. Jose was attentive, courteous and so unbelievably knowledgeable; we honestly learned so much on the tour and felt comfortable asking questions on everything from economics to environmental protection. Jose gave us space and time to explore and not once did we feel rushed or like we were an inconvenience. He discussed the itinerary with us and tailored it to our interests. Words cannot describe how great Jose was, he took care of us from 9am-7pm and kept us engaged the entire time. My partner and I feel so lucky to have found Carpe Diem Dream Tours, Jose's passion for his island shone through and made the tour truly magical. Jose was also prepared for everything and had towels water and cookies for us! The buffet we went to was delicious and Jose accompanied us round to tell us about all the dishes - how many tour guides would do that! 

I cannot recommend Carpe Diem Dream Tours enough, when my partner and I come back to the island, another tour with Jose will be our first stop.
reviews/14/text: Jose is a marvelous guide. You get history, ecology, geology, scenery, and a soak in a natural hot spring. Great tour. Highly recommended.
reviews/15/text: Great day trip! Soooooo much better than a bus tour. We were taken to places buses didn’t go and we’d never have found ourselves. We could stay as long as we liked in each place. We also were given lots of information by an enthusiastic local. Recommended! Thanks Jose! (Wish we’d had an extra day to go on a guided walk with you)
reviews/16/text: Jose offers it all: a genuine love for his island and a desire to share its beauty with his guests; a comprehensive knowledge from the flora and fauna to the geothermal and hydro energy; and a cheerful, warm personality. It was a pleasure spending the day with Jose. We highly recommend this tour for a most delightful and informative experience on the breathtaking island of Sao Miguel.
reviews/16/title: Perfect tour with the perfect guide!
reviews/17/text:
We have not long returned from a short stay in Ponta Delgada (our first time in the Azores) and what a memorable experience it was. We saw so much in four days and this just would not have been possible without the ‘man with the plan’, José. 

José knows all there is to know about his beautiful island and taught us so much that we would never have found out through self guided travel. He really brought trips to Furnas and Sete Cidades volcanic craters to life and went out of his way to ensure we had the best time possible, despite the sometimes inclement weather. 

A true gentleman and an expert tour guide. Thank you for making our stay a special one! 

Muito obrigado! 

G, H & Bump!
reviews/18/text:
I think we struck gold with Jose as a tour guide. He has a rich and varied knowledge of the Azoers arpegios and may well be the most congenial human I have ever met.

The tour is fantastic and beyond all expectation. He took care of the group and  noted and helped with everyone's  individual needs.

Our group was travelling with an 8 year old and he kept a sharp eye out for him and added in some priceless moments for the 8 year old.

The first day was so good we were lucky enough to get Jose to take us for the next day as well!
reviews/19/text: Two weeks in Portugal and this day was our highlight! Jose was the perfect guide. He was professional, polite, punctual, funny and incredibly intelligent. He shared so much of the history of the area and interesting facts of the volcanoes. We came away with such appreciation for the area. Our lunch was delicious and traditional food that one would find in their homes. We loved our dip in the thermal spa. The jeep is very comfortable and Jose took us on " roads" not passable in an average rental car so that we could have unbelievable views. If you do nothing else on Sao Miguel go on a tour with Carpe Diem. You will not be disappointed.
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Carpe Diem dream tours tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Rua do conselheiro Avelar n_40, Freguesia das Sete Cidades Number 40, Pico 9950-335 Portugal
address_obj/street1: Rua do conselheiro Avelar n_40, Freguesia das Sete Cidades
description: PICOmeUP is a travellers guidance service that is provided by locals professionals that were actually born and raised in the islands of Azores, Portugal. Therefore able to receive you and organically guide you and provide you the top experience in the mysterious Azores islands.
name: Pico Me Up
reviews/0/text:
Amazing experience. Manuel organized the tour super well and went the extra mile in order to accommodate our group. Special thanks to Sonia for leading our group up Mt Pico. You made our trip very special. 
We had a beautiful sunset and sunrise. Manuel provided us with hot tea and coffee. I can't recommend it enough.
reviews/1/text: This experience is a must you have to do if you go to Pico. An amazing adventure that makes every second  of life count.
reviews/2/text:
We were a small group of 7 people and the whole experience will be something I will never forget. 

We had a really experienced guide who provided us a lot of hig quallity gear for the overnight climb, sleep and morning descend. He was prepared to always lend a hand and go beyond tne norm to help us as a group.

The conditions were quite demanding and even though it was raining through the night the tent was amazing and the sleeping bags warm.

The morning sunrise was an extraordinary site, well worth the climb.
reviews/3/text:
Hiking Pico Mountain was simply incredible! 
Also Very challenging physically and mentally. Thankfully our guide Manuel made it easier for us with his experience and knowledge. 
The entire journey from beginning to end was surreal.
reviews/4/text: My husband and I did the overnight climb of Mount Pico. The experience was absolutely amazing from beginning to end. Amazing group and incredible instructors, Manuel and Richardo. We had a nice pace and they were very good at suiting the hike to the group, so that both those in good shape and those struggling had a nice trip. The gear was in really good condition and the general atmosphere was perfect. We can only recommend doing an overnight (night sky with the milky way was breathtaking).
reviews/5/text:
Pico Me Up wine tour is fantastic, it’s the best tour through Pico. Our tour was tailor made for us, making us feel instantly at home and in-love with the unique and magnificent island of Pico. The wine was good,  the places visited were amazing. David ensured that we felt welcome, and even introduced us to his beautiful family and welcomed us to his home - it’s like visiting friends on holiday. 
We truly loved the experience and can’t wait to visit Pico again.
reviews/6/text: My fiance and I did the overnight Pico hike. Definitely a challenging hike, but also very well worth it! The views of sunset and sunrise above the clouds were amazing. We had a good group to climb with and the guides were great (Manuel was our lead).
reviews/7/text:
I've constantly heard that climbing Pico was a must-do experience in the Azores, and I fully understand why. While the climb is relatively strenuous for unexperienced hikers / climbers, the guides are incredibly helpful and accommodating. My girlfriend and I booked the overnight climbing, and we're very happy we did so, as it was a memorable and one-of-a-kind experience.

I want to give due credit to our guides Tim and Manuel, who were remarkable and absolutely essential in having us make the most of this activity. Early on in the hike, my girlfriend felt the climb would be too strenuous on her, and Manuel understood and gladly walked us back. Before we made it back, he paused and said that, after observing us better, he felt the issue might simply have been that my girlfriend's backpack was too heavy. After splitting some of its heavier items in his own backpack and my own, he suggested for us to try doing a bit more of the hike upwards, and if after a particularly challenging part of it my girlfriend still felt she couldn't do it, he'd walk us all the way back. This made all the difference, and allowed us to eventually reach the top, so a big shout-out to Manuel for his care and attention with us.

The overnight climb also allowed us to truly make the most of being at the peak. We were unlucky on the way up, having had mostly foggy and cloudy views, but the sunrise was absolutely gorgeous, and we had enough time at the top of Piquinho to truly take in the view from all angles without many clouds obstructing our view.

The activity was a satisfying test of strength which rewarded us with spectacular views, and Manuel's additional surprise at the top made it all even better. Highly recommended!
reviews/7/title: Wonderful experience, and incredibly helpful guides
reviews/8/text: My girlfriend and I did the hike and overnight sleeping in the volcanic mountain crater of Pico, with Manuel as our guide. The adventure of a lifetime epic experience! Manual was the best guide we have ever had, professional, fun, caring and compassionate with attention to all the details needed for an exceptional experience! Don’t book with anyone else, he is the best!
reviews/9/text: Our adventure to the top of Pico was led by Manuel.  It was certainly a great adventure with new friends in our group.  Our gear was basically ready to go and Manuel used his experience to help us even more.  What to bring, what not to bring.  We were on our way and our guides plan worked.  You can do the hike without a guide but wow were we glad we had one.  Our overnight was amazing.  The sunset, the sunrise, the added treats and surprises were all awesome.  Manuel certainly knew what he was doing and he got us up, and down, safely.  If you are on the fence about a guide, use one, if you can't decide whether you want to do this as a day hike or an overnight, for sure go with the overnight.  Pico Me Up was amazing.  It was what we needed to make this strenuous hike enjoyable and memorable.  I've been off of the mountain for over a week and I still can't stop thinking about this trip.
reviews/10/text: Climbing Pico and staying overnight was hands down the best thing I did while travelling across the Azores - We were very lucky to have Manuel guiding us up the mountain too! 10/10
reviews/10/title: The one thing you need to do in the Azores!
reviews/11/text:
I can't recommend this excursion and this company enough. I did the overnight climb with Pico Me Up's guide Manuel Goulart where we camped up in the crater at the top of the mountain and then summited Pico Pequeno at sunrise the next morning.

Manuel was an amazing guide, he's close to climbing the mountain 300 times - and he is incredibly knowledgeable, patient, helpful, and all around good guy. I felt very safe and secure with him in charge and learned a lot from him about the mountain and Pico (he's had family there since the 1700s!).

At the start of the hike, it was raining on the mountain. Manuel recommended hold off starting and see if the weather would clear and in the meantime brought us to check out two nearby lava tube/caves which were insanely cool. An hour later, the mountain was cleared of rain and clouds and we got started. It was really the best call, I'm so glad I didn't have to camp in wet clothes. 

I'm in pretty good shape, I run a lot, but this is definitely a challenging hike - more challenging on the way down because of the steep/uneven terrain and loose rocks, along with a backpack holding sleeping bags/food/water etc. Definitely not for a novice!

The views of Pico and Faial, the insanely mars-like landscape of the mountain itself, the sunset, the stars, the view above the clouds - I can't express enough how amazing this experience was. I highly recommend it, and I highly recommend Pico Me Up.
reviews/11/title: Pico Overnight Climb: once-in-a-lifetime experience with pico me up
reviews/12/text:
Would recommend the Pico Night Climb with Pico Me Up to anyone looking to for an amazing experience in the Azores.

Manuel is an experienced and passionate mountain guide, putting your personal experience and safety first at all times.

Due to worse weather conditions than expected, Manuel recommended us to postpone our climb by 1 night based on the conditions at the mountain itself.

Wisely choosing the route and guiding us up with great energy, we were happy customers at the top.

Everything was arranged perfectly in terms of gear (incl. crampons for icy conditions) by Manuel, offering us a nice hot coffee during a magical sunset.

Bottom-line is definitely that Pico Me Up should be your go-to guide at the Pico vulcano!
reviews/13/text: I definitely recommend the night climb! It was   worth booking it and cutting some sleep for sure ! I really felt save and the sunrise was amazing.
reviews/14/text:
One of the best experiences during our stay.
Booking was quick and easy. Great website.

The guide was super nice, layed back and really good to talk to.
We were picked up at our hotel by a comfortable car prepared with everything needed for the tour. 
Even though it was Sunday we got a tour personally tailored to us. The dude was very knowledgeable about everything Pico and took us to some cool museums and to some really awesome local and somewhat secret destinations. 
We learned so much about culture, people and history of the island. 

They had a lunch in a local restaurant planned, and to finish the trip took us to a small and really good winery.

ALL THE ENTRY FEES, FOOD, WINE AND CHEESE WERE INCLUDED IN THE PRICE! 

10 out of 10! Me and my wife will be back in springtime and we will definitely check out the boat tour by Pico Me Up then.
reviews/15/text: Manuel was a great guide and sleeping at the top is amazing. The views and the sky full of stars are beautiful.
reviews/15/title: Great hike with sky full of stars
reviews/16/text: Great local guides, super friendly, not looking just for the money (contrary to other companies). Climbed to the top of the mountain with overnight stay in a group of 3 people plus the guide. Really worth the money for the amazing experience! Highly recommended!
reviews/16/title: Amazing climb and overnight stay at Pico
reviews/17/text: I wanted to do something exceptional for my birthday and climbing up Mont Pico turned out to be one of the most memorable moments of my life. Spending the night in the middle of this gigantic crater is an out-of-this-world experience. Views are literally breathtaking, your senses are shaken up by so much beauty. It is also a very humbling and meditating experience that reminds you how small and vulnerable you are and creates shared bonding moments. You are on the top of the tallest volcano in the Atlantic Ocean! A few words on our guide, Manuel - his passion for ‘his’ volcano is infectious, his calmness is reassuring, his knowledge is enlightening, his kindness is everything. Climbing up (and down) in his steps makes the journey meaningful, and even more beautiful.
reviews/18/text: Manuel was a really valuable guide up the Mountain and really helpful as well. Very nice and also easy going. Would definitely say that Pico Me Up is the guiding to go for in Madalena
reviews/19/text: In February 2020 my family went to Pico where my great great grandfather was born. We had a blast with Manny from Picomeup. I am 11 years old and learned a lot of history about the island. We had a day full of going to some cool vineyards and Manny taught me how to build a stone wall. I also went on a wind mill and he brought us to a museum where we saw a cool whaling ship and hunting weapons. I was able to bring up water from an old well in a bucket . He showed us a museum full of wine with an awesome old truck. He spent a lot of time with me and was the nicest person in the world. He even got me to try lapas and I am picky

address: Rua do Areeiro 52 Fazenda, Santa Cruz das Flores, Flores 9970-243 Portugal
description: WestCanyon Tourism Adventure, is a company that works on Flores Island - Azores - Portugal.Our Goal is to show this lost paradise in a very different way to those who love mixing NATURE and ADRENALINE in a safe way!Come and have fun with our products:- Canyoning;- Jeeptours;- Trekking;- Corvo Discovery;Enjoy LIFE, enjoy NATURE!
location_string: Santa Cruz das Flores, Flores, Azores
name: WestCanyon Turismo Aventura
reviews/0/text: We had a great experience all in all. Marco ist a fun Guy who explains everything really well. Thanks again!
reviews/1/text: We went canyoning for the first time, but had done some abseiling before, so we did level 2. The experience was amazing. Marco is a great guide. You could really tell he knew what he was doing, so we felt completely safe the whole time. Next to that he was joking around, telling stories and also being serious when necessary. We had the best day and would highly recommend to do this activity with Marco.
reviews/2/text:
It was the first time canyoning for my girlfriend and me. It was great! If someone has problems with heights or fears, Marco stays calm and relaxed, smiling at you and understands how to handle this without pressure, to make it a great experience for everyone. 
If you are the next time on Flores i greatly recommend to do it! For me: 100% will do it again!

PS: Even if you hit him in the face he stays friendly and laughs! Sorry again for that - sometimes long limbs are more in the way than they are helpful - especially on narrow cliffs xD
reviews/2/title: Great experience and very professional, polite and helpful!
reviews/3/text: I went with a friend and we both had zero experience doing this type of activity so we were a bit anxious… But we felt super safe throughout the whole course and we loved the experience! The course was amazing and in the end we wanted to do it again 😁
reviews/4/text: Again thank you for this nice experience we are very lucky to do this with you! Warm regards from a lovely singing MAN and me :D
reviews/5/text: Marco is very helpful. He picked me up in the town, provided a great service during and after the trip and even took the effort and looked up the photos from the canyoning when after a few months I realized that I lost them.
reviews/6/text: An unforgettable experience with Marco. Highly recommended , very professional. Well organised and a great fun day.
reviews/7/text: It was very cool and fun. The waterfalls are beautiful and the equipment is very comfortable. My first time canyoning and it was very nice experience!
reviews/7/title: First time canyoning and very nice!
reviews/8/text: We did Level 1 Canyoing as it was our first time. It was a lot of fun and adventurous and challenging at some points. We highly recommend this adventure in Flores! Thanks to Hugo for the good guiding and see you next time for the next level ;-)
reviews/9/text: Such an awesome and fun filled experience! The guides were very knowledgeable and very funny! Not only that, but they got back to me right away when I contacted them and were very understanding when the ATM ran out of cash where we were staying. We had to arrive a bit late to make a quick stop in another town on the way and their entire vibe was “tranquilo, relax, it’s gonna be a great day!” Thank you guys!!!
reviews/9/title: Funny and knowledgeable guides for a great experience!
reviews/10/text: My best canyoning experience so far! Very helpful guide and speaks fluent english. The activites were fun and the place is nice.
reviews/11/text: We had an amazing canyoning trip with Marco , he is super professional and made  the experience both safe and fun
reviews/12/text:
The canyoning was really fun. They take loads of pictures during the experience of you and the group …. so you don’t have to worry about your own camera. 
BUT, YOU NEVER GET YOUR PICTURES… 2 stars only for this broken promise to send you pictures if you email them your email and the date you went. We emailed 3 times and messaged on WhatsApp.  It has been 2 months and NO PICTURES.
reviews/12/title: They take photos that you NEVER get, canyoning itself is cool.
reviews/13/text: Incredible experience canyoning with Marco, really friendly and professional guide. One if not the best thing we did during our stay in the Azores. 100% recommended you will not regret going to explore the waterfalls with Marco.
reviews/14/text: We had a great experience doing canyoning with guys of West Canyon! It was our first time and it has been really fun. We were a small group (8 persons) with two funny and professional instructors (Marco & Hugo), who helped us at all time and make the experience better 💪
reviews/15/text: Canyoning level 1, we had already had a good experience with canyoning at Ribeira dos caldeiroes, here was very good too, Hugo und Marcos were very cautious, friendly and funny! We had a wonderful time, absolutely recommended!
reviews/16/text: An amazing experience in an unbelievably lush and beautiful natural setting! Canyoning with accredited guide Marco and Hugo was so much fun! We felt confident and safe in their instruction and guidance as well. Truly a unique, well-planned adventure with a mixture of rappelling and jumps. There were a variety of ages amongst the group. Don’t miss this opportunity of a lifetime in this paradise called Flores!
reviews/17/text:
Very good, catered to whole group of different levels to make sure everyone was comfortable, would do next level if I was staying longer!

Definitely recommend to all visiting Flores - perfect on rainy days too
reviews/18/text:
It was my first time canyoning, and I loved the experience. Marco and Hugo are great people, and very experienced making it a safe experience for everyone involved.
I will definitely return and book with them again.
reviews/19/text: I am not an adventure sports woman, I am afraid of heights and only wanted to accompany my daughter canyoning, but Marco and Hugo are not only very professional, they also create an excellent group atmosphere and patiently support you with everything you need on your way through the river!  Thus, this tour was a great pleasure for us. Canyoning for all! The slogan really applies! Thank you for this extraordinary experience! Sigrid and Amelia
reviews/19/title: Feel the river - a wonderful nature experience!

address: Praia da Vitoria, Terceira 9700-187 Portugal
description: ComunicAir is an active tourism company based in Terceira Island, Azores. We organize nature activities in Azores all year round: Walking tours, 4x4 Tours, Bike Tours, Sea Kayaking, Relaxing Programs, Birdwatching and Hot Air Ballooning. We do not just organize tours, we do not just guide people, our team really wants to share with you the wonderful experience of living in this magical place, this set of islands lost in the middle of the Atlantic. We want to show you everything we know, because we believe that sharing is the best experience. We're passionate about Azores, and happy to guide each and every client from start to finish. There is so much to do with us in Azores!
name: ComunicAir
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Patchwork Bike Ride
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Wine and Vineyards Hike
photo/caption: sea kayaking at Praia da Vitória Bay

reviews/0/text: An excellent walk with Isobel, which provided a great introduction to the island and some views which we certainly wouldn't have seen otherwise. Great value.
reviews/1/text:
Ok, first, I fell in love with this island, Terceira, the moment I landed! Not sure why, but I just did! We had another full day tour planned and it did not disappoint! 

I’ll focus on highlights from the day because I can’t fit everything we did into this one review!

Gabriele Vergani picked us up at 9am for a our tour and if you have a chance to request him as your guide in Terceira I highly recommend him! He personalized our day and was so knowledgeable about everything we asked...which is a challenge since I’m a biologist and ask some pretty crazy questions! Lol

1.) Monte Brasil - the views from this location were spectacular and driving through the gate to get up there was intense! I didn’t realize there was a guard, etc. Cool to see! 

2.) Natural pools in Biscoitos - we were there in October so the surf was huge! The only thing that changed was that we couldn’t get in the pools! But it didn’t change the scenery which was amazing! The surf crashing over the pools was beautiful! Totally worth the visit no matter the time of year!

3.) traditional food at Ti Choa - I can’t tell you the name of everything we ate because we tried 4 traditional dishes; one of which was Alcatra and it was sooo good!! It was all amazing! We had an amazing, hilarious waiter too! I only wish I would have gotten his name because he was great! 

4.) Algra do Carvao - this place was beyond words! To be inside an extinct volcano was humbling! It’s one of those things you have to experience for yourself! AND, our guide was not too embarrassed to be around us when we took out our travel pig! Lol

5.) Weird highlight for me was when a local was moving his goats right along the main road! Lol they just laid right down in the middle of the road! So cool to see this part of everyday life! 

There were so many other things we did throughout the day, but I can’t write about it all here! Amazing day overall!
reviews/2/text: We had a really good day touring Terceira with Tiago, his enthusiasm and knowledge of the island was exceptional and made for a memorable day. We felt that he had all the time in the world for us, and we appreciated his sense of humour too.
reviews/3/text:
Nous avons passé 2 magnifiques excursions avec Tiago : tour en 4x4 de l'ile avec une multitude de visites et d'anecdotes et un somptueux pique-nique au coucher de soleil. Cadre idyllique certes, mais cela n'aurait été rien sans Tiago. Il nous a partagé sa passion pour l'Ile et ses endroits secrets, magiques et magnifiques.
Sans hésité l'un des plus beaux moments de notre vie, dans le top 3 ! Ce pique-nique au milieu des kagarus aura été un moment de pur émerveillement ! Merci beaucoup Tiago, on reviendra !
reviews/4/text:
Formidável ...!
Não tenho palavras para agradecer a atenção, o cuidado e o profissionalismo da ComunicAir na pessoa do Tiago. Excelente guia, atencioso e muito participativo no grupo; sempre com algo para ensinar sobre os lugares visitados!
Recomendo vivamente!
Paulo Silva
Portugal
reviews/5/text: Tiago Fortuna nos hizo una excelente visita de día completo por toda la isla de Terceira. No sólo explica lo que ves, sino que te hace comprenderlo. Un excelente guía, de los mejores que hemos tenido. Cuando te explican bien las cosas, te gustan más y eso fue lo que nos pasó en Terceira. De las cuatro islas que visitamos, fue la que más me gustó, simplemente porque me pareció conocerla a fondo mejor. Felicidades.
reviews/6/text: Ben wezen hiken en heb een 4x4 tour gedaan met comuniciar.Deze waren fantatisch georganiseerd en je komt op plekken waar je normaal niet komt.Ben verder door hun goed geholpen om de wandelingen die ik zelf heb gemaakt te vinden.
reviews/6/title: wat een mooie dagen heb ik beleefd met comunicair
reviews/7/text: Hicimos una visita guiada a Terceira en un Jeep 4x4 con Tiago como guía y estuvo genial. Los parajes estupendos, las vistas geniales, todo el día estuvo muy bien organizado. La visita al interior del volcán espectacular. Pero queremos destacar la gran profesionalidad de Tiago, además de ameno, tiene un gran conocimiento de la historia de las islas, lo cual fue intercalando en diferentes zonas de la misma, dando un carácter diferente y único al Tour. Además todo ello en un perfecto castellano.
reviews/8/text: 4x4 tour over het eiland geboekt bij Tiago. Kleine groep, erg aardige gids en hij weet van alles over het eiland. Op elke vraag had hij een antwoord, we hebben veel geleerd over vulkanen en het eiland én over de geschiedenis van de eilanden, heerlijk gegeten, het was een topdag. Ook aan te raden als je maar een paar dagen op het eiland verblijft, aangezien Tiago zorgt dat je een goed overzicht krijgt van het eiland.
reviews/8/title: 4X4 tour over eiland, geweldige en leerzame dag!
reviews/9/text:
We hebben 3 excursies geboekt bij Tiago. De 4x4 tour is aan te raden voor iedereen, en neemt je mee langs veel interessante punten van het eiland. Tiago - de gids - heeft enorm veel kennis, is super vriendelijk en een enorm toffe gids om de dag mee door te brengen. Tijdens de tour kom je op verschillende toeristische plekken die door zijn uitleg wat extra diepgang krijgen, maar ook op de wat minder bekende plekken zodat je het eiland écht leert kennen.

Daarnaast ook een wandelexcursie bij hem geboekt naar de Santa Barbera (hoogste berg/vulkaan van het eiland) en een mountainbiketour. De wandelroute is niet heel zwaar, maar vanwege het hoogteverschil niet aan te raden voor mensen die slecht te been zijn. Wel enorm leuk te doen: je doet een picknick met Tiago op het hoogste punt van het eiland met een uitzicht om 'u' tegen te zeggen.

De mountainbiketour was mijn favoriet. De route is zo'n 8 kilometer maar door het hoogteverschil best pittig. De natuur, het uitzicht en het gezelschap maken het wel 100% waard. Hoogtepunt tijdens deze tour was 'de Playground'; een oude steengroeve wat tegenwoordig op een soort skatepark lijkt. Zelfs voor beginnende mountainbikers is dit een mooie manier om jezelf een pro te wanen op de mountainbike.

Als je Terceira bezoekt en je geen excursie boekt bij ComunicAir, heb je eigenlijk een verloren vakantie. Tiago is hét voorbeeld voor wat een gids moet zijn: enorm vriendelijk met een boel kennis en humor.
reviews/9/title: 4x4 tour, hiken en mountainbiken met een top gids!
reviews/10/text:
wij hebben 4x4tour  met nog een dame van over de 80 jaar geboekt bij Tiago en dit was een bijzonder en fijne dag. Tiago heeft ons veel verteld over het Eiland en de flora en fauna, hier hebben wij veel van opgestoken. deze info was erg handig voor de andere Eilanden die wij hebben gezocht. Het was echt een fijne dag met prettig gezelschap!

Ook hebben wij nog een wandeling geboekt van een halve dag en dit was echt heel bijzonder om met Tiago als gids de wandeling te maken.

Tiago dank je wel voor deze twee bijzondere dagen en deze ervaring!!
reviews/10/title: Wij hebben twee trips geboekt bij Tiago en dit waren twee fantastische dagen en een TOP GIDS!
reviews/11/text:
Unser Guide Tiago hat es geschafft, eine unvergessliche Tour zu kreieren. Er macht die Dinge anders und besser :andere Route und einige zusätzliche Stopps, die alle sehr sehenswert sind. Das Wissen über seine Heimat wirkt, als ob er unendlich viele, neue Infos wiedergeben kann..... Außerdem merkt man ihm an, dass er mit ganzem Herzen bei der Sache ist.

Der beste Guide, den wir auf den Azoren hatten.
reviews/12/text: Difficile de se faire un véritable avis. Avant d’arriver à Terceira et au moment où je préparais mes futures excursions, j’ai pris contact le 26/03/2018 avec la société Cominicair car j’ai intéressée par leurs 4X4 Tours. Je n’ai JAMAIS eu la moindre réponse de leur part. Autre tentative aussi par mail, aucune réponse non plus. De même via les réseaux sociaux (toujours le 26/03/2018) et leur compte Instagram, pareil pas de réponse. Cependant, la personne derrière leur compte a pris le temps de regarder une de mes stories puisque ça apparaît son mon profil. Après 3 tentatives infructueuses, j’ai préféré laisser tomber, visiblement c’etait Trop leur en demander. Une fois arrivée à Terceira, je suis donc passée par d’autres prestataires. Problème de communication? Ou volonté délibérée de ne pas répondre? Je n’en sais rien. Une chose est certaine, ce n’est pas du tout professionnel. Précision importante : je n’ai rien contre cette société et je dispose de tous mes échanges justifiant de ce que j’avance. Il semble préférable d’aller directement à leur rencontre à Terceira que de les contacter au préalable. Dommage.
reviews/12/title: Injoignable et ne répond pas aux mails
reviews/13/text: Tiago houdt van het eiland en weet er veel over te vertellen, hij brengt je naar plekjes die je zelf met een gehuurde auto niet gevonden zou hebben.  Met een prima lunch helemaal af.
reviews/14/text:
O tour da ComunicAir leva-nos a passear durante um dia pela Ilha Terceira como quem folheia as páginas de um livro, página a página, sem pressas, com rigor, informalidade e pormenores de simpatia surpreendentes.
À beleza espetacular da paisagem, junta-se o conhecimento de quem conhece o terreno como a palma da mão.
É dada atenção ao património natural, aos monumentos históricos, à gastronomia… a tudo aquilo que vai despertando a curiosidade ao longo do caminho. Uma experiência para todas as idades. Muito especial. Obrigado.
reviews/15/text:
Auch wir waren im Rahmen einer Kreuzfahrt auf Terceira und hatten vorab die 4x4 Tagestour bei Tiago gebucht. Wegen schlechtem Wetter wurde bei unserer Tour die Reihenfolge der Inseln getauscht. Tiago hat es trotzdem möglich gemacht, dass wir unsere Tour machen konnten.
Obwohl wir zwischendurch auch mal richtig nass geworden sind, hatten wir viel Spaß bei der Tour. Die riesigen Bäume,  die vielen Kühe, die wundervolle Küstenlandschaft, das leckere Mittagessen, viele Informationen zu Land und Leuten und zum Schluss das kleine Picknick in der Sonne - für uns der perfekte Tag!
Vielen Dank, dass die Tour auch an dem Tag möglich war!
reviews/15/title: Ein toller Tag auf einer wunderschönen Insel
reviews/16/text:
...trekking,  aventura, sensaciones y experiencias.
Profesionales 10. Un lujo de viaje y emociones 😊
reviews/17/text:
En petit comité de 4 personnes, notre guide Sophie nous a fait découvrir tous les secrets de Terceira et ce à travers un tour intégral.
Passionnée et amoureuse de l'île, nous avons découvert de nombreux sites et points de vue face à la mer. Durant ce voyage, nous avons pu découvrir les volcans, les routes bordées d’hortensias et le site fantastiques de biscoitos avec sa baignade.
Je ne peux que vous recommandez cette excursion si vous désirez en apprendre plus sur la culture et l'histoire de l'île. Encore un tout grand merci à toi Sophie pour cette journée dont nous garderons un excellent souvenir.
reviews/18/text:
Een hele mooie dag gehad met de 4 x 4. Onze gids Sophie neemt echt de tijd om je van alles te laten zien en is altijd bereid e.e.a. uit te leggen. 

Ook hebben we een easy walk gedaan met Sophie. We hebben de zwarte lavastroom en de rode lavastroom gezien en natuurlijk heel veel groen.

Het is echt de moeite waard om met deze organisatie een uitstapje te maken.
reviews/18/title: Geweldige dag gehad met de 4x4 tour over het eiland & een mooie wandeling gemaakt (halve dag)
reviews/19/text: wundervolle Tour, weil Sophie alles so engagiert erklärte und auf unsere Wünsche einging. Sie liebt diese Insel und hat uns so auch in deren Bann gezogen. die Stopps waren so hervorragend ausgesucht und Sophies Art hat allem noch das Besondere gegeben. Es war die beste Tour, die wir jemals gemacht haben. Merci beaucoup Sophie!
