address: Cais de Santa Cruz Marina da Horta, Horta, Faial Island 9900-172 Portugal
animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
description: Azores Experiences is the result of a rebranding of "HortaCetaceos Whale & Dolphin Watching", island of Faial, city of Horta. Our goal is to to deliver our guests amazing life changing experiences. And, as complement we offer also land based activities, such as Jeep Tours, Hiking Tours and City Tours around Horta. Harmony within the Nature, deep and real connection with the surrounding wild, is reached by shear passion and love. At Azores Experiences, we simply do our best to surpass our customers' expectations... so don't wait anymore, take the gap leap and join us for an unbelievable adventure, in Land or out on the Ocean!
name: Azores Experiences
ranking: #10 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #10 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text:
Absolutely gorgeous day! It was a sunny morning and we were out by 10am, blazing through the slightly choppy Atlantic  blue waves, to soon encounter a group of dolphins, so called Common Dolphin, playful fun-loving bunch! We then got tipped that a whale was spotted far out and patience was required, to finally see the magesttic and magnificent Blue Whale, what a reward! 
Big thanks to Pedro, Marta, Elena and Roni. Hope to see you guys back in September! 😀
reviews/1/text: We had a wonderful tour and saw dozens of spermwhales and delfins. Some how Pedro and his team managed to get our boat out to groups of whales socialising much earlier than the boats from other tours, so we could enjoy the view quietly. Maria, the marine biologist on board provided clear and interesting details on all sea life. Really a truest recommendable experience!
reviews/2/text: We had an excellent experience with this tour. Both Marta, our guide, and Pedro, our skipper, were very informative and made for an entertaining tour. We were quite fortunate in seeing many different animals, and they were great at describing what it was we were seeing and knew how to fill the time in between sightings. The views of the islands alone were worth the boat ride out. Highly recommend!
reviews/3/text:
Once again Pedro and his team have provided a superb afternoon of whale watching. 
The team are all enthusiastic and knowledgeable, sharing information and making sure everyone on the boat was getting the best out of the trip. 
I know you don’t always get to see very much, but today was exceptional. 
Dolphins galore, 4 types of whale ( including Pedros beloved humpbacks) & a blue shark. 
Just to see the humpback breaching once was worth the trip, but it was showing off and did it several times.
reviews/4/text: We had a fantastic experience in Faial with the team of Azores Experiences. We did a whale and dolphin watching tour and we had the opportunity to see multiple species of dolphins and multiple sightings of a sperm whale. It was an unforgettable experience. We particularly appreciated that the team was very knowledgeable, professional and very respectful of the sea life and animals wellbeing. The crew was also super fun and made sure that everybody enjoyed the time with them. We highly recommend this company!
reviews/5/text:
It was just an amazing experience. Maria and Pedro were super nice.
Absolutely suggested. You cannot miss it if you are in Fajal.
reviews/6/text: A shout out to our tour guide Hugo for an amazing experience of our day touring the Island of Fayal with my friends. Hugo was knowledgeable, helpful, entertaining, and he provided the full experience of life on an island in the Azores. By far the best tour of the entire vacation. I would not hesitate to ask for Hugo if you are planning to book a tour with Azores Experiences.
reviews/7/text: Great jeep tour with our guide Hugo. He was extremely nice and explained a lot of interesting things about the island, its history and life. The tour was flexible and adapted very well to our preferences, and Hugo’s choices of what to visit were perfect. Would recommend 100%.
reviews/7/title: Great jeep tour with our guide Hugo, would recommend a 100%
reviews/8/text:
I took "Excursão de Dia Inteiro - Ilha do Faial" with Hugo as a guide and I can assure you that it was an authentic journey to the volcanic and cultural history of Faial Island. 

Congratulations
reviews/9/text: Fantastic trip today with Leandro. Very knowledgeable and passionate guy. Showed us everything we wanted to see and knew the answers to all of our questions. Would highly recommend.
reviews/10/text: What a great day with Hugo - we experienced a lot about Faials history and were lucky to see a lot of remote places around the whole island even though the weather condition was against us. Had a great lunch in a family run restaurant with very good food and wine - whats not to like. Go and try it yourself 😍
reviews/10/title: Warm, friendly and very skilled guide
reviews/11/text: Day-long tour of Faial Island with Hugo. Highlights included the caldeira and Capelinhos. High clouds meant the view of the caldeira was perfect and the light exceptional for photography. Azores Experiences use Land Rovers, which meant we crossed the island on tracks as well as roads thus increasing the fun but also giving us some sightseeing opportunities we would have missed in a regular vehicle. Final stop was the exceptional Volcano Interpretation Centre of Capelinhos. Don’t miss this for an appreciation not just of an important event in the recent history of Faial but also for a deeper understanding of the unique character of the Azores. Last but certainly not least, a big thank you to Hugo for his knowledge and insight as well as his warmth and friendliness.
reviews/12/text: Just had an amazing jeep tour of the island of Faial expertly navigated by Leandro. He was very welcoming and extremely knowledgeable. We were taken to many parts of the island and some great view points culminating in a visit to capelinhos museum. We feel that we have seen all parts of the island and would recommend this company to everybody.
reviews/13/text:
We visited Pedro and his crew twice on our holiday in June, and both times had an amazing trip. Before heading out on the RIB we had a talk about what we might see and what to expect, it was very educational. We were told that it was going to be a rough ride but we were asked before we went out if we would be ok with that, if not we could go another day. We decided to risk it, luckily we wore  the waterproofs provided by them so stayed dry. I have a bad hip but that was not a problem as Pedro and a member of his crew made sure I was helped on and off the boat safely, which meant a lot to me.  We saw sperm whales, hundreds of dolphins and a turtle. The next time we went out we added a blue shark and flying fish to the list of whales, dolphins and another turtle. 
Pedro is sensitive to the safety of his passengers and to the wildlife we saw. He never chased the wildlife and stayed a safe distance away so as not to frighten it. 
This was not our first trip with Pedro, we had been out with him 5 years ago, and because of his enthusiasm and awareness of the ocean  and his dedication to deliver an amazing experience we will definitely visit him again next time we are in the Azores.
reviews/14/text:
To bad I can only give 5 stars.
I forgot the count of my trips with Pedro and his experienced crew, but coming over to Faial from the Netherlands especially for Azores Experiences, should say enough. To find whales and dolphins in the big ocean you have to rely on the knowledge and expertise of a good skipper. Pedro Filipe has amazed me every time I went on a trip with him and it has been worth the money every time. Because Azores Experiences is a small company they have excellent care and attention to all the people on the boat that can transport a group of 12/14. Which is also the amount I would recommend for a special and occasional moment like this. I also recommend everyone that visits Faial to go on a trip with Pedro.
Or advise people who wants to go whale watching to visit Faial and ask for Pedro. Rather have a good small professional company then a professional good looking company. But Azores Experiences also looks good.
reviews/15/text:
We spent two days with Pedro and Hugo. 

Pedro took us out in a fast boat across the bay to the other side of Pico island to look for whales and dolphins. 

The ride was thrilling but the equipment provided kept us dry. We saw the same whale twice but almost as beautiful were the groups of spotted dolphins who came up close to our boat. 

The next day we spent the day with Hugo in a Jeep. The itinerary had to change so that we were able to see the magnificent caldera. The visit to the exhibition in the lighthouse at Capelinhos was enhanced by Hugo our guide. The off road trips were excellent. The buffet lunch was filling. Hugo did an excellent job of guiding in Portuguese and English. 

I would have no hesitation in recommending this company.
reviews/16/text: Well organized boat trip and not limited to exactly the advertised hours, in fact our trip was one hour longer than planned just to spot one more whale. Good after service by providing foto's of the tour upon request, free of charge. And there foto's are significant better than the average foto we could make of the whales and dolphins.
reviews/16/title: Dolphins and sperm whale safari around Faial and Pico
reviews/17/text:
Amazing company, easy 5 stars! I don't use to write many reviews but I want to support these guys as much as I can.
We had one tour with them after a couple of days of uncertainty due to bad weather conditions, and it was so great that we decided to double down the next day (our last one in Faial), which was even greater. We saw and learned so many things (I won't get into detail here, as each and every tour is different from the others and I'd rather not to create any expectations). Pedro and his stuff are passionate and careful professionals, very respectful both of their customers and of the sea life. And they are extremely nice and fun guys! The best thing you can do if you are in Horta is getting in touch with these people and spending some time with them. And who knows? You may be lucky enough to see a whale breach... or even better, getting unexpectedly to learn some enlightening gem about whales and glue (Pedro you know what I mean! :) ). THANK YOU GUYS!
reviews/18/text: We had a fantastic day tour on Faial! Our guide Leandro was very friendly and helpful. He adjusted the tour according to  the weather conditions, so in the end we managed to see the view points we could not go to in the morning due to heavy fog. He also took extra time so we could go up to the Caldeira. The lunch place had an amazing view and delicious food. All in all he really made the most out of the day and we had a wonderful experience!
reviews/19/text:
With a little patience in the early morning, until the fog dissipates, we had a  nice observation trip  : sperm whales, communs dolphins, bottlenose dolphins. These are resident species (june is too late for whale migration period).
Thanks to Maria, the marine biologist, for her explanations, to Mauro, the skeaper to find so well places to observe, thanks to the whole team for its involvement  in environmental issues and the protection of the ocean.

description: We are a team of Researchers, Field Biologists from the Univ. of Lisbon and the Azores and local Nature Park Guides, working on land and marine environments for more than 10 years. We found a way to stay close to wildlife, and improve tourism experiences, bridging Science & Tourism. Azores Naturalist Team is based Faial, operating Faial, Pico and Sao Jorge Island where the natural history and the local culture are live. Whale watching, Bird watching, Walking, Hikings, Jeep or Van Tours, private or large groups, tell us what you have in mind, our job is to help you have a great vacation! Every ticket contributes 10% for the NGO AtlanticNaturalist.org and environmental data is collected on every tour (whales, bats, sharks, seabirds, etc).
name: Naturalist - Science & Tourism
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Explore Faial with a Biologist - Half Day 4h
photo/caption: Cachalote a saltar. 1 em cada 10 avistamentos de cachalotes observamos saltos de animais. Para comunicação, divertimento ou para remoção de parasitas, tudo são boas razões para um salto destes monstros marinhos. Tenha a câmara a postos!
ranking: #9 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores

reviews/0/text:
I went whale watching with Naturalist, and it was the best experience I could ever have. 
We saw different species of dolphins and sei whales and the team told us a lot of information and curiosities about them.
All the service was really well organized and this company has an amazing team, with biologists that love their work and guide us with an amazing energy.
reviews/1/text: My favorite part of the experience was without a doubt the scientific component associated with observing these incredible animals. I saw common dolphins, turtles, birds and Portuguese man of war, but the most impressive of all was the sighting of the blue whale without a doubt.  During the visit, Gisela explained a little more about the lives of these animals and what kind of data Naturalist collects so that we can learn a little more about them. I really enjoyed it and totally recommend it!
reviews/2/text: Our family did a private tour with Marco and Josue, and we were not disappointed. We picked this group because they offer the opportunity to do research if it presents its self. They are more than just a boat, and company making money off tourists. They are marine biologists from the University in Portugal, it’s educational, mixed with your vacation. They talked to us about what we could possibly see, sperm whales, and common dolphin.  Going with low expectations as it was migrating season yet we still saw 8 sperm whales, swam with a pod of 150+ dolphins and THEN came across a sea turtle. Here’s where it go incredible...we got to bring her into our boat, measure her shell, and head, tag her and then released her back home. They will now be able to study Lucy, and see where the Atlantic takes her. Truly incredible, and educational experience. HIGHLY recommend.
reviews/3/text:
Excellent team that cares about people, science and nature and of course providing their guests with a fantastic experience (in our case the whale and dolphin observation) while protecting animals and landscapes. 
On top, they dedicate 10% of the fees (upon the customer‘s approval) to research and thus, support marine biology students in their field of work! 
That‘s how it should be done.
reviews/3/title: Highly motivated and skilled team providing a fantastic whale and dolphin observation expedition.
reviews/4/text: Whale watching with Naturalist was a revelation of the teeming ocean, thanks to this first class team of biologists. Not only did we see the animals close to but we learnt a lot about them. We passed through a large school of bottle nosed dolphins, first the males, then the females and young. Spotters from land helped us to a sperm whale cow and her calf, magic to know she was breastfeeding the calf while resting at the surface then watch her dive with iconic tail leaving her young above for safety. Then a school of smaller spotted dolphins, then on to a sei whale, and finally a lone, probably male, sperm whale. The albatrosses and shearwaters all added to the atmosphere.
reviews/4/title: A high point in my travelling life
reviews/5/text: I went whale watching several times during my vacation and it was an experience every time. Each tour was so different and individual because you never knew what nature is like today and I learned more and more about the animals. I can only recommend to go several times with them and I will definitely come back. Thank you Naturalist Team for the amazing time
reviews/6/text: The Dolphin and Whale watching tour is a must do when you are at the Azores! A great experience to be such close to this beautiful animals, in the middle of the islands of Faial, Pico and Sao Jorge. With a great team of professionals who really know where they are talking about it and also helping the animals with research and observations.
reviews/7/text:
Thank you Naturalist for this amazing experience, we’ve seen a lot of Sperm whales and also a very rare whale jump. We sailed with a pod of dolphins and seen a marine turtle.
High recommended for a unique experience.

Elena & Fabrizio
reviews/8/text: I went with my family for a whale watching trip in Faial with Naturalist Science and Tourism. It was a fantastic experience and we particularly appreciated to be accompanied by dedicated and experienced scientists. The staff was not only passionate, professional and extremely knowledgeable, but they are also very kind and take the time to provide very interesting information. We also appreciate their very sustainable and respectful approach. They are doing a great job at transmitting their love for the ocean to their clients. Part of the resources they collect through the whale watching trips also serves to fund scientific projects. So if you are interested to watch whales and dolphins, and learn more about their lives and environments, I highly recommend you to book a trip with Naturalist Science and Tourism. It was the highlight of our 3 weeks in the Azores.
reviews/9/text: Whales and dolphins watching: outstanding team. Very nice people, careful with the animals, very  skilled and provided tons of useful and relevant information. We have done several similar tours with different companies in different island and this is the one we have prefered.
reviews/9/title: Great people, amazing wildlife. Highly recommended !
reviews/10/text: It was a full day tour of Faial island. Everything was perfect - the tour program, the food, and especially the guides, who were not only informative but also super friendly and smiling, which enchanted the weather to also be perfect, so we could see everything without a cloud, even the Caldeira. The tour builds up very nicely and culminates with what is believed to be the newest European land - the moonlike landscape of Capelinos. I highly recommend this tour! Special thanks to our guides Pedro and Ana!
reviews/11/text: Awesome boat trip. My family and I loved the trip. We were lucky to see Sperm Whales & Dolphins & Portuguese man-of-war. Staff are great with a vast amount of knowledge and more than able to answer all questions. This makes a huge difference to other trip providers; they are all Biologists and have massive respect for the animals. Remember, we are in their habitat. Recommend booking a few days in advance. 10/10 recommend!
reviews/12/text: The whale watching tour was lovely. The common dolphins are so much fun and so playful, surfing the waves from the bow of the boat.
reviews/13/text: Fantastik trip. Friendly people with a huge amount of knowledge, able to answer all questions. Well prepared whale watching with chance to see many of them. Finally Naturalist sent us profesional photos from our trip. I recomend them
reviews/14/text: We had a great full day tour of Pico with Jen. She was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about all things Pico. We learned many new things and also had a delicious lunch . All details were coordinated for the day including transportation and tickets to the ferry . Very professional. I can highly recommend Jen and this company .
reviews/14/title: Excellent Full Day tour of Pico from Faial
reviews/15/text:
I had several adventures with Naturalist while my time in Faial. 
Saw a blue whale and fin whale during one trip!!! And many different dolphins. Recommend booking several whale watching trips to increase your chances of seeing all the animals. My two trips out on the ocean were something I will never forget. Thank you marine biologists Sara and Gisela and the rest of the team!

Also, went on a land tour. Visisted the volcanoes, learned about local plants (and invasive ones), about the history of the island and saw all the main sights - all in one day! Loved the warm personality and humor of tour guide Pedro. 

Thank you Naturalist for having me. 10/10 recommend!
reviews/15/title: An adventure I will remember forever!
reviews/16/text: The whale watching tour was wonderful. Very informative and great sightings of a humpback whale and many dolphins. Definitely recommend going on a tour here, had an amazing experience.
reviews/17/text: Awesome experience with a lot of information about the sealife and conserving this precious ecosystem! They keep the ocean clean and tell you a lot about their research. Absolutely best place to go whale spotting!
reviews/18/text:
Scientists monitoring the whale and dolphin population, while also collecting samples. Super respectful for the animals, driven and engaged, very knowledgeable. Solid equipment. Fun boat ride to be awarded with the sighting of these beautiful sea creatures. Part of your fee goes to their research. 

If you want to go whale watching in a respectful and sustainable way, these are the people to do it with!
reviews/18/title: The best choice for whale watching on Faial and Pico!
reviews/19/text: We did 2 tours full day one to Faial and next day to Pico. It was an amazing experience! Our guide Pedro was super good, he explained so many things and he has a big knowledge about the islands and the nature, we learned a lot with him. If you are in those islands we recommend you this company 100% and also the guide.
reviews/19/title: Amazing trip to Faial and Pico

reviews/0/text: A fantastic couple of days with Dina, Jorge and Rui, hiking, sea kayaking and exploring Sao Jorge island. They are the most wonderful people, so friendly and professional, and enthusiastic to share their beautiful island, which is so natural and unspoilt with stunning scenery.
reviews/1/text: Jason and I had a truly fantastic day canyoning with Jorge and Dina.  It was our first time.  But Jorge and Dina went over the route and discussed all of the safety protocols before we arrived at the site, so we knew that we were in good hands.  We had a blast abseiling down three waterfalls (and jumping off the last one).  They were great company.  It did not feel like we were with a tour company.  Instead, it felt like we spent the day with friends of friends, who were acting as our knowledgeable, kind, and funny hosts to the island.  Thank you Dina and Jorge!!
reviews/1/title: Fantastic day of canyoning with Jorge and Dina
reviews/2/text: Personal, safe and adventurous! Really good experience! Kind Guides with Great Knowledge of all the highlights of the island
reviews/3/text:
I was on an island-hopping tour of the Azores, trying out some of the walking trails created by the government to attract members of the global hiking community. They are similar to the long-distance walks in the UK like the Pennine Way. However, in the Azores, they seem to be sited quite a distance from the main towns on the islands. So you usually have to make your own way to the start points and back from  the finish to your accommodation. 
And that's where you meet your first major obstacle - how to do this? Public transport  is just above primitive, usually rare and early-finishing. If you rent a car that is a significant extra cost to your holiday. Anecdotally, the tourist information office will advise you to arrange for a local taxi service to take you to the start point and advise you to arrange with the driver to pick you up at where you intend to finish and when. If you are hiking here in the Azores for the first time, that is a  tremendous "leap of faith". If anything goes wrong with you or your taxi, you are well and truly stranded. Who wants to spend an unexpected night in a bus shelter? It is of little consolation that there are no "wild", dangerous animals on these islands .
So what to do? Fortunately, there are many little companies offering their services as hiking guides and on Sao Jorge, "Discovery Experience" is a name you frequently come across and I was fortunate to have two days with them during my stopover there. The company is made up of Dina Nunes and Jorge Santos, a local couple that have been born and bred on the island but do not lack a worldly-wise outlook on life - Jorge is an ex-military man who has seen service for his country in some of Portugal's "hot spot" former colonies and Dina has done business studies at university in Lisbon.
My first day was with Jorge when the two of us did part of the "Fajã de São João - Lourais - Fajã dos Vimes". At the start, I was a little perturbed about Jorge's description of the walk as I imagined it to be a "there-and-back" walk. In this, I was mistaken, as Dina, who drove us to the start point, was going to take the minibus and meet us at the end , whenever we arrived. For me the fact that my concerns about the "open-ended" nature of the hike and the unknown nature of the trail itself were so quickly addressed, it made me feel that my guides were professional and more than competent to deal with any unforeseen problems that might occur during the day. The walk itself was quite challenging for me as we started at sea level, went as high as 450 metres and then went down to sea level again. During  this 10 km walk, I found Jorge to be an extremely genial guide and it was not long before we felt comfortable in each other's company and chatted about our own lives and the people in them. He was also full of information about the island - the people, the plants,  the geology, the history etc... That is how I learned of his military experience and the fact that he is a member of the island's volunteer fire brigade - he showed me a video on his mobile that was a "live" exercise that he had participated in the night before with the rest of the island's emergency services and military forces. If I'd had any remaining doubts about his capabilities, they vanished.
 When we got to Faja dos Vimes, Dina was waiting for us with the minibus as expected. While Jorge went off to jump into the Atlantic ocean to cool off, Dina took me to the coffee plantation that her family own for a much-needed cool, soft drink and a sample of the organic coffee they make there. The taste of this coffee that is made on Europe's only coffee plantation is well worth a visit. If you catch Dina in a talkative mood, she'll take you on a tour of the plantation and its fruit groves and you might even see her mother at work on one of the handbuilt looms that she uses to create her unique woven blankets.
The next day, Dina took me on a hike along the trail between Faja dos Cubres  and the Faja de Caldeira, a coastal walk that suited me after the previous day's exertions. She was just as talkative and easygoing company as her partner Jorge and put up with my frequent stops as another photo opportunity presented itself. This is a truly spectacular coastal walk and is well-worth it's reputation. When you get to the little church of Ermida de Santo Cristo that has been built on this headland of volcanic lava rock and have a drink of coffee in the local bar - the "Taberna Conves" - it is easy to relax and watch  the surfers ride the waves that reach the shore here. Unfortunately for me we had to go back along the trail to where we had parked the minibus, as Jorge was on fireman duties that day. Still, it did not seem to take as long to do as the outward walk - probably because of my continued state of wellbeing !
So it came as no surprise that "Discover Experience" cover activities such as canyoning, kayaking, canoeing, climbing, boat trips and island touring. You cannot wish for better local guides and their love of their island is palpable in the way they talk about it. They are obviously known by the locals if the number of friendly waves their minibus attracted is anything to go by. The good thing about them is that they tailor your experience with them to what you can do, rather than what you think you can do. As Jorge said to me, "That way you limit the chances of unforeseen accidents occurring". After finishing my walk with him,I was absolutely knackered but I was riding high on the adrenalin rush of completing the walk for days afterwards !!
reviews/3/title: Top Class Guides for Challenging Sao Jorge.
reviews/4/text: Captivating moments not to describe in words You have to feel it like meeting Serafin Brasil and his wife and dog her eyes moved me intensively. Wonderful experience ! Guide Jorge and his wife Dina  and nephew we felt with Them like with family. They proffesionaly took Care about us during cycling and hiking. Jorge is like medical doctor his advise helped my husband with ears problems ! Wonderful company with true wonderful people from Sau Jorge. they will be in our hearts forever thank You for amazing unforgettable moments with views and moving luck moments it  was the most intensive gripping moment during our 3 weeks in The Azores thank to our guide Jorge ... thank You dr Vaselin Mrs Cotton and Sergio  😍
reviews/4/title: It is obligatory to meet people with Disvovery Expwrience when You are in Sau Jorge
reviews/5/text:
Jorge was a fountain of knowledge and prioritised the fun of the group. We then went on a little bus tour and got a good local perspective of the Island
 He also took plenty of photos and videos for us.
reviews/6/text:
Great experiences with Dina And Jorge!! 
Sea kayak, canyoning, tracking … nature adventure with knowledge and always  keeping  safety protocols.
reviews/6/title: If you are looking for Nature Adventures @São Jorge, Açores Discover Experience is a great choice.
reviews/7/text: Despite the outstanding professionalism, service and equipment, Jorge and Dina offered us an unforgettable adventure weekend, based on their kindness! Great canyoning! Amazing people! Absolutely recommended!!! Thank you
reviews/8/text: A big shout out to this wonderful team, Jorge, Dena, and Rui, for going above and beyond to provide me with an exceptional first canyoning experience on Sao Jorge. As a discerning customer and experienced outdoor adventurer, what really impressed me was 1) their responsiveness to my initial inquiries 2) their high level of organization and professionalism 3) their commitment to safety, above all else 4) their deep knowledge about the island and the sport,and last but not least, 5) their giant hearts and their passion for what they do, which infuses every step of the experience. Canyoning on Sao Jorge was invigorating and unforgettable, and I am already looking at my calendar to see when I can book my next adventure with Discover Experience. Thanks J, D, and R...hope to see you again very soon.
reviews/9/text: Great team, very professional, nice people, first time doing rappel, in a wild nature, one of our best times in the Azores
reviews/10/text: Second time with Discover, now doing Coastering. Really great, the kids loved and people from Discover were amazing. Thank you Jorge, Dina and Rui
reviews/11/text:
We booked a canyoning trip with our 3 kids. The youngest one, 8 years, was a little bit afraid of heights. Due to the foregoing explanation and try-out on a wall, my son was completely enthusiastic about the canyoning.
In the last part, the children, and we, could jump into a lake, about 6 meter height. As long as we enjoyed it, we could keep going on. No rush.
Definitely recommended.
reviews/11/title: They make you forget the fear of heights
reviews/12/text:
What an amazing day. 
We (two families with teenage kids) went for a canjoning tour and became absolutely excited about the commitment, carefulness, passion and dedication Jorge, Rui, Dina and his team has brought into this event and turned it into ‘um dia espetacular e fantástico’. Or as one said ‘in no time we made a new friend’.

Not only the canyoning tour itself but also the organization around that event (port-get and bring service , investiture, admission, sight-seeing of Sao Jorge…) turned that day in long lasting memories. 

Thanks for that and real looking forward for additional new discover experiences next year. 

Petra, Christina, Rüdi, Rui and kids
reviews/13/text: What an awesome day with Jorge and Dina. Our kids are 12-17 and we love active vacations. Jorge does a great job explaining the technical aspect of the gear you will be using so that you understand the certifications and safety aspects. It’s also comforting to know Jorge is a certified EMT. They are both wonderful as we had a great day rapelling !  Note photos below are of training only.
reviews/14/text: I went canyoning with Jorge and Dina with a group of friends and it was absolutely spectacular. Safety was a top priority so we spent time practicing how to use the equipment which helped ease our nerves. During the trip they were always there to provide you with support and suggestions on what your next move should be when you were rappelling down the waterfalls.  I will definitely do this again when I come back to São Jorge with my family!
reviews/14/title: Will be going back again and again!
reviews/15/text: We had a great time cannyoning with Jorge and Dina! They were great in explaining at the beginning how to do it and make sure we were comfortable before starting the excursion. Jorge was great in reassuring and making sure we were alright before and after. Their energy was amazing throughout the whole day and we could not ask for a better organisation.
reviews/16/text: We went canyoning with Jorge and his trainee and had an awesome day.  It was clear from the start that safety was their number one priority. Jorge is a very knowledgable and effective teacher, he taught us about all the equipment and techniques and made sure we were comfortable before we left. The waterfalls we went to were beautiful and although scary at times, we felt safe the whole trip. If you're going to Sao Jorge I highly recommend contacting Discover Experience for your outdoor adventure!
reviews/17/text:
Dina, Jorge and their trainee Rui had a Sea Kayak activity booked with us. The ocean was not adequate, there were Portuguese Man O' Wars everywere and we really tought our activity would be cancelled. 
However, this amazing team took the time to explain how we could still be in the water safely, they took some of the kids out personnaly for a ride within the bay. 
Jorge did an outstanding job helping one of the teen's overcome his phobia of water.
What a great job when you help someone overcome their fears and they even ask you for a second ride!
We changed the initial plans but had an incredible time thanks to this team of dedicated professionals!
reviews/18/text:
Next visit to S.Jorge  definetly will use Discover Experience to explore the Island  and see places that I had no idea existed . 
I'm proud to know Jorge Santos since (kid) and for all the adventures  and knowledge that he is providing to all that visit S.Jorge .
Keep the good job with your Team in showing the ethics and professionalism of our people . Cheers
reviews/19/text:
We did canyoneering with Deena and Jorge. It was AMAZING!  We had a blast!!  They took the time to teach us how to do it and what to expect. It was so much fun. The he took us on a personal tour of the island. We felt as if we were family rather than clients. 
We had such an awesome time. We changed all our plans and stayed one more day on the island so we could return the next day to go kayaking. Again it was top notch and we had a blast! Jorge is professional, knowledge and safe. We can’t wait to plan our next trip back!  
Definitely go to Sao Jorge and visit Jorge and Deena!!!

reviews/0/text:
I can’t say enough about  Eleuterio!  He is extremely knowledgeable and our experiences (yes plural-3 full day tours and an evening thermal pool experience) were all so incredible, informative, fun and relaxing!  
We would recommend Eleuterio 1000 times over.   Eleuterio’s knowledge of the island, history, sites and his stories were just simply amazing, interesting and so full of energy!  We spent 3 entire days and an evening leaning about “his island” and all it has to offer!  It was especially fabulous for us since my husband was born here but hasn’t been back since he left the island at 4 years old 50 years ago!  It was a different (equally amazing) experience for each of us - my husband coming back to an island he has vague memories of and the rest of us seeing it through his eyes for the first time.  Amazing!  We left our last tour today wishing we had even more time with him!  He makes the tours personal, adds little surprises to the end of some of them, and you can tell his passion is true and heartfelt!  He is fun and so laid back - at the end of each day we couldn’t believe we were out for an entire day and never looked at the time while we were out!
If you are going to Ponta Delgada, Azores - you really must book with him (and we recommend multiple days)!
reviews/1/text:
Had a three day island tour with Eleutério and we absolutely loved every single aspect of it. He was exceptionally knowledgeable and really knew how to organize the itinerary around the constantly changing weather patterns and limited time we did have to ensure we maximized everything we saw. Could not have been more delighted to have chosen him for our tour guide during our visit.

The only drawback is, of course, that we wish we had even more time in the Azores. There's so much to see that three days is honestly not enough (even just for Sao Miguel).

His vehicle seats six (or more?) therefore you can have an entire family in there as well. Kid friendly and elderly accommodating for those with somewhat limited mobility.
reviews/2/text:
During my stay on Sao Miguel Island I did a full day tour & walk with Azores4Travel and it was the best day tour & nicest hike I did on the island. Eleutério showed us the North East side of the island, we did an amazing hike ´Ribeira do Faial da Terra´ through forests and with some waterfalls and we also had time to enjoy the thermal pools in Furnas on the way back. 

What I really like about Azores4Travel is the very personal service and flexibility. Eleutério knows his home island very well and gives a professional service as a guide with interesting facts and recommendations about the island,  but at the same time is very personal and you can sense his own passion for the island, nature and hiking. This gave me a completely different experience than the ´standard tours´, where guides are ´just doing their jobs´.

In my opinion, this tour was really the best! You feel as a friend rather than a customer and if you like to do something different than the usual,  Eleutério knows all the ´off the beaten track´ secrets for amazing hiking around the island. In addition, they also do ´the standard tours´, so I can really recommend to book all your tours with this company for a more than complete Sao Miguel experience! 

Highly recommended and I hope to be back one day.
reviews/2/title: The best! Just that bit of extra  what you miss with the standard tours & hikes!
reviews/3/text: Arranged this tour prior to our cruise ship arriving in Ponta Delgado.  There is a reason that this company is highly rated. Our guide was excellent, the vehicle very comfortable and the island is rich in history and scenery.  The lunch of stew, the famous Furnas Cozido was excellent.  All in all great value for the money, and for those concerned with getting bak to the ship on time, our guide had us at the dock exactly one minute before the time he predicted he would get us back and with ample time to still do some looking around the shops near the port.  I highly recommend this company.
reviews/3/title: Fantastic Tour of a Beautiful Island
reviews/4/text: We arranged a 2 day tour of Sao Miguel. All of us were so pleased and impressed with the entire experience with Azores4Travel. We toured parts of the island I'm sure were not on your every day tour.  Cannot wait to visit again and will absolutely use this service.
reviews/5/text:
We loved our brief but memorable visit to the Azores, all thanks to our excellent guide, Eleuterio.   Because of the weather he suggested we adjust our tour to experience the hot springs, which we're so glad we did - they were amazing!!  And after learning more about the island's thermal activity, we got to visit a tea plantation - which was really very interesting.  We also enjoyed some beautiful in-land and coastal views along the way, as well as learned so much from his enthusiastic explanations of his beautiful island.
Eleuterio gave us an excellent recommendation for lunch at Restaurante Gastronomo and even asked his wife to make a booking for us.  That just perfectly topped off our half day tour!  

We highly recommend Azores4travel and can't wait until we can book another tour one day soon - we hope!!
reviews/6/text:
We had a wonderpil Night with Some experiences we Will never forget. With 8 guest we were guided by Eleuterio, a Local guide with a exceptioneel knowledge of huis lovend island.
First we were guided through the hot water springs, a place where our food was prepared that day (cooked in the ground for 6 hours). After that we had an amazing dinner at the restaurant in Furnas. Really great.
After dinner we went to a hot water spring. A true experience.
And, if it was not enough, Eleuterio guided us to a place with different hot springs and hot & cold water. I wasn’t await about the differences of tasts of water!

Don’t hesitate to contact Eleuterio, but aboth all, go on tour. You will be astonished and will have a “one time in a live experience”.
reviews/7/text: Way way up! Eleuterio is very knowledgeable about his island. He explained the geography, geology and history about the Azores. He is prompt, accommodating, and experiences and he keeps an eye on when we needed to be back on the ship. We gladly recommend him!
reviews/8/text:
Eleutério gave us one of the best days we've ever had. It wasn't just a tour, he got to know us, saw what we enjoyed and adjusted each step to give us an absolutely incredible day. 

It does help when you live on an island that has beauty everwhere you look, of course. I can't believe what we saw was all in one place, it was like visiting 3 continents. 

My wife and I never do tours, we always try to do things ourselves but this would have been a huge mistake. Eleutério's local knowledge was what made the day. You absolutely need a guide and I'm sure Eleutério must be the best there is. 

We'll never forget it!
reviews/9/text:
Our group of 7 visited Sao Miguel in October.  All agreed that not renting a car and using Azores4travel to tour the island for 3 days, as well as take us to and from the airport, was the BEST decision we made!  (Three days touring and two days walking was perfect!)

Eleuterio was a fantastic guide:  personable, super-knowledgeable, and attentive to our preferences.  He used his vast knowledge of the Azores (and local weather!) to plan 3 amazing days of hiking, touring, and eating.  We also appreciated the information he shared with us around culture and the history of the area.  

We could not have seen, done nor learned so much on our own.  All 7 of us would recomend Azores4travel and will certainly call Eleuterio next time we visit Sao Miguel.
reviews/10/text: Eleuterio provided a terrific island tour for us in late October 2018.  We (two couples) were traveling on a cruise ship and had a one day stop in Sao Miguel.  It was easy to set up the tour with him via email.   Eleuterio picked us dockside (late model, comfortable van) and took us through the center and western side of the island.  We let him decide were to take us, and he did a great job showing us the countryside.  Lots of lakes, volcanoes, lovely farmland, and dramatic vistas.  We went on a short lakeside hike and had a delicious snack (cheese, bread and wine) at a small local restaurant.   We found him to be an excellent tour guide who enjoys showing his home to visitors.  Highly recommend Eleuterio and Azores4travel.
reviews/10/title: Excellent Island Tour from Cruise Ship
reviews/11/text: We booked Eleuterio for a full day of touring and exploring the island, he was fantastic. His knowledge and love of his home is obvious. He explained everything in detail but was never once boring. Even though the weather was playing tricks with us all day, Eleuterio was one step ahead, and we did everything he had planned with no problems. We would highly recommend
reviews/12/text: The highlight of our trip to Sao Miguel was Eleuterio as our tour guide.  We were so fortunate to be able to spend three full days with him during our week away.  He is personable, knowledgeable, professional and attentive.  He was so adept at planning and organizing our outings based on our own interests combined with his vast knowledge of the island, experience with visitors, weather conditions etc.......He took us to stunning vista look-outs, scenic hikes, thermal hot springs, island highlights and historic and charming towns.  As well, he made wonderful restaurant suggestions where we experienced delicious local cuisine.  We happily didn't rent a car and spent our two off days exploring  Ponta Delgada, local beaches  and our lovely neighbourhood of Sao Roque.  It was such a memorable trip and Eleuterio's insight and enthusiasm was such a huge part of that.  Thank-you so much!!!
reviews/13/text: I booked 3 tours with Azores on Travel: Lagoa do Fogo Hike, Nordeste and the All in One Tour, during the last week of August/first week of September. They were very organised and professional in keeping me informed about the trips and even phoned me when I was in the UK to check a couple of things. The trips were fantastic and we had great guides, Rui in particular was great fun and we had lots of laughs whilst seeing some beautiful parts of the Island. They were even the same company who provided my travel to and from the airport, everything ran seamlessly, the drivers arrived on time and were lovely and friendly. When I return to the Island I will definitely book further tours with Azores on Travel - I highly recommend them!
reviews/13/title: 3 Day Tours with Azores on Travel - Highly Recommended
reviews/14/text: My girlfriend and I booked a full day tour with Eleuterio and it was an incredible experience. Eleuterio drove us all over the island in his van and saw so much for only one day. We got great views of both Sete Cidades and Lagoa de Fogo. He has an immense amount of knowledge about the island which he explained in a clear, interesting way. He took us to both the popular viewpoints as well as some more secluded spots which were just as memorable. I would highly recommend booking a tour with Azores4travel as a way to get to know the island.
reviews/14/title: Amazing Full Day Tour of São Miguel
reviews/15/text: We had only a day at Sao Miguel and what a day it was! I can't possibly imagine a better guide. I chose Eleuterio because of raving reviews hoping that at least some of them were realistic. The reality by far exceeded our expectations. His great qualities, attentivness, infectious passion for the island, flexibility, professionalism, genuine desire to make you fall in love with this marvelous island on your terms, worked a miracle on us. He managed to taylor this introductory tour on the go based on our initial requests and continuous feedback, so that we didn't feel drained (after the sleeples night on the plane), bored or overwhelmed. We wanted to have an active, outdoorsy trip and see all the highlights. We biked and hiked beautiful trails with our comfort level, swam in the hot springs/ocean swimming hole, dipped in a magical waterfall, enjoyed all major island nature sites, accompanied by impressively knowledgeable commentary, had a delicious meal, experienced the city historic center and were delivered back to the airport right in time. We cannot wait to come back and go on more trips with our awesome host!
reviews/15/title: A real gem of a guide
reviews/16/text: We had 2 days of sightseeing with Eleutario. The sights were fantastic, the restaurants where we had lunch were great but most of all, the service we received from Eleuterio was the best. He is so knowledgeable, so passionate about his amazing island and so eager to give you the experience that suits you. From old granny to high end Adrenalin junkie, he would suit you all. I would highly recommend him. You will not be sorry.
reviews/16/title: Fantastic 2 days with a super guide
reviews/17/text: We had a jam-packed day with Eleutério driving around Sao Miguel! He is very knowledgable and passionate about his home. So we learned a lot about the history and geology of the island as well as interesting fun facts about the architecture and way of life in the various towns. My brain was overflowing with information by the end of the day. We got to experience the hot springs of Furnas, which were amazing. He also took us to Nordeste, where we learned a lot of history and enjoyed nature. There were a lot of stops in between. Then we expressed interest in swimming so we ended our day with a swim at the surf beach which i cannot remember the name of. All I remember was how much fun it was with the crazy rough waves, misty beach and a lot of surfers. While I was swimming, I saw a horse on top of a cliff along the beach about 20 meters away, which blew my mind! Perfect day!
reviews/18/text: We took a private full day tour with another couple which I highly recommend. We were able to be flexible on itinerary based on the weather that day and Eleutério recommended Lagoa de Fogo and Cete Cidades since the weather was good. We could stop when we wanted or move on. Did the hot springs and had a great table at a beachside restaurant (with Eleutério's help). Saw the sights from several perspectives, not just a single lookout. Eleutério shared the geology, history, plantlife, animals, etc. of the island throughout the day. He is truly passionate about the Azores and being Portugese. He will be my first call if I get a chance to return.
reviews/18/title: Full Day Private Tour - Had A Great Time
reviews/19/text: We went on a full day tour and hike of the sete cidades and ended the day at the thermal pools. Everything about this day was excellent, eleuterio knowledge of the island will blow your mind and the views he took us to were breath taking. I’m not someone who goes on hikes but the experience was fun and you get to see things you would not typically see. If you’re planning a trip to sao Miguel, I highly recommend getting in touch with eleuterio and booking any of his tours!!

description: Personalized Tours, Activities and Cruise Ship Excursions to suit you and your budget. Tell us what will make your holiday and we will make it happen. We specialize in bespoke vacations and private tours that take YOU where YOU want to go and organize the activities YOU want to go on. Your perfect trip is just a message away.
name: Azores Connections
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Couples PRIVATE Hybrid 4X4 Tour - Furnas (Inc Hot Springs and 3 Course Lunch)
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: PRIVATE Hybrid 4X4 Tour - Full Day Furnas (Inc Hot Springs and 3 Course Lunch)

photo/caption: Enjoy a Private Tour of Furnas in our very comfortable and ECO Hybrid 4WD Vehicle.
reviews/0/text: Very satisfying journey, received more than expected service. After we were picked up from the hotel, we were taken to some very special places for sightseeing and hiking. The scenery was very beautiful and all our requests were well responded to. I would definitely recommend to my friends!
reviews/1/text: Andy and his team provided one of the best custom tours I’ve ever been on - my family did two full days of sightseeing around Sao Miguel. Andy’s local and historical knowledge of the island made it educational. And, most important, his knowledge of the weather and best time to hit different spots, so you get a clear view without a thousand other tourists, made the experience worthy of 10 stars. He and his team were prompt with communication around booking. His car was immaculate. He listened to our interests and gave us an experience that considered our feedback and wishes. You will not be disappointed if you book with this company.
reviews/2/text:
Andy and his tour packages are well worth the money. My wife and I used Andy and his company for two tours and loved the experience.

Andy was a great guide and explained the history behind the sites and was such a beneficial guide.

I would highly recommend Andy’s company and everyone I know will be referred to him while visiting the Azores.

Absolutely fantastic company to work with.
reviews/3/text:
We LOVED working with Andy and Azores connections. We reached out to Andy for help planning our 2-week honeymoon and he created the perfect itinerary, filled with adventure, relaxation, and beauty. And to our pleasant surprise, while on Sao Miguel, Andy himself was our amazing tour guide!

This was a 10/10 experience, carefully crafted by Andy. From the small details to the big, we felt taken care of by Azores Connections.
reviews/3/title: Azores Connections helps plan your trip with care
reviews/4/text: We have just returned from a two-week holiday on Sao Miguel Island in the Azores.  It has to go down as one of the best holidays we have ever had and that is largely down to Andy of Azores Connections.  Due to COVID, we had wanted to put a package together so that we felt more protected if we couldn’t go. We tried several agencies but Andy was the only person who offered to put a fully bespoke package together for us.  This was a family trip for us with our two extremely active 22-year-old daughters so we knew that we needed to keep them fully occupied or they would get bored.  We are definitely not a ‘sit on the beach’ type of family! Andy organised a variety of trips for us and he personally took us on three full-day excursions (the Logoa do Fogo Tour, Furnas Lake, Botanical Gardens and Hot Springs Tour and Sete Cidades Tour) and arranged Coast to Coast Quad Biking, Be a Marine Biologist for a Day, Swimming with Dolphins, Horse Riding and Canyoning trips through his partner contacts.  The whole holiday was superb and hassle-free.  Andy arranged for us to stay at the 4* Hotel Marina Atlantico which we used as our base for the whole trip which suited us well.  On the day trips with Andy, we found him extremely friendly, knowledgeable and fun to be with.  Although we had to get to certain places at specific times, we never felt rushed but, likewise, we never felt like he was having to fill time.  He took us to some amazing view points which we would not have found without him, gave us the opportunity to walk part way around a couple of craters (dropping us off at one point and picking us up at another), waited patiently while we bathed in the thermal pools at Caldheira Velha and the Terra Nostra Botanical Gardens and while we went paddling in kayaks and on stand-up paddle boards on the stunningly beautiful green and blue lakes at Sete Cidades.  He also took photos for us when we couldn’t.  He guided us through the bubbling caldeiras at Furnas and showed us where our Cozido lunch (a stew of mixed meats and vegetables) was being cooked using the heat from the volcano.  During our tours with him, he took us to the Gorreana Tea Plantation and a pineapple plantation which were very interesting.  He also organised car hire for us so that we could explore some of the island on our own.  This proved invaluable as he was able to secure the standard rate.  Others trying to hire a car at the last minute were having to pay 5 times more than we did a day.  We also discovered that booking activities at the last minute was pretty much impossible.  Andy had pre-booked all of ours which ensured we were able to do everything we wanted – and more.  Highlights have to be the canyoning, when we jumped off 7 jumps into the river, varying from 3m-9m, and rappelled down waterfalls, putting us out of our comfort zone and making us overcome our fears. The swimming with dolphins was absolutely amazing.  We swam four times and we saw and heard the large pod of dolphins swimming below us.  We even got to see a small hammerhead shark which was really exciting.  The island is beautiful, lush and green with flowers everywhere.  Overall, Andy helped to organise a fantastic trip that we will remember fondly for the rest of our lives and we would highly recommend using Azores Connections to anyone thinking of holidaying in the Azores. We would certainly go back to them if we were to return.
reviews/4/title: Fabulous holiday. Would highly recommend using Azores Connections!
reviews/5/text: We really loved the canyoning experience!  A beautiful location and a great introduction to rappelling!  Andy was super helpful with tailoring our different activities and accommodating our schedule.  Having the full itinerary with all the details at our fingertips within the app made it very easy to follow our daily plans
reviews/5/title: Great fun in the Azores on Sao Miguel
reviews/6/text:
Our trip to the Azores was fantastic!!!  The islands are absolutely beautiful, and the people are very friendly.
Andy at Azores Connections organised our entire week in The Azores, booking the hotel and transfers from the airport & fun-filled activities for every day.  He even hosted us for two of our day trips.  He provided a comprehensive online itinerary of everything that we were doing, where to go and when and it all ran like clockwork.
We went whale watching, swimming with dolphins, quad biking, half day canyoning, full day Sete Cidades tour and half day Lagoa do Fogo tour (both with Andy), and Furnas tour with canoeing and hot springs and lunch cooked by volcano.  Every tour lived up to expectations, although the quad biking was more on road than I was expecting.  Andy really knows his stuff and tours with him were relaxed and informative, and his enthusiasm from the islands really comes across.  His chosen partners for our other trips were also great and my personal highlight was seeing a curious Sei whale up close.
If you do go quad biking, or swimming in the hot springs at the botanical garden on the Furnas tour, wear old clothes/old swimming costume.  The iron oxide in the dust/water is an absolute pain to remove.  Eventually got most of it out with white vinegar and lemon juice, but it took ages.
reviews/6/title: Fantastic holiday organised by Azores Connections
reviews/7/text: Just back from a delightful tour around the sete cidades. Andy had a wealth of knowledge & tailored our day trip brilliantly to cater for our family.
reviews/8/text: Andy was a wealth of knowledge on our tour. We felt it was perfectly paced. He gauged our interests and personalities quickly and tailored the experience accordingly. We’ve already booked another custom tour with him as we enjoyed this one so much. Top notch experience. The Azores are breathtaking.
reviews/9/text: Four of us were in Ponta Delgada in June.  Andy, from Azores Connections was our driver/tour guide for 3 full days.Our first day, Andy took us to  a volcanic hot springs where we took a dip.  We saw several waterfalls and then to a tea plantation.  We had lunch overlooking the ocean at a sweet restaurant.   The sites were stunning as there are Hydrangeas and Agapanthus growing wild everywhere.The second day Andy took us to Sete Cidades(Seven Cities), stopping along the way.  We saw one of the 7 wonders 0f Portugal, a volcanic complex, which included blue and green lakes, one of the most visited locations of the Azores.We had a great lunch on the banks of the blue lake, which was quite delightful. The third day we  were off to explore the volcanic region of Furnas in the center park of Sao Miguel Island.We took a walk around Furnas Lake and ended up at the bubbling fumaroles which are used to cook meat and vegetable stew.  Then off to Terra Nostradamus Gardens and Hot Springs where we took a dip in the volcanically heated pool of minerals, mostly iron. Then off to Tony's where we ate our stew that had been cooked underground for 6 to 8 hours.  It was amazing.They call the stew Cozido. I tell you all of this in this review, but can't express the credit that goes to Andy our guide.  All of this was experienced with Andy's superb knowledge and expertise of the island and region.  His detailed narrative of each and every place we stopped left you knowing exactly where you were and what you had seen.  He didn't leave anything to wonder, every word was backed by his love for the island that he has lived on for 8 years, where he has learned the language of the Portuguese fluently.We all walked away with a strong  sense and knowledge of the Portuguese people, their love for their island and all its many resources.  We loved our Sao Miguel experience.  We loved Andy as our tour guide and everything he did for us to give us the ultimate experience.  We recommend Azores Connections highly.  We will be back Andy.  Thank you for all you gave us.
reviews/10/text: Andy and Laura created the trip of a lifetime for our family of 13 (ages 20 to 72). They attended to every detail. I would highly recommend Azore Connection bespoke tours!!
reviews/11/text: Azores connections made our vacation so wonderful. My wife and I asked Andy to plan us an action packed active trip for 2 weeks with some time carved out for rest and relaxation at the end. Azores connections went absolutely above and beyond! There is no way we could have made this trip possible without his connections, planning and suggestions. Every tour was outstanding and his organization of our climb of Mt Pico and whale/dolphin watching have left us with memories to last a lifetime. Look nowhere else, these guys are amazing!
reviews/12/text: Azores Connections came highly rated by a Portuguese friend.  We are delighted with all the arrangements Andy made for our 10 day trip to Sao Miguel, Pico, and Faial.  He made it so easy just to show up and know that our accommodations, guides, and trips were handled.  Our guides were terrific.  Our eco-resort in Pico and hotel in Sao Miguel were lovely - and very different from each other.  We had so many memorable experiences throughout the islands.  Thank you, Andy!
reviews/12/title: Let Azores Connections plan your trip!
reviews/13/text: Contacted Azores Connectioms when we were planning our honeymoon trip to the Azores. Andy was immensely helpful throughout the planning process and fantastic tour guide once we arrived. Highly reccomended :)
reviews/14/text:
Andy really exceeded our group's expectations with the planning and execution of our private tour. 
First, he planned out an itinerary that worked for a group ranging in age from 6 to almost 60.  This was accomplished with only a broad list of things that we saw online, and a list of our interests.   We were all happy with his original plan, and moved forward with that.  
Then, COVID times hit and Andy gallantly rescheduled our itinerary three times due to flight/arrival changes.  From our end, it looked easy, but I am sure coordinating multiple vendors for schedule changes was no easy feat.  He did all this with a "no worries" attitude.
Everything after arrival went smoothly, all vendors picked us up as scheduled, all activities were well organized.  We even spent two days with Andy as our guide.  He was quite informative, allowing us flexibility in our schedule, answering all our questions, and providing much information on the island.  He was also quickly available during our stay for all questions.
Activities planned included: gin tasting, canyoning, scuba diving, snorkeling with dolphins, hot springs visits, tea plantation visit, lunches, kayaking, horseback riding, and visits to see natural beauty.  
All in all, I will recommend Andy to everyone.  Top notch service.
reviews/14/title: Best guide and tour booking for the Azores
reviews/15/text:
Andy & Laura did an outstanding job coordinating a schedule of the activities our group of 7 asked for and rescheduled things for us when TAP cancelled flights and changed days multiple times   
They even scheduled Covid tests prior to our return flight do we had no problems exiting the country to get home.
reviews/15/title: Organized our trip and coordinated multiple activities for us!
reviews/16/text:
Andy was a patient informative guide, answering all the questions we had (including my young millenial daughters) and providing a lot of the cultural background as well as island life experience.

Despite the dicey weather a couple of days, Laura kept in touch and was able to adapt our plans to the weather conditions.  She also made suggestions for alternative rain friendly activities.
reviews/16/title: Excellent service and planning itinerary for family
reviews/17/text:
We did the Furnas lake, Botanical Gardens and Hot Spring tour with Andy.
First of all, Andy and Laura have put together a well thought out memorable day for their guests. Andy is an extremely talented and patient guide, a wealth of knowledge and a wonderful person to spend the day with. 
Our visit to the Furnas region exceeded our expectations. Soaking in the hot spring is so relaxing and puts you in a perfect state of mind to stroll through the garden afterwards. The Cozido lunch was very good with generous portions of food and wine.
This is a very special tour with lots of surprises along the way, I would highly recommend putting it into your plans if you go to the Azores. 
Many thanks to Andy & Laura for providing this opportunity.
reviews/18/text: From start to finish Azores Connections were a pleasure to deal with. Laura helped so much with the planning and had lots of helpful suggestions, and Andy was a fantastic tour guide - really knowledgeable and just a nice person to be around for the day! Would highly recommend Azores Connections
reviews/19/text:
My fiancée and I recently returned from a 2 week trip to Sao Miguel, 10 days of which we organised through Azores Connections. I was a little apprehensive about booking through a company, as I usually like to research and plan everything myself, however, this wasn't possible this trip. That turned out to be a great thing though, as I really couldn't have hoped for anyone better than Andy and Laura to take the reins for us!

Communication with Laura during the planning stages was excellent, and she organised a wonderful bespoke package for us, combining some of their more luxurious hotels, lots of activities, and plenty of time to relax too. She responded to all our messages and questions promptly and professionally to make sure our trip was just as we wanted it to be.

Laura also picked us up from Ponta Delgada when we arrived late at night, and it was like being greeted by an old friend. This continued on both our excursions with Andy. They really did well at putting 2 quite shy, reserved travellers like us at ease...even though we responded to all the beautiful things Andy showed us with "ooh, this is quite nice." (We promise when we return we'll have learnt a few new adjectives, Andy!)

It's clear how much pride Andy and Laura take in ensuring that people's trips go to plan, and even that their expectations are exceeded, with tour partners and hotels being carefully chosen to ensure a premium experience. They clearly know Sao Miguel inside out and love where they live, and this definitely comes across on the excursions that they lead themselves. We will definitely be returning to the Azores to explore some of the other islands, and we will be asking Andy and Laura for their help when we do. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend their services to anyone planning a trip!
reviews/19/title: Wonderful, personalised service from Azores Connections!

description: We offer you the best adventure tours on the Island. I am a Canyoning Instructor, Coasteering Guide and I teach Canyoning and Mountaineering at the Azores University.
name: Rope Adventures
ranking: #8 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #8 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text: Manny and the team were very professional and attentive. We kayaked and snorkeled with them. They had all the gear we needed and gave us instructions to ensure our safety. They led us around a beautiful part of the island to a secluded beach where we snorkeled for about an hour and saw all kinds of marine life. I would HIGHLY recommend Rope Adventures! 10 out of 10
reviews/1/text: Completely enjoyed the adventure, this is a must when you visit Terceira Island.  My girls talked about it for days after our adventure.
reviews/2/text: I booked the Mega SUP with Diego, our guide.  Emanuel also guided us from a regular SUP. I appreciated how they took time to stop near the rocks where the water was clear so that my 4 year old could see the numerous sea urchins, crabs, and fish. They taught us where to stand and how to hold the paddle. We jumped in the water and overall, had the best time. They even took pictures and shared them with us via the web. Thank you Rope Adventures!  I highly recommend this for two people or a small group.
reviews/2/title: Mega SUP = A MEGA good time;
reviews/3/text: Great outing, guides made let us see and do as much as we wanted, and made us feel very secure by helping us in any tight areas where we wey not sure where to put our feet or hands. Only 1 rapel, so if that's not your thing, it's still worth it.
reviews/3/title: Great way to see the caves
reviews/4/text:
Foi uma fantastica experiência. Pessoal divertido,  organizado,  e bem dispostos. Fomos 3 pessoas, 2 adultos e uma crianca de 12 anos. Muito facil para todas as idades. 
We did megaSub 1st day, and 2nd day was coastering both amazing and fun. Next time we try diferent activities. Thank you for the amazing people and making us feel comfortable and enjoy the day and beauty of the island.
reviews/4/title: Amazing people and so much fun
reviews/5/text:
We did a coasteering activity with Rope Adventure.
It was a great experience, fun, safe, well organized. An organatisation is really good, the guide is competent. the organizers are very nice! I reccomend a lot!
reviews/6/text: We try the coastring and It could not have been better. Amazing time, incredible coaches and huge experience. Fully recommend. You learn, enjoy and feel adrenaline. Looking forward to coming back soon.
reviews/7/text: I took the Costeering Tour with a friend and we had an amazing time. The guides were very professional, friendly and entertaining.
reviews/8/text: We had such a good time with the team from rope adventures. We always felt safe and we enjoyed every second of it. Beautiful island, amazing people.
reviews/9/text: Emanuel shared a special, not easily visible part of his beautiful island. His expertise, patience and calm teaching manner went a long way with a 63 year old scaredy cat like myself! It was a truly wonderful experience to share with my son and I highly recommend it.
reviews/10/text: This was a great experience and Manny was a great guide! Fun time playing in the forest and the falls.
reviews/11/text: It was a lot of fun, a little scary and very muddy. Great guides. Rappelling and zip lining were easier then walking and slipping in the mud. Beautiful scenery. Can’t wait for Emmanuel to post or send us the pictures.
reviews/12/text: Emmanuel met us with smiles and jokes! I was a little nervous and he always was patient with me and helped me. I never felt rushed. He took amazing pictures that I will keep forever. My experience was amazing because of Emmanuel! After we were done he shared hot tea and lemon cookies with us! Emmanuel is truly an amazing individual!
reviews/12/title: A day I'll never forget with Emmanuel!!
reviews/13/text: This activity was so amazing!! A great way to experience the natural beauty of the island. Emmanuel was an excellent guide, he kept us safe and made sure we had a fun time. This was a highlight of my trip and I would love to do another activity with Rope Adventures again!!
reviews/14/text: My 19-year-old son and I did this tour today and it was really fun!  Emanuel is a great tour guide with a wonderful sense of humor and everyone in our group had a great time.  Canyoning seemed a bit scary at first, but Emanuel kept us all calm and helped us to feel comfortable and have a blast.  I highly recommend this for anyone who loves adventure.
reviews/15/text: It was a great experience and Manny is a great tour guide. He made sure everyone understood the instructions before we proceeded down the waterfall. He talked us through everything and made sure we felt safe. We did go in January and it was cold and windy but the gear kept us warm. Overall we all had a great time.
reviews/16/text: I tried coasteering and I highly recommend it because I had a great adventure and I have learned many new technics about getting to the water, jumping to the water,  be more self-confident of being in the water close to the rocks even at higher waves. Very professional and experienced crew thanks to which I felt safe and I had lot of fun! Thanks a lot!
reviews/17/text: I tried coasteering and I highly recommend it because I had a great adventure and I have learned many new technics about getting to the water, jumping to the water,  be more self-confident of being in the water close to the rocks even at higher waves. Very professional and experienced crew thanks to which I felt safe and I had lot of fun! Thanks a lot!
reviews/18/text: I spent a half a day coasteering with Emanuel.  Even in December the water was quite comfortable because of the excellent gear that was provided.  A a sailor and person who loves swimming in the ocean the skills I learned could someday save my life.  Specifically we learned the techniques to hope in and out of the ocean onto rocky coast in swells.  I'm almost 50 and felt quite safe under the careful eye of Emanuel.  The whole experience was a blast.  Some really nice cliff jumps of into the seas and snorkeling were other highlights of this adventure tour.
reviews/18/title: Coasteering, a guide to swimming safely along the rugged coast of the Azores
reviews/19/text:
Manny is an awesome guide, and was able to accommodate my tight schedule for canyoning. He's even a professor of canyoning - he definitely knows his stuff.

Safety is a number-one priority, and the instructions and training are super clear - there is no way to mess up really.

Although the water temperature was low in November (16-17), I was completely comfortable in the gear. Also, with this type of canyoning, you are not getting completely  submerged in the water. 

Highly recommend Rope Adventures if you are passing through Terceira.
reviews/19/title: Canyoning is a must-do in Terceira!
