description: We are a 8 years experience on tourism family business and our goal it's to provide you the best time in the Azores islands through our Jeep Safari Tours, Sportfishing Charter Boat or Boat Tours.
name: Seazores
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Half Day Sete Cidades PRIVATE Jeep Tour
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Full Day Sete Cidades and Lagoa do Fogo PRIVATE 4WD Tour with Lunch
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Full Day Sete Cidades 4WD Tour + Walking + Typical Lunch PRIVATE
offer_group/offer_list/3/title: Full Day Wild Lakes 4x4 Tour with Lunch PRIVATE
offer_group/offer_list/4/title: Full Day Sao Miguel Tour with Cooking Lesson - PRIVATE
ranking: #15 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #15 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text: We just returned from 4 days on Sao Miguel in the Azores.  Natacha was our guide and we did 3 separate days of touring.  We did not know exactly what sites or areas to cover and Natacha was the PERFECT guide.  She optimized our days and time taking us to the most beautiful areas possible.  She is filled with wonderful information and gave us exactly what we needed.  I fully recommend her services without hesitation and urge anyone visiting the island to contact.  We will DEFINITELY be using her when we return!
reviews/1/text: We did a private tour with Natasha.  There was so much to see and do - thermal pools, oldest botanical gardens, traditional lunch cooked in the ground, Europe's only tea factory and more.  I highly recommend Seazores!  We were picked up promptly and got back just in time to catch the last shuttle to the ship; perfect timing.
reviews/2/text: A group of 5 friends had a wonderful full day adventure with Natacha - highly recommend! She took us to some of the best spots across the island, from hot springs and waterfalls to volcanic pits and great restaurants and cafes. Highly recommend!
reviews/3/text: Unfortunately with the pandemic our flights were cancelled and we were not able to travel to the Azores in June 2020.  I wanted to post though to mention the excellent communication and customer services we received from Seazores.  Questions were promptly answered and policies clearly listed on the website.  We are sorry to miss out on our fishing trip this year, but the positive experience we had interacting with the company will absolutely make them our choice for a future trip!
reviews/4/text: Sergio was very helpful in organizing a week of activities for next June 2020.  We were planning a family holiday in the Azores, but the coronavirus seems to have other plans for us! The Covid-19 pandemic made me have to cancel the bookings I had made with Seazores.  Sergio was very understanding and immediately refunded my deposit.  Though not having met Sergio, I can say that he is a gentleman who runs a business that wants to get paid for a good service delivered to his customers.  Thank you Sergio... hoping we will still get the opportunity to meet once we overcome our current difficulties!  Take care.
reviews/4/title: Great people I never met... but hope to!
reviews/5/text:
As we are in such a time of crisis in the travel industry, I thought I would write about my trip experience with Sergio. I am a travel agent and I booked myself and 4 clients for the Twin Lakes Jeep tour.  From the moment I first reached out to Sergio, he was nothing but amazing to work with.  He provided full descriptions and details on where to meet them when getting off the ship and what to pack and bring on our shore excursion  He always responded within 8 hours even given the vast time difference from Colorado.

Unfortunately our cruise was cancelled because of the Covid 19 virus and we will not being going on our excursion in April.  I will use Serigo and Seazores when our cruise is reschedule and I encourage everyone to support him and his wife when you visit!

Thank you so much Sergio for all your support and your professional business manner.  Hope to see you as soon as it is safe to do so.
reviews/6/text:
Whole day biggame fishing with Captain Sergio and 1 st mate paid out very well.
Been given safety instructions, we left port of Ponta Delgada for 8 hours oceanvisit.
45 minutes later one of the big fishingreel started screaming.Exactly as in Hemingways "the old man and the sea"-
far out in the distance a big fish was jumping many times silhouetly in the direction of the sun.Such a beautiful sight. Having released the fish, Sergio laughed.He said that now he found us a blue marlin and now we could 
continue with tuna : Meaning tunapizza was ready(delicious).Recommendable.Greetings from Per Kamstrup,Esbjerg in Denmark.
reviews/7/text:
Had an awesome time with Sergio, very knowledgeable and passionate about the island.
You will not be disappointed, beautiful sights and food. Great attitude and fun personality.
Only wish I had more time to go fishing with him. Next time for sure!!!
reviews/8/text:
I had initially contacted Sergio (who owns this business along with his wife Natacha) about a fishing excursion.  We would be arriving for one day during a Cruise Ship port visit while in port at the beginning of November.  Sergio was very honest with me that the sea conditions in November would not be optimal for fishing and suggested a land tour in one of their Jeeps that would accommodate up to 6 passengers (turns out they are NOT jeeps - which are smaller - but it easily held four of us in the three rows of seats in a Toyota SUV).  
I recontacted him the day before we were to arrive at the island and we arranged a land tour.  While nearly all of the passengers aboard the ship disembarked and got onto big tour buses for their island tour, we were met by Natacha pier side.  It was at that moment when I began to appreciate what we had arranged.    Natacha had a wonderful personality, she spoke flawless english and treated us like we were family from the moment we climbed aboard the SUV.  The experience was memorable for us.  We saw the sights of the island (absolutely beautiful volcanic island) and had lunch in the community at a very popular local restaurant.  Overall, considerably less expensive than the shore excursion fees for a family of four and we were never crowded or uncomfortable.  Natacha tailored our sightseeing stops to insure we were at the sights before or after the giant mobs on the tour buses.  It was very personal and exceptionally comfortable.
reviews/8/title: Exceptional land tour of Sao Miguel
reviews/9/text: As our first time big game fishing it was a great experience. Great weather great crew and great food. We saw plenty of dolphin and a few fake orcas (large dolphins) as well as catching 6 tuna. The first tuna caught we thought was huge but when we compared them to the 125kg final fish they were tiny. My 17 year old son who’s had no experience with this kind of fishing was able to fight the 125kg fish so this is doable for novices. Greatly exceeded our expectations and thoroughly enjoyed! Highly recommendable.
reviews/10/text:
We had an amazing cruise with Seazores We went out on the boat at around 6:30PM and spent about four hours our on the water. We had a beautiful view of the sunset. We were served wine (flowing freely, if I may add), bread, cheese, and olives. We were invited to swim off the back of the boat and about half of the guests chose to do so. There were nine guests on the boat in total. The staff made sure we were safe and well-cared for. If you get sea sick, bring motion sickness medicine with you! Our ride was originally scheduled for Friday but it rained so they moved us to Saturday with no problem. The crew was kind, friendly, and fun! 

This tour is not on TripAdvisor, but you can find it on the Seazores website and I highly recommend!
 
Thank you Seazores, for a wonderful evening and the most unforgettable sunset!!
reviews/11/text: Natacha was phenomenal....the very best!!!  She captivated us from the first minute until the last.  We felt like old friends at the end of the tour. Her knowledge and love of the area were evident. We were originally scheduled to go to Sete Cidades and L. Fogo (private tour for 3) but heavy fog stopped that plan. She immediately offered another option to which we agreed. An incredible day!  We went to a Tea factory and to Furnas.  We learned so much from Natacha.....her command of the English language and all of its nuances were amazing.  We had an authentic Portuguese lunch at a wonderful restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed the food and the conversation. Highly recommend Natasha for any tour from Ponta Delgada.  Bring your camera, everything is beautiful!  Thanks again, Natacha.
reviews/11/title: Amazing tour of Ribeira Grande and Furnas from Cruise Port in Ponta Delgada
reviews/12/text: We used Seazores to take a sailing tour around the island. Natacha and her husband were fabulous to work with and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff on the boat were knowledgeable, flexible and made it a great day for everyone (even a few seasick passengers!). They provided an adorable picnic lunch and great Portuguese wine. We think it was the best day we had in the Azores. Thanks, Seazores!
reviews/12/title: Amazing private sailing tour of the island!
reviews/13/text: We had an amazing evening on the catamaran with Seazores. We booked a few days earlier in their office and the team really took the time to explain the different types of activities and which activity would be great at what time. We chose the sunset catamaran tour that lasts 3.5 hours. The catamaran is small and we were eight guests in total, so it was a very calm and intimate experience. After boarding, safety was put first and the skipper showed us how to walk across the catamaran with safety ropes. Since it was a little cold, we were provided with jackets and blankets and a few times, the crew came by to ask if we had everything we needed and to tell us about special locations or marine life that we were seeing on the way following the east coast. It was perfect to relax and to unwind. After a while, baskets with appetizers (bread, cheese, and olives, as well as water and white wine) were served. We were completely relaxed and enjoyed every moment. Luckily, we had a wonderful sunset and the sea was very calm, so it wasn’t cold at all. It would also have been possible to sit inside and enjoy the cruise from there. Everyone was so warm and friendly, we really didn’t feel like tourists, but like friends. Thank you for a wonderful evening!
reviews/14/text: Went out for a half day fishing and seaside lunch with Sergio and crew. Great guy with a lot of knowledge of the area. Caught a variety of local species and took them to a nice restaurant on the ocean where they cooked up what we caught for lunch. All in all a great day on the water with good company that took the time to tell us all about their beautiful country. Highly recommend Sergio and his team!
reviews/14/title: Half Day In-shore Fishing and lunch excursion
reviews/15/text:
We booked 2 full day deep sea fishing trips and one half day drip. On the first day had some small action, but no fish on the hook. We spotted a Blue Marlin right in front of us, but he did not follow the bates. 

On the second day we spotted a Blue Marlin and this time we where more lucky, it took the bate, but got away. After around 15 minutes there was another Blue Marlin chasing the bates and this time the fish was on the hook. It is amazing how powerful the Blue Marlin is, he just pulled the line out 800 mm within a few minutes. The fish was around 3,7 m long and about 300 kg, to pull it in, was quite an experience. After the fish was next to the boat, it was released. 

On the third day we did not have any luck, no action. 

The team was trying very hard to spot the fish and take us there and they did a good job. It was a great experience!
reviews/16/text: My girlfriend and I enjoyed a wonderful four-hour fishing trip off the coast of São Miguel with Seazores.  I'm very inexperienced at fishing but Natacha and Sergio made it easy and a great pleasure.  Both my girlfriend and I caught a pleasing variety of local fish and enjoyed a beautiful cruise along the coast of the island.  I can't say enough about our hosts' skills, professionalism, enthusiasm and infectious fun-loving approach to sharing what they love so much.  Absolutely fantastic, I would recommend them WITHOUT HESITATION to anyone looking for a great adventure with splendid one-on-one support and encouragement.
reviews/17/text:
I can’t recommend this trip highly enough. Sergio and Natacha made the day so personal and enjoyable by ensuring we not only caught plenty of fish, but also never went thirsty! Their local knowledge of the fishing, the Azores and Portugal is fabulous and they answered our many questions.
If you want a fishing trip where you want to enjoy the experience without having to fight for fishing space - or fish - check out these guys. We did the coastal fishing, trolling lures and bottom fishing, but they also offer big game.
reviews/18/text: Fantastic fishing trip with this family-owned business! Sergio and Natacha do their best to find where the fish are biting. And they offer a wide variety of beautiful, personalized tours of Sao Miguel island. We started out as customers and left as friends😍
reviews/18/title: Big Game Fishing, Coastal Fishing and Tours on Sao Miguel Island, Acores
reviews/19/text:
We did the full day tour on our 1st full day in the Azores. Our guide was Vetta (spell?). Her Englsih was excellent.  She was a great driver and gave us many good tips for the remainder of our vacation.  The roads are fairly narrow in this area and it was nice to get some 1st hand driving tips before setting out on our own in a rental car for the rest of the week.  Vetta took us on roads that I would not have driven on otherwise and   I always felt very safe.  It was a great day and I would highly recommend the trip with Seazores. 
We also did the family fishing trip with Seazores which was also an excellent experience.
reviews/19/title: Great Experience-Full Day Jeep Tour Sede Cidades with Seazores

address: PDL Business & Cowork Center Av. D. João III, nº33, Sao Miguel 9500 Portugal
description: We love adventure! We love to explore! We love to be outside in nature! And because we also love to share the beauty of the Azores, FUN ACTIVITIES AZORES ADVENTURE exists!
name: Fun Activities Azores Adventures

reviews/0/text: We had a great time! The activity was very fun, the views were amazing and the instructors fun, kind, and professional! I strongly recommend you to book the activity with them.
reviews/1/text: Cannot recommend enough. Loved our guides and it was the most fun activity on the island. Felt very safe the whole time.
reviews/2/text: I did an amazing hike yesterday to Lagoa do Fogo, a secluded lake in the crater of one of the volcanos on Sao Miguel with Fun Activities Azores with the privilege of having a small group of just 2 persons with 2 guides, which comes from travelling out of the main tourist season. I learned a lot, had a lot of laughs and took in the many variations of green and blue of this place. We were super lucky with the weather and had a clear blue sky, which apparently is very rare - thanks to good knowledge of the organiser :-) Ricardo and Diego were both extremely competent and caring guides, who love their pearl of an island. Booking and organising the tour was easy due to quick responses and flexibility from the team. Thanks a lot, I can highly recommend you and would love to come back and try other activities.
reviews/2/title: Stunning hike adventure to Lagoa do Fogo
reviews/3/text: We had a wonderful experience with Fun Activities Azores during our stay in Sao Miguel. The guides were knowledgeable, kind, and fun to spend time with. We went on fun hikes, and they made appropriate changes with the rainy weather to make the day as enjoyable as possible. I would recommend them to anyone who wants to explore the beauty of the Azores.
reviews/4/text: Fantastic tour with our two guides. It was very well organised and felt very safe throughout the tour. Loved rappelling and sliding into the streams! Highly recommend for beginners of all ages
reviews/4/title: Brilliant fun if you like some adventure
reviews/5/text:
Excellent tour, great guides, beautiful landscape.
Great experience, very much recommend FunActivities.
reviews/6/text:
Fab e-bikes (MTB) and great route for 2+ hours.  relaxed but prompt service.

My seat post did sink a little....but not a joy killer!
reviews/7/text: Kayaking on the Atlantic. That says it all. Ricardo and Tavi were great guides, organized and fun. We had a swim and snorkeling as well. Don’t miss it especially if you enjoy kayaking!
reviews/8/text: We did the ebike tour around Sete Cidares and it was excellent. Bikes were great and our guide was knowledgeable and everyone enjoyed.
reviews/9/text: Booked the kayak tour to Ilheu De Vila Franca Do Campo with pick up from Ponta Delgada and it was amazing! Much better than taking a boat there. You get a decent work out and it’s a much more beautiful way to experience the Islet. We were picked up from the hotel by 2 guides who were very friendly and warm. It was about a 25 minute drive to the marina. I’ve done a lot of kayaking and these tandem kayaks were so comfortable I was surprised. The guides were very patient and also clear with their instructions. It’s an easy-moderate paddle to the isle about 25-30 minutes. The waters are turquoise and it was pretty calm for the sea. We had the option to paddle around the protected reserve and it’s definitely an option you want to take! It’s breathtaking to see the arches and then to kayak in and explore the caves. We then parked our kayaks inside the protected reserve and had a chance to snorkel (lots of fish for such a small area in such shallow water) as we were there at low tide and hike to see the different view points. We spent about 45 minutes there then we paddled back. The whole experience was about 3 hours not including transfer. It’s totally worth the money! Thanks Fun Activities for the great experience! We fell in love with Sao Miguel!
reviews/9/title: The Kayak tour to Ilheu De Vila Franca Do Campo is a MUST!!!
reviews/10/text: We booked the full day Sete Cidades excursion that included kayaking, hiking and a visit to the thermal pools. The entire day was fantastic - the views and experiences you couldn’t find without a local guide, and the ease of enjoying the islands beauty without any planning. Our guide Rodrigo was fantastic - he was so knowledgeable and great with the kids. He even surprised us with a birthday cake for one of the members of our group which was so thoughtful. I highly recommend this experience for families, we loved it!
reviews/11/text: We did the E-MTB Self-Guided Tour of Sete Cidades and it was the highlight of our trip to Portugal. The gentlemen that got us set up with the bikes were super friendly and made getting started a very smooth and easy process. Although the electric bikes themselves do still require some work, they were definitely the best way to see the sights. I am definitely a big adrenaline junkie and flying down the hills and along the mountain ridges was absolutely thrilling! I would say it is not for the faint of heart and it still is a bit of a work out but it is 100% worth it. We would absolutely recommend!
reviews/12/text: we loved the self guided e-bike tour in Sete Cidades. Great communication with the team and beautiful area for e biking. Highly recommended!
reviews/12/title: e-biking in Sete Cidades. Just do it!
reviews/13/text: Loved the Waterfalls | Lomba de São Pedro tour! The guide Marica has a lot of energy and knowledge about the area and it was a wonderful day in nature, seeing waterfalls, the tropical forest, and the beach. Plus we hit up the tea plantation and saw tea being produced. A great day all around!
reviews/14/text:
The best kayaking adventure I’ve ever been on. Our tour guides were incredibly knowledgeable about the area, the island, and the islet we visited. They knew which caves would be safe to kayak into and what would make for a special day. 

Sincere thanks to Rodrigo who spent 2 days with us and shared his passion and knowledge of São Miguel with my husband and I.
reviews/15/text: After a nightmare trip from NYC to Ponta Delgado (due in part to weather and part to Jet Blue and SATA Azores Airlines mismanagement and incompetency), we finally made it to San Miguel 3 1/2 days late. Paulo was incredibly flexible, empathetic and understanding with the situation and we were greeted by him personally at the airport upon arrival after 10pm. He moved our reservations around to the extent he could so that we could see/do as much as possible with our remaining time. Paulo was kind and patient and made sure that we were able to get a late dinner before dropping us off at a beautiful and spacious hotel in Nordeste. On the ride there he provided us with helpful information about our activities and also about the island. All of our guides were fluent in English, easy going, and on time. We enjoyed their company, especially Daniela's. All three of our accommodations across the island were super clean, provided breakfast and were located within walking distance of attractions and restaurants. We biked (bikes were in excellent condition), hiked and went canyoning with Fun Activities. Our guide for canyoning, Joao, was extremely experienced, confident and very helpful every step of the way. The picnic lunches were in environmentally reusable containers and they also provided reusable silverware.  The lunches were healthy and delicious. We flew to Pico for a few days and upon our return Paulo arranged a driver for us to take us to the pharmacy for our Covid tests. We took the test and he drove us downtown for lunch and then picked us up again to retrieve our test results and then dropped us off at the airport. Fun Activities provides top notch customer service and I highly recommend that you use them when you visit San Miguel.
reviews/16/text: I went on a couple of hiking trips with our guide, Ricardo, to sete cidades and lagoa.  He was very knowledgeable and personable.  I had a great time!
reviews/16/title: Hiking through sete cidades and lagoa do fogo
reviews/17/text: We went hiking on Lagoa do Fogo.  Our guide Marica was extremely knowledgeable about the islands, their natural resources, history, plants and terrain.  She was an excellent guide, getting us to the lake despite very windy and rainy conditions.  We had a lot of fun with Marica and Pablo.  The staff in the office including Yuliya were so extremely helpful and responsive both by email and by phone.  If we are able to return to Sao Miguel, we will definitely book with Fun Activities!
reviews/17/title: So much fun with Fun Activities!
reviews/18/text: Fun Activities (Paulo, Michaela, and the other guides) led our large group (20+) on two wonderful hikes on São Miguel: to the Lagoa do Fogo area and around Furnas. They were extremely knowledgeable about the landscape, natural history, and local history; it was great to have that context as we walked. The hikes accommodated people of different strengths, and Paulo always seemed to know where to be to lend hand at tricky spots. The routes were diverse and interesting, through lush green pastures, cloud forest, tunnels through the mountain, around and above the caldera lakes, etc. Highly recommend these folks if you're in the Azores!
reviews/19/text: We went kayaking yesterday ! it was fun, exciting. Instructors are great: welcoming and helpful (and so fun!). I'm really happy we visited the island from the water. The perspective is different. If you are lucky with the ocean conditions you can see the caves! I absolutely recommend it. Half a day of fun!
subcategory_ranking: #18 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores

address: Ponta Delgada, Sao Miguel 9500-350 Portugal
description: Gary Travassos Azores Private Tours, Hiking Tours & Taxi Transfers. Personalized Car & Van Tours to see the most beautiful places on the island of Sao Miguel, Azores. In my page, you can find over hundreds of photos, and interesting information about the Azores (especially for Sao Miguel Island, where I live and work on). We execute Taxi Transfers on the island, from and to the Airport, and to the Hiking trails, and too any other destination on the island of Sao Miguel. We also offer Hiking Tours to several places on Sao Miguel Island. Where Green and Blue never ends!!!
name: Azorean Tours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Full-Day Sete Cidades Crater Lake and Fire Crater Lake Private Tour
photo/caption: Azorean Tours - Azores Private Tours by Car & Van, Hiking Tours & Transfers on Sao Miguel island
reviews/0/text: Unfortunately we missed the tour because our cruise ship canceled due to weather.  So why the 5 star review?  The company did everything they could to help us.  They communicated with us every step of the way and quickly refunded the tour as soon as I notified them of the cancellation of our port visit to Ponta Delgata.  The tours they offer were 1/4 the cost of the cruise ship tour offers and they offer private vehicles and flexible itineraries.  They also offer a wider range of sites to choose from.  Absolutely, without a doubt, I will book with this company when we go to Ponta Delgata.  Gary, thank you very much for offering a legit service that is clearly the best tour company to choose.  I really hope to visit in the future.  You have a built a solid company that clearly puts your customers first, something that is increasingly difficult to find.  We really appreciate your help and super fast responses.
reviews/0/title: This is the only company we would use.
reviews/1/text: We luckily had Marco pick us up at the airport to transfer us to our hotel.  We asked him about car rentals to explore the island, and he made great suggestions...we then asked if he provided that service, and he explained that he could do that as well.  It was by far the BEST option.  Marco was very prompt, full of information, and showed us areas of the island that are not on the "tourist route" We immediately booked him for a second full day, and pre-arranged our transfer back to the airport with him.  If you are going to Sao Miguel, then call him in advance (+351) 913 189 125 or you can e-mail him at marco-pavao@sapo.pt  You can tell him Miss Portugal, and the Sarge sent you!!
reviews/1/title: Azorean Taxi Tours with Marco - THE BEST OF THE BEST
reviews/2/text: My husband and I did one of the private shore excursions with 2 other couples from our ship. Wow, it was great! We did tour #7, which gave us a very nice exposure to the island, including visits to Furnas (hot springs, garden), national park with waterfall, tea factory, multiple panoramic viewpoints, and many other local sights. Gary was very knowledgeable and personable. He deftly adapted the itinerary to fit weather patterns and to avoid large tour crowds at the more touristy spots. He also was flexible with our requests, especially when we all wanted cheese ... Gary brought us to a favorite queijaria, where we enjoyed delicious food and drink and pleasant conversation. Making arrangements was very easy, with good communication and no problems with pick-up and drop-off. (I'd also like to mention that in 2020 when we had to cancel because of pandemic, Gary was very kind and efficient at refunding our payment.) A perfect day. We would definitely use Azorean Tours again!
reviews/3/text: We visited when we stopped here on a Transatlantic cruise.  Gary, our guide and driver, was fantastic and made sure we could see everything possible.  The weather didn't cooperate but he went out of his way to take us to the best viewpoints.  We visited two lakes, a tea plantation where we were able to sample some tea, a small park with hot baths and a small waterfall, and to visit the thermal features on the island.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this tour to anyone visiting the island.
reviews/4/text:
We too visited this port on a transatlantic cruise but our experience was not good. Our tour guide was evidently a last minute no-show, so a taxi driver was substituted instead.  A nice man, but unfortunately he spoke little English.  We were so looking to our visit here and learning about Ponta Delgado, especially since we are unlikely to return. But we ended up with a mostly silent taxi ride that did not make all the advertised stops and did not last the advertised six hours.  We learned nothing about the area. And the stop at the 'pineapple plantation' was a joke. To call them 'plantations' is a stretch. It was a look into a greenhouse, then a visit to the gift shop. A couple we met later on our cruise ship evidently visited a different set of pineapple greenhouses where a staff member discussed the process, then showed them a video. They also had fresh pineapples for sale at the other location.  

After the tour ended, we walked on our own to a market where we purchased fresh pineapple for less than 3 euros.  It was delicious!! Definitely try it when you visit this port.
reviews/5/text:
We stopped at Ponta Delgado on a transatlantic cruise. Due to an issue with another port, the ship rescheduled. Azores Tours was very accommodating in changing our tour date. 

Our guide and driver, Marco was a hoot. His English was great, and you could tell he really loved his home and all it had to offer. The tour hit the major highlights, and stopped in a little town for lunch and chocolate with amazing views. 

I’d asked to stop so I could buy a specific cheese you can only find there. Marco did me one better by stopping at a cheese store where we got to sample several local cheeses. Everyone on our tour had a great time. I can’t believe some people just walked around the town and missed all the beauty Sao Miguel has to offer. 

We got back to the ship in plenty of time, always a concern with third party tours. 

Bottom line: great guide, lovely tour, and at a great price.
reviews/6/text: Azorean Tours was a great to use! Great communication and on schedule. Team was very accommodating as well.
reviews/7/text: We had Cesar as our driver and guide.  He was absolutely wonderful…..so nice, informative, and stopped wherever we wanted to take pictures or whatever!!!  This was a private tour so there was just the two of us and it was PERFECT!!!  I would highly recommend them for a tour of San Miguel!!!!
reviews/8/text:
Gary was extremely responsive and help get us his last vehicle for the day we visited.
Our guide Nunu was the highlight of our trip. He anticipated what would make us happy and took us to experience everything we asked for.
He taught us how to drink from a well properly.
We enjoyed a meal cooked in a volcano.
We went to gorgeous lookouts.
We even stopped in town for wine and chocolate 
A perfect day with a gentleman of a guide
reviews/9/text: Gary provided both our hotel transfer and a magical customized tour of the island. He was knowledgeable, adaptable and the service couldn’t have been better. We look forward to booking Gary again when we’re back next year.
reviews/10/text: My friend and I went on an amazing hike to Rocha da Relva with Gary through Azorean Tours. He provided lots on information about the Azores as well as the specific plants we saw on the hike. Gary walked at our pace and took as many breaks for photos as we wanted, so we did not feel rushed at all. The hike itself has incredible views and it is perfect for people who have limited time on the island since is was only about 2.5 hours. I highly recommend booking a hike with Gary, who is knowledgable, friendly and clearly passionate about what he does.
reviews/11/text: Couldn’t fault our 2 day private tour with Garry. He was so knowledgeable and passionate about his island we learned so much in a relaxed atmosphere going at our own pace. He took us to more unknown places as well as the main tourist spots and viewpoints. Would thoroughly recommend this company.
reviews/11/title: Excellent time on our 2 day private tour of the island
reviews/12/text: We had an amazing time during our 2 days tour with Harry. He took us to the most amazing places on the island, we tried some delicious local food. He was very patient with us, letting us enjoy the spots we stopped at for as long as we needed. During the first day he took us to a tea house in Sete Cidades, which we enjoyed very much. We also went to the hot spring pools. Harry was a real tour guide, telling us about the history of the cities, of the formation of the island, and the volcano eruptions. We enjoyed every part of this tour
reviews/12/title: Amazing 2 days tour of Sao Miguel island
reviews/13/text: We really enjoyed our time with Joao in Sao Miguel. He is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The destinations on the itinerary were incredible! Joao was personable and related to our children well. He provided explanations in a manner that they could understand. Although the day started off with rain, when we arrived closer to the seaside towns, the weather had cleared up, and we were able to enjoy beautiful views of the ocean. Thank you for a lovely day!
reviews/13/title: Great Tour of West Sao Miguel
reviews/14/text: Gary is professional and organized, a good communicator, his vehicles are immaculate and he is extremely punctual. A true gentleman who speaks impeccable English. He is Azorean, extremely knowledgeable and has excellent suggestions based on who might be participating on a outing. Looking forward to using him again on our next visit!
reviews/14/title: Excellent transportation and tour resourceProfessional, organized, punctual and knowledgeable
reviews/15/text: Lunch at a local restaurant was wonderful. We were the only couple for the tour, so we were able to see so much. We went to the tea plantation and did the tour and tasting. The countryside is so beautiful. Our guide/ driver was ably to tell us about the area and their livelihood.  Enjoyed it very much!
reviews/16/text: Your guide will either make suggestions for your tour or gladly take you where you ask.  We decided to follow his ideas with a few tweaks. We enjoyed the ceramic factory, the tea farm (who knew?), and the volcano cooked local meal. He was full of love for his home and we soaked up his knowledge.
reviews/17/text: What a wonderful day we had with Francisco of touring Ponta Delgado and Sao Miguel.  He was so knowledgeable and very organized so that we got to see lots in a very short amount of time.  And Gary's communication with us through email was always prompt.  Highly recommend this group.
reviews/17/title: A shore excursion in Sao Miguel
reviews/18/text: Elder was our tour guide for the day and despite  having clouds and a small amount of showers we had an awesome tour. He was very knowledgeable and spoke great English. We loved this charming island.
reviews/19/text: Rodrigo gave us a great tour of the island and took us to places we would have not gotten to on a cruise ship excursion. He also went out of his way to make a couple of special requests happen, like setting up a wi-fi hot spot with his phone so we could access the internet during the day. I would highly recommend this tour, and this company, to anyone who wants a great tour of the beautiful island of Sao Miguel. My wife and I thought this would be the only time we would be in the Azores, but after this tour we want to come back and a week or more.

address: Ponta Delgada, Sao Miguel Portugal
animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
description: The spectacular and impressive Azorean natural spots are ideal for the practice of your favorite outdoor hobby and appreciate our amazing nature. With our experience, since 1999, you will have a perfect trip or activity, on unique scenery that can take place on a Safari 4x4 tour for a sightseeing tour, in a walking trail, in a mountain bike tour to the ancient places or on a fishing experience where you can feel our sea and the adrenaline of fishing, on a coastal or Big Game Trip. Our main goal is to provide our visitors the best experiences and for that we have an experienced, available and fun team to help you in everything. With our company you will find a team described for its sympathy and experience so you can enjoy on the best way, the time you spent on this beautiful island. We want you to adventure yourself in our trails being sure that you will have a quality service. Our adventures were created so that our clients/friends can enjoy all the places that we visit minimizing the environmental impact that this visit may cause. During our activities you will also meet our so-called Azorean hospitality and the traditional wealth and its fascinating history.
name: Acores Trilhos da Natureza
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Extraordinary Half-Day Tour 4x4 - Unexplored landscapes & Lagoa do Fogo- Join Us
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Discover the unexplored beauty of the island by 4x4 tour - the Nordeste
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Explore different trails at Sete Cidades Volcano on Half-Day Tour 4x4 jeep
offer_group/offer_list/3/title: Explore with our guides the West side & Sete Cidades on a surprising 4x4Tour
offer_group/offer_list/4/title: Full-Day Furnas Tour: Lake, Fumaroles and Thermal Pools 4x4

ranking_subcategory: #16 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text: From the moment our guide picked me up at my hotel smiling and full of energy, I knew I was going to have a good time.  The tour was spectacular with lots of little surprises that were fun and exciting.  I got to see a lot of the island that you don't normally see...would definitely recommend this tour, this tour guide and this company.
reviews/1/text: We booked three tours using Gate1 Travel who partnered with this company.  On our trip we signed up for three full day tours through this company.  The experience was great. Our guide was extremely friendly and made everyone feel comfortable.  He was knowledgeable about the island and the different areas we toured.  It was great experience all three days. The sites, meals and interactions were fantastic.  I highly recommend this company it will make your trip and experience all the more enjoyable.  Our guide all three days was Rodrigo and he was a gem.
reviews/2/text: We did a three day tour with Phillip. Our trip to Azores was great because of him. It was like seeing the island with a friend he was super kind, knowledgeable and always flexible to accommodate our preferences. This is def recommended with Phillip as a guide!
reviews/3/text:
Hugo was my guide and he was really really great.

I originally booked a walking tour for the lagoa do fogo, the other group of people who were meant to join us weren't able to due to contracting covid so I had essentially a private walking tour with Hugo. 

We figured out early on that I wanted to see good views, and Hugo adjusted the itinerary to tailor to my desires and we went to Sete Cidades. It was absolutely fantastic, Hugo gave me a lot of local knowledge and he had answers to all the questions I had.

The route that was chosen was gentle(ish) uphill for 2/3 of the day, and downhilll for the other 1/3. I saw good views throughout and the hike was probably easy-moderate in difficulty. I had never heard so many birds sing at the same time until venturing into sete cidades, it was beautiful.
reviews/4/text: We enjoyed a wonderful half day fishing charter and sightseeing excursion along the spectacular coast west of Ponta Delgada. Pedro is an experienced skipper with a well maintained boat and he knows where to find the fish.  We returned home with a couple of meals of delicious Barracuda.  Thanks for the unique experience.
reviews/4/title: Thanks for the unique experience on the water.
reviews/5/text: I have been to over 75 countries and I can definitely say that I had the most amazing experiences in Sao Miguel with this company. I ended up being alone on my tours, we did the Nordeste and then the Lago do Fogo and eastern part of the island with Sete Cidades.  Filipe was the most wonderful guide and companion any visitor could ever ask for.  Very knowledgeable about his land, a true native of the Acores, he knew where to take me for the best shots, views, and hikes, and always maintained a good spirit even if the weather wasn't always perfect.  I wish I would have time to do more hiking trips with his company, it was truly a lovely experience getting to know the beautiful island of Sao Miguel with Filipe.  Highly recommended, if you go to the Acores, ask for a tour with Filipe!!
reviews/5/title: Two fabulous full day tours with Filipe
reviews/6/text: As a tour guide, Philip was extremely professional and very helpful. Thanks to him, we didn't only explore Sete Cidades, but developed an appreciation of Azores as a whole. We are definitely coming back in summer, just to see all that we missed out on this trip!
reviews/6/title: West Side and seven cities jeep tour
reviews/7/text:
Had a great 4X4 tour this a.m.
Philip was a great guide; knowledgeable, humourous, very personable AND a great driver to boot.
Hope we have him again 
Thank you
reviews/8/text:
Used this comany for 3 days of tours...the full day Furnas Jeep tour, the full day Nordeste Jeep tour, and the Sete Cididas Jeep tour. Pickup at our hotel was very prompt, and our tour guide, Hugo, was the best we had ever had.
He did not rush and made sure that we saw the best views.
reviews/8/title: Excellent tour company....best tour guide ever!!
reviews/9/text: We do not do well on our own and look for good tour guides wherever we land. If you want an informative, stylish and a small group tour and tailor-made itineraries, we strongly recommend this company and JOHN for land tours. We took 2 of the all-day tours which resulted in seeing 80% of the island. Our guide, John’s extensive knowledge and local expertise created a real authentic, extraordinary travel experience in some of the island’s most captivating sites, a few of which are not seen by many other tour groups. The full day tour begins at 9 with pick-up at the hotel and return by 5, lunch included (which are unique dining experiences). The company also offers mountain bike tours, coastal sport fishing, and boat tours.
reviews/10/text: Philippe was fantastic and knowledgeable . Good vehicle and comfortable. Highly recommend.  This was the best activity that we did including a fabulous lunch at Caldeira. Super.
reviews/10/title: Full day Sete Cidade and Fogo lake
reviews/11/text: We were 3 days in the company of a private guide, named Filipe, a young guy of 28 years old, who speaks fluently English. He guided us in a perfect way and it was ideal for us to learn a lot about this beautiful island in a short period. Thanks Filipe for everything you did for us!
reviews/12/text: I highly recommend this trip! You get to see all of the pearls of Sete Cidades and go to places you would never find yourself. Our guide was Luisa, a very warm, fun, and professional person. We were alone (a couple) during the trip and she let us take all the time we needed and choose the places we wanted to go to. We were also grateful how she appreciated that we're vegan and made sure to find a restaurant where we had options. This is a must do in Sao Miguel!
reviews/13/text: We had Filipe for both our tours and he was an amazing guide.  Extremely knowledgable about the island and was able to answer any questions we had. Also a very nice and patient individual that really enhanced our experience.  Both of the tours were great and doing it with a private guide was really enjoyable.  Would definitely recommend this company for any Azores experiences and request Filipe for a guaranteed great time!
reviews/13/title: Half Day West and Full Day East tours
reviews/14/text:
My friend Pauline and I booked a 4 day tour with Pedro for our 5 days trip in Azores, including airport pick up and drop off, and it couldn't get any better!

Pedro picked us up at the airport on time and took us to the accommodation, and gave us a brief introduction of the tour on the way, which was the great kick start of our Azores trip. 

In the next few days, we spent a really good time with Felipe, one of the team members of Pedro. Felipe was fantastic! He was very professional and knowledge as a tour guide, which was amazing because we get to know Azores in a much more extensive level. Not only were we able to visit all the famous sites and beautiful areas with a nice comfortable jeep, we were able to understand Azores's environment, history, culture and economy, and have a better understand of this beautiful island's past and future.

Apart from being a professional tour guide, we also regarded Felipe as a local friend, who recommended us all the nice local restaurants and places to have fun at night. If you booked with Pedro and is looking for a young and fun guide, we definitely recommend you ask for Felipe!!

In our last day, unfortunately the host of our accommodation has very strict check-out policy and did not give us any option for bag storage for our late flight, luckily Pedro was very kind and allowed us to store our big suitcase in his hostel. This allows us to explore the island freely the last day, 

In short, we had a wonderful time in Azores thanks to the great organisation and hospitality of Pedro and Felipe. We are looking forward to coming back soon for visiting other islands!
reviews/14/title: Amazing Tour & Wonderful Memory of Azores
reviews/15/text: Our guide Luisa was great!!!!!  She knew the island like it was her very back yard and gave us insights of everything we passed.  We went thru trails where at times we were the only ones on and what views we had.  This is a tour NOT to be missed.  I can't wait to get back and do another tour.
reviews/16/text: A great with Luisa and "John" in a full day tour to beautiful Sete Cidades. Sao Miguel is a beautiful island. Our tour guide Luisa and her expert knowledge and driving skills made our day very exciting. Thank you Luisa and "John"!!
reviews/17/text:
This tour was the highlight of my trip! Hugo, the tour guide was amazing! Very personable and helpful. 

The tour itself has hotel pickup and drop-off so it's stress free, breathtaking views, laid back so nothing feels rushed, everything you want in a tour. 

Definitely would recommend to anyone visiting Ponta delgada 😊
reviews/18/text:
We took the full day 4x4 tour of the Nordeste, the full day 4x4 tour of 
Sete Ciades, and the full day Furnas tour.  I would recommend them all. The 4x4 option is fantastic as you are able to go on backroads that the larger vans and buses cannot manage, and the smaller group is nice.  A native of Sao Miguel, our guide for all 3, Filipe, spoke Portuguese, Spanish, and English, and shifted seamlessly from one to the other as we spoke English, and others on the tour spoke Spanish.  He was knowledgeable about the entire island, its history and culture.  Moreover, he was very personable and accommodating, always displaying a terrific sense of humor and a love of his home and traditions.  Bring your cameras because the natural beauty of flowers (hydrangeas,ginger lilies everywhere),amazing vistas of ocean cliffs and volcanic lakes, as well as historic churches and quaint villages offer many photo ops.  Each area of the island is somewhat different, so if you have the time, do it all.  The Furnas tour offers the chance for a dip in the hot springs.  Be aware that you will come out with a coating of mustard colored film, but showers are available and our skin was noticeably softer after our dip.   The tropical gardens are beautiful and, although we had better meals while in Ponta Delgado, it was fun to try the stew (which was similar to our American pot roast) cooked in the thermal water. I would totally recommend this company, especially Filipe, as he was always punctual, cordial, and genuinely happy to share his island with us.
reviews/19/text:
We enjoyed two full day Jeep tours with this company. First day it was Nordeste, the greenest county of Sao Miguel. The route was beautiful and we stopped at several view points. We traveled in a group of four jeeps. Our Jeep was the smaller and older kind . The windows were a bit dirty and some did not open which interfered with taking pictures and adjusting the comfort of the journey. The lunch was very good and it was a part of the trip. Our guide was Louisa - very pleasant and energetic but it seems with a bit less experience than the other guides so she could give us less information and could not answer some questions but referred us at times to her colleagues.
The next day was full day Sete Cedades and it was a beautiful experience again including the good lunch. But we got the same Jeep and the windows still dirty and defective.
In spite of minor deficiencies I would confidently recommend this company as a choice for exploration of the island. Having an experienced knowledgeable guide also helps.
Next time we will perhaps look into their hiking trips.
subcategory_ranking: #16 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores

description: Sea Colors is a high quality operation dedicated to marine wildlife conservation. With spirit of mission we perform expeditions for observation and scientific research in the Azores, a mid-Atlantic wildlife treasure to be enjoyed, shared and protected, a vast number of species, all in a set of blue shades, the unique Azorean sea colors.
name: Sea Colors Azores
ranking: #19 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #19 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text: An incredible experience!  Great ride on little boat (for 12 people) and the opportunity to get closer to dolphins and whales than other big boats. A well-deserved 10/10!
reviews/1/text: Great place! As every whale/dolphin company claims but not deliver: these guys really care about the animals. Swimming with dolphin is possible, but only when they see the animals are at ease. Did a great trip on the ocean with them and experienced an unbelievable encounter of 6 spermwhales. Multiple breaches out of the water and up & close meeting the animals, swimming towards us, we got it all. I stuck my camera in the water and got these amazing shots. Oh, I forgot the 100 dolphins playing around our boat..
reviews/1/title: Wow is the only word that fits
reviews/2/text:
We did several trips over our week in Ponta Delgarda and this was definitely the best one.   If you want to do a whale and dolphin watching trip I would really suggest doing one with Sea Colours.   

We did the whole day trip that is a split of a sailing trip (with Paulo) and time on a rib (with Jasmine).   It was pretty calm on the day we went, so the sailing was a bit slow but it meant that the rib trip was fairly calm.   Obviously seeing anything from a boat under sail is pretty hit or miss (we saw a shy beaked whale from a distance, but not much else) but it was still enjoyable. On the day we went, a small group went sailing first and another group went on the rib first - we then met up at sea and swapped boats.  The advantage was that when we met up with the rib at lunchtime we were able to go straight to the area where Jasmine had seen whales that morning (and be the only boat there for quite a long time).  We saw sperm whales, Atlantic Spotted dolphins, Bottlenose dolphins and lots of playful Risso dolphins, and a couple of shark dorsal fins. While we did a full day trip, I think that the shorter half-day trip that they also do would also be an excellent experience.  

Jasmine was great at being in touch before our visit and we really liked the ethos of the company - these are people who do research about the whales and dolphins, and going with them funds this as it allows them to undertake research on the day of the trip (identifying which individual whales are seen) and provides revenue for their ongoing research. This is different from the other commercial boats.   If you are interested in supporting this work, and want to go on a trip with really lovely knowledgeable people then we would recommend this trip.   When we re-visit the Azores we will book with Sea Colours again and would genuinely recommend them to anyone visiting.
reviews/3/text:
We wanted to see whales in a respectful way and this tour did just that. 
We saw this company mentioned in a guide book, looked at recent reviews and emailed them.
Janice wrote a lengthy and informative reply and arranging the trip was easy. 
Janice gives a little talk at the beginning of the trip on land, you get kitted out with waterproof jacket and trousers and life jacket, dry bags are also available. 
Opportunity to use the bathrooms and off we went. It’s a small RIB and a max of 12 people so not crowded and excellent to be low in the water for great viewing of the wildlife.  Crashing through the waves was great fun as we went out to sea, everyone on the lookout for that first glimpse of whales. We were not disappointed. Around 8-9 sperm whale were lazing around, enjoying a Tues afternoon doing what whales do. We must have spent around an hour or so watching this group; the boat not getting too close, being respectful at all times and not cutting across the path of the whales. Plenty of opportunity to ask questions and take photos. Janice is very informed and you can tell the wildlife is her absolute passion. 
I would recommend this trip without hesitation to see whales   with a company that respects their habitat.
reviews/3/title: THE whale watching trip you should go on when in Sao Miguel
reviews/4/text:
Sea Colors is the only company you should consider going out with for dolphin / whale watching in Sao Miguel. 
We booked two trips with them because we were coming to the Azores specifically for cetaceans and they did not disappoint. In addition to taking us on two exceptional trips on which we saw sperm whales It’s also clear that this company is more ethical and conscious of the animals than others. We saw other boats drive directly in the path of the animals and sort of chase them down - this was not at all the vibe with Sea colors who were instead careful to give you an amazing view of the animals but also incredibly careful to give the animals space to exhibit their natural behaviours. I hope we come back to The Azores soon and go out with them again.
reviews/4/title: The best trip in Sao Miguel
reviews/5/text:
The whale watching experience with Sea Colours in Ponta Delgada was an amazing experience.
Sea Colours personnel is highly professional, nice and respectful.
Sea Colours differs from other whale watching services as the personnel is highly motivated and you can feel the passion for the sea and nature they are able to share.
During our whale watching, today almost 9 sperm whales altogether, Sea Colours has always been very respectful of the sailing rules sailing at very low speed near the coast and always respecting the whales keeping the appropriate distance.
Before boarding the rubber boat you are provided with water proof trousers, jacket and bag in addition to the life vest.
Sea Colours does not use big boats with many passengers on board but only rubber boats with a limited number (max12) which is the best way to fully appreciate the experience respecting the whales.
Super recommended. If you are in Ponta Delgada you can't miss the Sea Colours whale watching experience!
reviews/5/title: Recommended experience in full respect of whales and sea
reviews/6/text:
Absolutely amazing experience. We were on the sea for about 2.5-3h. We saw many whales. Jasmine went as close as she could and had the opportunity to make an amazing underwater video with my gopro. 
Once we were all happy with the whales, we went for dolphins which was also incredible. 
With Jasmine instructions, we had the chance to swim with them for a couple of min. 
They were very informative before, after and during our trip. 
Thank you Sea Color Azores.
reviews/7/text:
Absolutely incredible experience, we went out for a full day expedition and came across tons of spotted dolphins and about 10-12 sperm whales. The highlight of the day was the two young sperm whales which were playing and Jasmine managed to get the boat up really close, I’d say about 15 meters away, truly amazing to be able to see them this close and in such a respectful/sustainable way.

I highly recommend this organisation if you want to go whale/dolphin watching in the Azores.
reviews/8/text: Our family had a great day thanks to Jasmine and her crew. The kids absolutely loved to spend time with a large group of dolphins and to see the sperm whales. Higlhly recommended!
reviews/9/text: Very devoted people, we've done many whale watching trips so far, this was one of the best, saw a large group of sperm whales, spent a lot of time observing them close up, what an experience!, on the way back we stopped for several groups of dolphins, even though the sea was quite rough, Jasmine managed to make it a smooth ride, thanks for that :-) small group, highly recommended!
reviews/9/title: Great and very personal whale watching experience on Sao Miguel
reviews/10/text: Superb experience, 10/10. Jasmine and her partner Paolo made our day unforgettable - we saw three species of dolphins and multiple sperm whales. Thanks a lot for your dedication
reviews/11/text: This was already my second time with Jasmin and her husband and I (again!) absolutely loved the trip. In the beginning there’s a short introduction and then we hopped onto the speed boat. You can clearly tell that Jasmin’s motivation is not about making business, but to give people an understanding of what’s going on in the ocean and how beautiful it is - her passion definitely made me come back (and recommend her to friends visiting the Azores in August). Unlike bigger companies Jasmin and her husband have a speedboat - this way it’s easier to react, the boat can move closer to the animals and generally you are closer to the animals. We saw plenty of dolphins and even some turtles.
reviews/12/text: We had a great trip with Sea Colors, seeing bottlenose dolphins, a sperm whale and fin whales. Really informative, careful and considerate crew. The boat itself is a really fun ride regardless of whether you see anything. Recommended!
reviews/13/text:
Booked this trip to celebrate a special birthday. We really hoped to find whales, although we knew October would make it more difficult than the summer months.
Capt. Paulo and Jasmine were the perfect hosts. Totally dedicated to the cetaceans, and their environment.
We traveled quite a way, eventually finding dolphins. They were happy to swim along with the boat. 
We were on our way back to base when they received a radio message that whales had been spotted, almost where we had just come from. They turned around and we went back out to sea.
They found a number of Sperm whales and a Fin whale (2nd largest animal on the planet!).
Their dedication is unbelievable. Our 3 hour trip turned into almost 5 1/2 hours.
If you want to see these creatures, you should find Sea Colours in the Marina. They never give up!
reviews/14/text:
Whilst we had to appreciate that our ticket did not guarantee any sightings where nature is in control, due to the dedication, passion and commitment of Captain Paulo/Jasmine, we were treated to sightings of Sperm & Fin whales plus the usual array of dolphins.
The white knuckle return trip was also a great end to a fantastic experience.
reviews/15/text: Such an informative host, all felt very safe and respectful of the sea and it's animals. We went in September and saw lots of common and spotted dolphins, was absolutely amazing, so close to the boat having fun! Unfortunately no whales but perhaps next time, is the way of things!
reviews/16/text:
Doing the Whale Watching with Sea Colors Azores is just great! I have done two tours, each of them absolutely fantastic and unforgettable. 

Reasons for Sea Colors:
1. Respect for the animals: they do they tours with respect to the animals and they shall not be disturbed during the tour
2. intense experience: respect for the animals and having an intense experience is not a conflicting target. I had very good views and various animals
3. Speed Boat: You do the tour with a speed boat. So you are quickly at the animals and the Ride is just fun!
4. Sea Colors Team: The Team of Sea Colors are very nice People and you feel really good with them. Furthermore they are very qualified and motivated - they are really happy to answer all your questions and to shape you a wonderful experience.

I would always do the tour again with Sea Colors. And for sure: when I come back to São Miguel, the tour is a mandatory point on my holiday checklist. 😊
reviews/17/text:
Awesome experience, twice to date. Sperm whales, Bryde whale, dolphins, turtles and jamantas. Fantastic staff, super devoted and professional. 
Small semi-rigid boat takes you closer to the action, allways respecting the wild beautiful beasts.
reviews/18/text:
The best dophin- and whalespotting tour in Ponta Delgada! Be sure to take this tour! So much better than all these large vessels with their commercial tours.

This tour takes you on a small RIB out on the ocean up close to the animals with a crew that know everything there is to know about the animals. The pride, passion and joy they show  about the sealife is intoxicating.

We have taken whale- and dolphin watching trips on many locations and lots of companies, but we never have had such an amazing time as with Sea Colors Azores.

So if you love spotting animals up close, put on your swimsuit and book with them. You will not regret it. 
Oh, and the hispeed sailing on the RIB out on the ocean is a blast on its own!
reviews/19/text: The boat is a two-row forward-straddle type of zodiac which is much better than being on one of those bigger boats with 50+ people on board and obnoxious megaphone interpretation. The staff at Sea Colors is out there conducting research while you enjoy the views, the marine life, and the interpretation offered by the staff on board who are very knowledgeable and actually respect the wildlife that they encounter. The best example of this is when we saw a whale while there were many other big tourist boats all around also watching the whale. When the whale went under for a good amount of time, the other boats were bored with it, got a radio call to another whale sighting and all rushed away. The staff at Sea Colors knew this type of whale and said that we should stick around, even though all the other boats left, because it would likely come back up. Sure enough, we had a far more spectacular viewing of the whale a few minutes later all by ourselves when it returned. It pays off to book with a good, honest company. Thanks Sea Colors Expeditions!

description: Season Challenge is a Padi 5 * Dive Resort located in Ponta Delgada on the island of São Miguel - Azores whose main activities are Diving School with daily fun dive trips, offshore dives, manta dives, try dives, PADI Courses from beginner to Pro, Snorkeling Tours, city-walk, van tours and hiking guided tours. Dive in the Azores is a unique experience and a truly place at the top of the list of world dive destinations. An unspoiled paradise in the Atlantic with spectacular volcanic landscape, whales, dolphins and great diving! Due to its location the Azores has an abundance of life and a combination of local sites and offshore sites. Local sites have interesting underwater rock formations with plentiful marine life, offshore sites have diving in the blue and virtually guaranteed manta rays. Season Challenge has the best entertainment offers for your holiday! Visit us!
name: Season Challenge Azores Islands Diving Center
photo/caption:
Amazing dives
⚓Underwater Adventures
⭐PADI 5* Dive Resort
👉🏻#seasonchallenge

ranking: #17 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
ranking_subcategory: #17 of 135 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Azores
reviews/0/text: We have done several dives and specialty courses with them. They have been highly professional and fun to dive with. We have learned so many things with them that we look forward to doing our next specialty course with Season Challenge. Especially, Veronika has been an amazing instructor, detailed oriented, and thorough in her explanations and practices. Enjoyed every dive! Totally recommended
reviews/1/text:
Great scuba experience. We were very well received, all information was well explained, dive instructors were super friendly and professional. We loved the fact that we were able to dive in a small group and that the instructor noticed who needed some more attention, dividing the groups accordingly. The dives were well explained, equipment was good and we were lucky enough that our guide spotted some dolphins on the way in. He took to time to stop the boat and watch them, and did not hurry to get to the dive sites. 

Overall a great experience, thank you so much!
reviews/1/title: Great scuba experience, would highly recommend
reviews/2/text: These guys give their customers so much attention.  We popped in to register the day before our diving started,  which I find is always received well by dive resorts.  Many people want the personal touch and look for a cheaper dive outfit,  I always look for an IDC centre and Seasons Challenge far exceeded my expectations of a PADI IDC who takes divers out with their students, Instructors and Divematers. Seasons challenge puts their drivers safety first,  and don't just try get a student their certification. They spent a lot of time with my fiance and didn't hesitate to ask her to get more water time and learn her gear before doing her deep dive. An amazing team and they're losing 2 great instructors and dive guides when Alberto and Maria move on.
reviews/2/title: Well organised, professional and responsible customer care
reviews/3/text:
Highly recommend. Very professionell.
Fantastic customer service.
Well organised. 
Each member of their team see's the needs of each diver individually. 
Very care-taking behaviour. 
Loved diving with them.
reviews/4/text: Fantastic Instructors. I felt very safe and cared for. Super support. I am not very experienced and felt well instructed, guided and watched. All the crew and office staff excellent and easy to deal with.
reviews/5/text: The staff was very professional and friendly. They answered all my questions and helped me with all the extra things. The dives were excellent and carried out professionally and relaxed. I would, once again, like to thank the amazing instructors, especially my instructor Albert!
reviews/6/text: Amazing dive experience with Season Challenge! Incredibly professional staff and very well maintained equipment. Felt very safe and taken care of the entire dive. Our Divemaster walked us through everything and made sure to check up on us throughout our dive. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to dive in Sao Miguel!
reviews/7/text:
Good gear, awesome instructors. I highly recommend!
I've been with them for 14 dives and everything was really good. Nothing to complain about
reviews/8/text: Very well organized dive center, the dive guides were really nice, providing us with beautiful and above all safe dives, and the captain was also amazing
reviews/9/text: Impccable staff, Rodrigo, Maria and Ivan were very kind, very modern suits and equipment, saw a lot of dive sites
reviews/10/text: Very well organized dive shop. Great guide showing us so many interesting things. Beautiful dive spots.
reviews/11/text: I have done three dives with them. They are real friendly. Know wat they are doing and keep you save.
reviews/12/text: Went on 2 dives today with Rodrigo. He’s an excellent dive master and gave us a wonderful experience, making us feel calm and in good hands. One dive was exploring a giant sunken tanker. Saw some cool marine life such barracuda, parrot fish, grouper, hermit crab. Would highly recommend.
reviews/13/text: We did 2 dives with Roderico. He was a great instructor and guide. Knows a lot about the marine life. He explained about the ship wrack. Thanks a lot for this experiance.
reviews/14/text: I got my Padi at the Season Challenge and dit some funn diving and it was a great experience. All the divers are very accurate and Maria learned me everything about diving in such a calm and clear way. I really really recommand this diving center!
reviews/14/title: A really really great diving center
reviews/15/text: It was our first diving experience. Maria was very kind and patient and tought us a lot about diving. We had an awesome experience we will never forget.
reviews/16/text: I have had an amazing diving experience last June at Season Challenge. Together with my diving instructor Rodrigo and another buddy, we made two incredible dives. One of which was an wreck dive where we saw octopus and other amazing seacreatures. Rodrigo was very pleasant, took it slow and took care of a very relaxed atmosphere both on the surface and underwater. Other than Rodrigo, the captain of the speedboat took good care of us and the equipment. Both Rodrigo and the captain took pictures of us with (underwater)cameras, which is so special to have. All together I would for sure recommend making a dive with this diving centre, cant leave the Azores without seeing what it has to offer below the surface!
reviews/17/text: We did two fun dives here, one of them to the amazing ship wreck Dori. Nice and experienced guides, great equipment and small dive groups. Would like to dive here again.
reviews/17/title: Great dives - recommend to dive here
reviews/18/text:
Absolutely horrendous customer service. I'm shocked at how highly rated this place is.

I knew I was coming to the Azores weeks before I wanted to dive so I emailed this company and also called both numbers on their website and also whatsapped the same numbers. Absolute no response even though they were read. When I first arrived in ponta delgada I went straight to the dive shop to find out why no contact and to see when I could dive. The next three days were booked up even though I tried weeks in advance to arrange but like I said I was ignored. I was given no explanation of why I was ignored. I was given a potential date of when I could dive towards the end of my trip and the representative gave me his email and and said email him to confirm (Alberto). Emailed twice and didn't get a response.

Shame on you. Waste of time and space. 

There are more friendly dive shops next door to them FYI.
reviews/18/title: Ignorant company. They think because they're the best rate they can ignore your enquiries and also ignore you in person
reviews/19/text: I did the try dive and I felt safe and comfortable with the instructor from the first moment on. We were diving for almost an hour and saw some colourful fish and more fascinating underwater life. Would definitely recommend!

description: AzorBus is a creative and innovative company that offers Tourism Activities, providing the knowledge of the History, Culture and Nature of Terceira Island. AzorBus primary service is its city circuit in Angra do Heroísmo, where it uses a panaramic open Mini Bus with audio-guide system, in the following languages: Portuguese; English; French; German; and Spanish.
name: AzorBus Terceira Tours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Historical Sightseeing Tour in Angra do Heroismo
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Algar do Carvão - The caves tour
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Terceira Island Best viewpoints Tour (half day)
offer_group/offer_list/3/title: Full Day Tour - The best of Terceira Island
offer_group/offer_list/4/title: Full day Tour - Terceira Island Gastronomy
reviews/0/text: An unforgettable experience, the guide very well disposed an amazing person very funny that made the experience much more interesting. Beautiful landscapes and the unique experience of seeing inside a volcano.
reviews/0/title: Visita ao Algar do Carvão, Ilha Terceira
reviews/1/text: Our tour was so interesting and fun.  Going to the center of the island and experiencing volcano history is very special.  Our guide, Filipe was so friendly, knowledgeable, professional and fun.   So thankful for the opportunity to learned about his beloved island from him.  It was all enchanting.
reviews/1/title: Great experience and learned so much!
reviews/2/text: Our family of older adult children really enjoyed our very informative private tour! Thank you for a delicious lunch..
reviews/3/text: Filipe  our tour guide and owner of company was an exceptional guide. He is so knowledgeable of the history of the island and not in a tourist focused way, it is presented as a very proud Azorian and resident of Terceira, with factual information, comedy and heart. We would reccommend booking the full day tour, the island makes so much sense afterwords. We were here for a week already before the tour and so many questions got answered.
reviews/4/text: Get to know the best of the Azores’ Terceira Island as you embark on a sightseeing tour by bus. Board your open-air vehicle and drive to several points of interest including the
reviews/5/text: Our 3hour tour and tour guide was amazing!  This Exceeded our expectations!  Filipe made it fun for the kids and kept them extremely interested! He was so knowledgeable about the geography of the volcanoes and the history!  The delicious ice cream stop topped it off! I would recommend this tour to all!
reviews/6/text: It was an amazing experience with Filipe. He is able to combine historical/cultural knowledge along with geniality. For sure the best option to see Terceira island.
reviews/7/text: Our guide for the day was very knowledgeable about the history of the island. Our family had a great time and highly recommend Azorbus tours..
reviews/8/text: We had a wonderful tour of the island. Sightseeing and enjoying a Gastronomy adventure! Each place was better! TY! F&F!
reviews/9/text: Filipe was a great guide and driver. He was very knowledgeable and I would highly recommend him for any tour you would like to do in Terceira. Two couples did two half day tours with him.
reviews/9/title: Terceira Caves, Volcano and Scenic view tour
reviews/10/text: Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Tour guide very, very knowledgeable, friendly and courteous! We had a great morning and experience.
reviews/11/text: We did the full day Terceira Island Gastronomic Tour with Filipe. This was likely the highlight of our trip. Filipe was a wonderful person who taught us about Terceira's rich history and each stop was well thought out. We went to local businesses and restaurants all over the island. The food was amazing! We had local cheeses, Terceira specialties from the sea and land, wines, and ice cream! In between we also stopped at points of interest which helped us to plan where to go on our free days as well! A truly worthwhile, personalized introduction to the Azores and Terceira!
reviews/11/title: Terceira Island Gastronomic Tour - A day of History, Good Food, and Wine!
reviews/12/text: Filipe is an most entertaining and knowledgeable guide - he made this island come alive with stories of its colourful history.  He ensured the tour matched our interests showing us the beautiful countryside as well as the coast, explaining the traditions, especially around the lovely Imperios.  A wonderful lunch of local Alcatra stew made this tour complete.  Brilliant.  Thank you Filipe - see you next year !
reviews/13/text: We did the culinary island tour with Felipe on a Sunday. He went out of his way to show us the most amazing spots on the island although the itinerary had some challenges due to bad weather (empty fresh fish department due to storm hence no boats going out) though the itinerary was amended slightly all aspects were honoured in a slightly different setting. As the winery was closed, we tried local wines during the other stops and saw the vineyards from the car (as it was raining heavily) Very kind, informative guide, thanks again for spending the day with us!
reviews/13/title: Lovely combi of delicious food, good company and beautiful sights
reviews/14/text: We booked a whole day tour with caves visit. Started in Angra do Heroismo, sightseeing points, monumenta, beautiful bays. The guide told us a lot characteristics, history and about nature. We had lunch with the see view of Praia da Vitoria. We visited inland, Duck pond and two caves. For the end we went to taste lokal cheese and wine.
reviews/15/text: We make a point of taking a bus tour on arrival at a new city/country to quickly get an overview and understand the culture and history. We booked with Phillip and he did not disappoint. The bus had a mechanical issue so Phillip the company owner took us on a private tour in his comfortable SUV. He has great knowledge of the island’s political and military history shared through engaging stories of past Kings, battles, victories with mainland Portugal and Spain at beautiful viewpoints often by a statue of a past monarch. Mt Brasil, the Fort, and churches come to life as does the past earthquake and volcanic eruption. Any personal interests you have are richly explained. Highly recommended!! Thank you Phillip.
reviews/16/text: Excellent tour and island overview with great historical explanation and tasty lunch of regional traditional dishes
reviews/16/title: Great overview of the island, a lot of historical explanation and tasty traditional lunch
reviews/17/text: We had a phenomenal time on the Caves tour with AzorBus! We were taken to a Lava tube called Gruta do Natal (Christmas Cave), and then to Algar do Carvão, a volcano vent. Our tour guide Philippe was very informative. Exploring actual volcano caves was awesome!
reviews/18/text: Absolute fantastic service by Filipe. He is professional, courteous and very informative. He provided us various local tips to enhance our experience.
reviews/18/title: Absolute fantastic service by Filipe. Strongly recommended!
reviews/19/text:
We only had one afternoon to know the island and the weather was uncertain, so we took a car trip with a couple of extremely friendly "Azorbus city tours" guides.
They let us know the history of the island, took us to the most emblematic places, showed us beautiful landscapes. 
They were fantastic. 
I highly recommend it.
