reviews/0/text: A nice 20-30 minute hike leading to arguably the best views on Sao Miguel island. Likely this is the very spot you see in your image search of the Azores. The hike begins very flat up to near the end when there is an incline up to the summit. Very doable for all, a light hike on paved roads to start then gets a bit tougher once you get onto the hill. We used hiking poles and they were a bit helpful for the steeper areas but definitely doable without them. The summit does get cloudy often, and it would be of value to wait 30 minutes and see if the sights improve. There may be some spots to sit to the left of the banister at the top. You may want to consider coming here earlier in the week so you can opt to go a second time if the conditions are not clear at the top. If you found this to be helpful, please indicate below so I know where to focus my future review efforts!
reviews/0/title: This hike leads to the instagram-worthy highlight of your trip (weather permitting)
reviews/1/text: Fantastic viewpoint with stunning views! We had no problem with parking, maybe because it was November. The weather cooperated -- no issue with fog or clouds. The trail to the viewpoint isn't too difficult.
reviews/2/text: This was by far the best view on the island.  You have to work for this view but the payoff is worth the effort.
reviews/3/text: Breathtaking view, forecast was rain%60 but when we got to the point, sun came out and we had amazing view of the Santiago lake in front of us. Be there early and wait few minutes or 1/2 hour if it's a foggy day. Weather changes quickly. If you don't have a car, like us, take a taxi from Ponte Delgada, $20, at 9:00 then walk around the lake from another walking distance parking lot to the Sete Cidades. Last bus leaves at 4:30. Excellent hike, not easy though, you will have great view of the Blue/Green lakes as well.
reviews/4/text: even if you come up and the weather is bad, just wait 30 minutes, the weather changes so rapidly that you might be able to see the view ! so don't give up !
reviews/5/text: There is a bit of a walk to get here but it is not difficult.  Enough so that many people to not get here but if I were advising a friend coming to the island, I would tell them to absolutely come to this miradouro.  Unfortunately being able to see the crater well is subject to weather and in our five weeks on the island in April and May, there were very few clear days to get the best views.  Not sure what that looks like though in the summer as it sounds like there are a few less cloudy days at that time.  The view here is spectacular - not too many places better.
reviews/5/title: The BEST miradouro in Sete Cidades area
reviews/6/text: Given the trade winds and hilltop location of this, dress warm as it can get quite chilly. Viewpoint is breathtaking.
reviews/7/text: This is the best overall viewpoint on the island. It can get crowded and clear skies are a must - so chase the weather and get here early or later in the day to get a more peaceful moment.
reviews/7/title: Leave the Self Stick at Home
reviews/8/text: To reach the Boca do Inferno view its necessary to walk on a trail. Bring your trainers and comfy clothes. Its totally worth it (and its windy)
reviews/9/text:
If you have to do one view on this trip (and you should do as many as possible - the island is beautiful!) then it's this one.

A tip if you're doing this and the other nearby attractions (the view point to the west, Miradouro da Vista do Rei, and also the Sete Cidades town by the lake) on foot if you are being dropped off by a taxi - there are no hiking routes north or east round the lake from this point (from what we could tell) so you need to walk along the road going west. You can walk by the side of the road in the first half, then the rest is on the road itself - it's wide enough to walk along and we found the road to be fairly quiet, but of course, be cautious all the same.

There are great views along the way but consider a tour or going by car if you are expecting a dedicated trail between these two viewpoints!
reviews/9/title: Essential - but some advice if you're exploring the lakes on foot
reviews/10/text: Great view over the craters and lagoons. Excellent view point setting, easy to park and spend a little time to enjoy the surroundings. You have to hike a little bit to get here, but it's absolutely worth the effort!
reviews/10/title: Great views - not to be missed!
reviews/11/text: Go in the morning for best photographs and to get ahead of most visitors (sun at back). If you can't walk very far or are short of time, don't park in the parking lot by the main road. If the gate is open, drive in and follow the dirt road that everyone is hiking along to the very base of the ridge where the trail goes uphill to the actual "miradouro"/viewpoint. There is room for several cars there. The view is amazing. If you have bad knees, bring trekking poles. It's about 5 minutes uphill to the viewpoint, depending on your uphill capability.
reviews/12/text: The view from the viewpoint is spectacular.  The trail is very easy to navigate, and well worth the leisurely hike to the viewpoint.  In fact, there are several other outstanding sights to see within a relatively short drive.
reviews/13/text:
First of all, read the other reviews about how you can park closer to the start of the trail (down the brown dirt road).

Second, it you get there and it's a bit cloudy, stay awhile and hope the clouds pass.  Or do what we did, drive down to Vista do Rei and when the skies begin to clear, go back to Boca do Inferno.   It's really not that long of a hike to the viewpoint, if you park in the closer parking lot.

This viewpoint is the image that first got me interested in going to the Azores.  It was surreal being there in person!

Make sure you plan enough days on Sao Miguel to get to see Sete Cidades and Lagoa do Fogo on clear days or at least semi clear days.   Going to this island and not seeing these places would mean that you missed out on the best sights.
reviews/14/text:
We have seen pictures and videos of this place many times before and we thought: this is the demo version. But once we got there, the place was as incredible as expected!
From the main road, it takes about 45 mins to reach this spot and then you need to get back. The hike is trivial. The weather is changing very fast and from a perfectly nice weather you can get to no visibility within minutes. Second time we visited the place we could not see anything!
reviews/15/text:
The Boca do Inferno viewpoint offers a fantastic view of the caldera lakes surrounding Sete Ciades. We went in late afternoon as part of a tour and there were a lot of other people hiking to the viewpoint. It wasn't overwhelming, but it was busy for Sao Miguel. We're used to it being quite quiet and chill in Sao Miguel. 

Despite the other tourists, the views were well worth it. On a clear day, you can see the different colors of the lakes. 

The hike from the parking lot was mostly flat with some uneven "steps".
reviews/16/text: I went there, out of the tourism peak and still the view point was full of people...the view point is AWESOME but try to go there very early on the morning so you can get all for yourself, the view the silence the tranquility will payoff those less sleep hours...you can go by car almost to the view point, but please don’t, you will ruin the walk for the people that goes walking from the road...always moving from the cars... :( very annoying. The walk is easy, you have only a small hill to climb at the end, other than that enjoy a good walk for the extraordinary forest...
reviews/16/title: Becoming a overwhelmed by tourists but still a must go
reviews/17/text: We loved this hike (mostly flat, some hills and stairs) to an incredible viewpoint to see multiple sparkling lakes below. You can drive down the dirt road or park above. We were worried about getting stuck because it was raining.  Must see this viewpoint during your stay!!
reviews/18/text: There is legend of princess and poor shepherd, about forbidden love and tears that created one of the most beautiful sights on Azores archipelago. Landscape of lakes nestled in extinct volcano crater and mayby seven cities hidden under water is doubtlessly one of the most visited place by travellers. Miradouro located on fabulous spot on top of the hill offers incredible panoramic view over the ring shaped crater of Lagoa de Santiago and  the hole caldeira as well. Really postcard scene! That is why this place is called the most beautiful view on Azores and it is probaly true!
reviews/19/text: We visited the Boca do Inferno viewpoint as part of a guided hike in Sete Cidades. We were fortunate to have visited the viewpoint on a clear day. The views and overall experience were amazing and I would say even better than the photos you see across the Internet.
reviews/19/title: Even better than the photos you see on the Internet
